2-qYgctSk4ZKg_b706hycw.text: Nice, mellow spot for some quick pho. I order the veggie pho and it's full of veggies. The spring rolls are great too. The lady who works there is very nice and always greets me with a smile.

EejmdVcQqoh9RCmne5KCEA.text: I went here to actual dine in the restaurant and I was so disappointed. Upon walking in, the restaurant smelled like bleach of some sort and was strong. We ordered the Beef Pho, Nem Nuong Spring Rolls, Banh Xeo and Beef Fried Rice. All were below average, I would not eat here again ever! I'd rather take the extra time to drive to Chinatown for better food and better prices. The Beef Pho was barely warm, the broth tasted sour and the meat was clearly frozen. The Nem Nuong Spring Rolls were sad and disgusting, I mean, the meat looked like it was from years ago, the coloring was way off and it did not taste or look right. The Banh Xeo was a joke, it came out looking greasy and it had a weird sour taste to it. The only thing that was kind of average was the beef fried rice and that was it, only because it's rice! The beef was ok as it had flavor and was a little tender. This is not the right standard for Vietnamese food and I don't trust that their food is fresh. Never Again!

zrEx_ULc9ZsIlH9aVULBaA.text: Probably the restaurant I frequent the most in Las Vegas. Very good pho, the other stuff is probably just as good. I've only tried pho at a couple other places in town but it's never come close to the quality at Lemongrass. It's pretty clean for what clearly used to be a traditional American diner that only received some minor redecoration. I always get the large 39 (Rare Beef Pho) and it's never done me wrong, in spite of the changes to management. Keep up the good work!

UZDNiXPzU_yYBjxno1U3-A.text: New ownership but the Pho soup tastes even better. If you don't want Pho, try thier Bun.

_km4UeTN9IfwMnOBoCg3pw.text: I have experienced the deliciousness of Lemongrass Cafe many times and I never  walk away disappointed. Although it's located inside a 50's diner, that should not deter you from enjoying the incredible food. The smell of the food being cooked when you first walk in, is enough to convince you that this place does it right.  I first heard about Lemongrass in a review in the Las Vegas Weekly magazine and instantly wanted to try it. Ever since my trip to Germany last year, I've wanted to find a place here that has amazing Pho. What is funny is that out of the many times I have eaten at Lemongrass, I have only had their Pho once. It's not to say that their Pho isn't good, it's I have found their Bun Cha Gio Chay to be absolutely amazing. This dish is my dish whenever I come here, which can be a bad thing since I so torn between it and trying something new. They must put something amazing in those vegetarian eggrolls because you will be wanting more just after one bite.   Their menu is quite extensive and I sure even the pickiest eater can find something to eat. Whether you are a carnivore to vegetarian there is something for everyone here. One other wonderful thing about Lemongrass is the complimentary hot or iced Jasmine tea. Although most might not enjoy the unsweetened taste of jasmine tea, I always order this to go along with food. Very few restaurants offer tea for free so this automatic gold stars in my book.  Food:   Bun Cha Gio Chay is a rice vermicelli noodle dish with shredded lettuce, basil, cucumber, bean sprouts, peanuts, and a garlic sauce with shredded carrots. You can order this dish any number of ways with or without meat as well as with or without eggrolls. I always order the one with the vegetarian eggrolls and you would never know that this is absolutely no meat in these. It is a simple dish that was a little deceptive at first. My very first bite I thought it was just ok but as you continue to eat it gets better and better until you are hooked.  Pho Ga is their chicken pho and this dish I have only tried as take out. The broth was fragrant and not heavy at all. When adding the sides of bean sprouts, lime, basil, jalapenos, and other herbs, it all balanced well with the beef broth. They do not skimp on the added condiments of the soup(had enough left over it actual make a dish but had no clue as to what to make), but as far as the chicken I was a little disappointed on the amount given. The Pho was wonderful and I will definitely order it when I am not taking it as take out.   Vegetarian Eggrolls are magical! This was a side order to the Pho as take out and they were no different than if I was sitting in the restaurant. These fried, crispy   pieces of goodness are filled with tofu, clear noodles, taro, jicama, carrot, white onion, black mushrooms, and served with garlic soy sauce. I have to have these every time I go to Lemongrass. They are a must and are the best eggrolls I have ever had.

-imaI-3IVjge4KWJJTOYjw.text: Ooooh Lemongrass...I have been here enough times to say, I will never go back. Something about this place rubs me the wrong way, don't get me the wrong the 60s diner feel is kinda funky, actually kind a cool. What bothers me about this place the most is the constant foul smell of sewage coming from god knows where (I'm guessing the kitchen). This has been the third time that the whole dining area has a strong smell of garbage.   Today was the icing on the cake. I went here with some coworkers for lunch, upon ordering the server gave my two Asian friends chopsticks and my friend and I forks...seriously?! I think I just got racially profiled. :/ It is a pet peeve of mine when servers give non-Asians (btw, I'm happa) forks in a Asian restaurant. You can see why it hit a little close to home for me.   The food is meh, the service is nothing to write home about. You are better off going across the street to Saigon 8 any day.   I just don't get it...

JIofpZdtz-xdN7gz4ngzIQ.text: Loved it here. My mom is a loyal customer from here. It's a pretty chill & quiet place to eat. Food is pretty good & their customer service were great. Will be back soon!

OXiFxj-_2zN4N_AoJNNOsw.text: Love this place. Really old but still good. My parents loves eating here. Service and food is good. It's because of their egg rolls that I always have to order egg rolls at Asian Restaurant. There entrees are filling. I would suggest for people to try it.

0rFzbO6UdUiD05xvXwg9nQ.text: I'm writing this 5-star review based on the pho alone. I've eaten the pho at many of the Vietnamese restaurants around Las Vegas and somehow Lemongrass is still home to the best pho I've had in the city. Even the popular joint Pho Kim Long's pho is nowhere close. Lemongrass's wonderfully hot tasty broth, the texture of the beef, the freshness of the green herbs, and the slick noodles are still tops all around. I hope they keep it up!

oFu-YxNJbWOvRqMJz3MA8Q.text: A friend suggested to meet for lunch at the Lemongrass! I was not disappointed! With nearly 3 Vietnamese restaurants nearby - one of which I had already been - I thought Lemongrass was far superior! The  staff is friendly, the dining room clean and the food delicious! The price is right too! If you're looking for a great, healthy, affordable meal I'd highly recommend Lemongrass!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemongrass Beef w/ spring roll!

UMFTpfYDLkPflU1BQF-uzQ.text: Pho soup is not that tasty compare to the one i always go! The service is not that bad! The price is too much for the taste!  A few cup of beef pride rice is way too expensive for $9.00 wow! Would not go back there! I spend about $60 dollars for 2 large soup thats almost taste like water and salt,1 beefpriderice,2 charlbroild fork that really tin and tiny! 1 can of coke that was accidentally spilled and was not replaced!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too pricey!!!

UqVMcoKuzL3s_8f4Kaux-A.text: I thought this place was very good. It's one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in henderson. They are friendly, very quick , and the do have staff that speak English so we aren't playing the game where I just have to point to the menu and hope that what I'm being served is going to taste good. The pho is awesome and so are the spring rolls and every different kind bahn mi sandwhich. They are fresher than the other Vietnamese places in the area and don't used processed meats. I love it. They never answer the phone , when I'm trying to order ahead. They are super!!!

7cgFi8b5XtdrdnjVlbOZYw.text: Granted I was the first person there, I always get the pho tai and vietnamese restaurants and this one was A-ok.. service was great though!

-9eAbq5iRwLScmd1ZILeiA.text: Use to love  this place when the other guy server was there and the older lady is there I believe  it's her place after experience  I had  tonight I will never return rude service did not like what was ordered alway has veggies tonight it did not but told if I order a different  one it would that's the same price mine you I asked well can I get veggies  since it's the same price no diffrent just veggies in I was told it would be two dollars more really  try to rip me off the veggie soup I took one bite of was made with beef soup mix and tasted like old tofu took one bite and sent it back then they tried to charge me for it even though I did not eat it done never again will I return

owVpU5mC8cVdYwbb3IVLDw.text: Today I had a crazy craving for pho soup and my boyfriend and I had found lemongrass on yelp.   It was a cute diner and setting but definitely weird because I had eaten at the old place before it become lemongrass. But I was definitely satisfied with the layout.  My soup was just okay. I think what made it good was the tons if sauce I had to put in it. The main thing I was unsatisfied with was the service. We were greeted very rudely and never got checked up on. The restaurant only had maybe a couple more people in it and we had to wave down a waitress two times before finally getting refills.  Another thing I want to add was that my boyfriends dish tasted like shrimp when it was definitely a chicken dish. It was just very not appeasing to know that the same pans are used to cook different meats.  And the last thing that bothered me was a homeless women walked straight in to the restaurant and went to each table asking for money. I feel like the owners did nothing to stop this and I was just unhappy with my service overall. I don't think I'd go back here anytime soon. Next time I'll have to go down to Chinatown.

FY2MMmLuOYfZ9FVVOhMSfA.text: I have to admit, I was a little weary. Not only is this place formerly a 50's diner, but the people who first brought me here are not exactly savvy with Asian food. But I'm glad Lemongrass proved me wrong. They serve a number of delicious dishes. With over 100 items on the menu, here are a few of my favorite items on the menu:  -the Vietnamese coffee: a perfect blend of bitter and sweet. Once it's finished filtering into a cup with condensed milk, pour it over ice and enjoy. -Vermicelli with lemongrass beef and egg rolls: I love the combination of noodles, beef and crunchy egg rolls. Of course, you can't forget the flavorful fish sauce to pour over the bowl and/or dip your egg rolls. -the combination fried rice  Surprisingly, I don't usually get pho. As much as I've been here, I've probably ordered pho 10% of the time. This isn't any indication of their pho (it's actually pretty good), but instead it just shows how much I enjoy the other items on the menu. The owner is great, always friendly and accommodating. So don't let the diner exterior fool you. This place has the goods to satisfy your Vietnamese cravings

NhH9bQtMZvOYXn2qDx6WEw.text: PHO here is good, better than a few PHO places in OC.  I like their Ice Tea, it soothing taste and it's complementary.  Good service. I give 4 starts.

7YqplK9Oir3UBPl39z5QsQ.text: This place isnt good at! I got seafood pho and friend got chicken pho. Seafood pho had 3 shrimp, imitation crap meat and like 1-2 squid pieces. They cut the imitation crab meat in like big cubes. The middle of the crab cube was still frozen. My friends chicken was thin sliced chicken breast. It was flavorless and dry. Staff was somewhat rude and unwelcoming. Never coming back. Pho Saigon by LVAC from now on.

LbfU28g6ekiJTKDknmHjqw.text: I'm not a big pho fan, but I came here with a friend (WORLDS COLLIDE!) who was craving it, and she got her fill.  I ordered a rice plate with pork, which was very good, although served a little cold.  She gives it a 5, I give it a 3...we split the difference and arrive at a 4.  Groovy.  (It's already been mentioned before, but the '50s style decor is pretty awesome.)

EHmZU_ISSB_9yH3F5vg9jw.text: This 50's-looking diner-converted pho restaurant was the cool new kid on the block when I first discovered her.  The service was good and the broth delicious.  One of my favorite soups is their Bun Bo Hue / Spicy Beef Soup Hue-style.  If you like it red hot and flavorful, this is the bowl to challenge.  It always made me sweat. However, one of my all times favorite Vietnamese dishes is Bo Nhung Dam / Beef with Vinegar Broth.  It's rarely served in most Vietnamese restaurants and I used to always go with my family to share that dish.  Upon my last visit in June, they no longer served the original dipping sauce for that dish.  Big faux pas.  My disappointment brought on disgraceful service from the staff, so I don't think I'm welcome there anymore, lol.

qdqn_Q7fRbXypg3LFy09HA.text: I used to really like this spot. Pho was delicious. Last two times I went in it smelled horrible. Like funky toilet or bathroom smell. We walked out. Tried one more time a few weeks later and it still smelled bad so we ordered the food to go. Ate it and several hours later I was sick. Not sure what's happening over there but I won't be back I'm sad to say.

ZrijLObQYSzMeM__FHl7cA.text: It is so difficult to find vegetarian pho.  I was so excited when we found this place.  The restaurant is unexpected from the outside - looks like it used to be a Johnny Rockets.  If you are driving in expecting it to be one of the small shops you may be shocked at how you missed the huge silver building in the parking lot!  The food is incredible.  The pho exceeded our expectations and the lemongrass chili tofu was possibly one of the best Vietnamese dishes I've ever eaten.  Go there immediately!  It was slow on Sunday when we went - we were the only ones there and we were getting takeout.  Keep this place in business - it's awesome!!!

JYsSSrZ6VfbQZund05dd7Q.text: I have a love of Vietnamese food so I am probably really bias and I usually think anything even remotely Vietnamese is good.   Lets be honest... the service here is really awkward. Definitely not their strong suit. Servers are rushed, sort of pushy, the place seems to be run in a bit of a chaotic fashion. I ordered an iced tea. Never got it. Fine.  The food is pretty decent. It will definitely hit your Vietnamese craving, but it is not going to blow you out of the water. Bun was ok and a decent size, but lacking in flavor. Pho was a nice portion and had good flavor, but the veggie side could have been bigger and some of the meat was a bit questionable.   Overall a passable place that will suit a craving, but not amazing. Negative points for weird service and an even stranger ambiance in an old 50's diner.

8NP4w7jXfE3-5-h4uZjMNA.text: The service isn't always great to here a lot of the times you're waiting but the food is delicious I don't recommend getting the shrimp pho because the shrimp is over cook but the beef is delicious I get it every time and I would recommend that and continue to eat here because of it

jYwV2PiO7EvP_EIDEkJn_w.text: The best Pho and Bun in town. I have tried many Vietnamese restaurants, and every time I eat anywhere else I always think, " this isn't as good as Lemongrass."

S89tvBqco38w0V1_g4NMKw.text: Good customer service but I was a little disappointed because one of our dish came out mostly burnt that's the grilled pork chop. They didn't give us enough silverware we had to keep asking. Otherwise not bad

nRU4_nUO9Q0Al-FOEAeZbg.text: I've been here twice, and both times the service was terrible. It took 20 minutes to even get service. My pho came before my water and tea, and my water refill didn't come for 10 minutes. The small soup is extremely small. Pho mailan (close to this place) is way better, super fast, and the portions and veggies are much more plentiful. I will not be returning here.

EKWwOV3gj14yXKOsq4YMGw.text: Looks as though they could have taken over a 50's diner. So not what I was expecting a Vietnamese restaurant to look like. Hah. But the food was delicious! Got the rare steak and tendon pho. Broth is on point and the price is reasonable. Service was actually good too. The manager lady had a smile on her face and was attentive. So far this is the best I've had in town. Will definitely be going back.

r3FSNn_QpEMOUTZjY_GHfg.text: I just have to bump it up to 5 stars. Ive been back a handful of times since the first review and its always a great experience! The service is probably the best Ive ever gotten at any Asian restaurant EVER! And I can't get enough of that tasty pho! Freaking Love This Place!! lol

lHJswqk_zPBw_S176Wm73w.text: I've been waiting to go to this place for awhile. Most of the reviews are good so it was a must that i try it. I'm glad that i did cause the food was very good and the waiters were very helpful. My only complaint is that the need to update they're menu. They had rootbeer on the menu, so i ask for that and they turn around and reply "we don't have rootbeer.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pho

tIArnhPGNKE7VgB6MjzoNA.text: The food is good, but I think the business is starting to cut corners. Over the past few visits, we've noticed that the bowls of pho are not being filled. At first, we thought it was an oversight, but as weekly customers, we see this shorting every visit. We shouldn't have to ask for a full bowl every visit.  The menus are terribly out of date with many items crossed off or new prices penned in.  And the restaurant is just...dirty. There are stains and fingerprint everywhere, and the outside desperately needs basic landscaping maintenance.   This restaurant earned "Best of Vegas" in the past, but given the trend they're following, I think their days are numbered. Start looking for a new place for your pho fix.

EO3jh_4dusVQDpZBtfnoMA.text: I have eaten here the last 2 times I was in Vegas because it serves very good food. Unique restaurant because the setting is an old school American diner so you expect burger and fries, not Vietnamese food. I ordered their #68 which is their combo vermicelli with bbq pork, sausage and egg rolls. This will easily feed 2 people. It is light and tasty with great textures of noodles, veggies, meat and crispy egg rolls. The wifey got her typical veggie pho and loved it. We also ordered their veggie spring rolls. It was fresh and delicious. The Vietnamese iced coffee was too sweet. The whipped cream on top was regrettable. Great prices and service. A solid 4 stars.

phsyL3-hEzirJtZtjvEb7w.text: Typical Asian fare in a Vegas casino. It was good but nothing special.

6rIsGPqdxdlXWmNykQwsYw.text: Back in July 2010, I was looking for good "Pho" eats place off the Vegas strip and not on Spring. So the Fam and I found Lemongrass Cafe near a theater complex where we saw The Last Air Bender (for the kids).  We later tried the traditional Pho bowl (as pictured) and the broth and tenderness of the beef was decent. Being a diner, I almost wanted to order a cheese burger and onion rings - lol, give this place a try.  -FM

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Pho @ the Diner!

lRN3Dy9VwQn30X2Rm_lkpQ.text: Pretty cool place. I love that it's got the diner feel for a Pho restaurant. It's a good change of atmosphere since most Pho places are expected to kind of have the same look and feel all the time.  I do love love love their pho broth here. Something about it just has so much flavor in it! While I do have the tendency to get horrible service at most pho places, this place kind of went up and beyond. So up and beyond, that the service was a little too into my personal space. Our server did very little with the small talk, and did on the positive side check on our table often, but when he did come to our table to drop of our food he did take it upon himself to move my clutch purse himself to across the table. He also took the liberty of moving my soup spoon from one plate to the plate that I was eating in as I was eating. So I felt a little uncomfortable because it reminded me of my grandmother when she'd be all up in my personal space while I eat. Smothering me. Protecting me. Choking me. Oh..childhood flashbacks...  They give you a good amount of the helpings and meat in your pho for a really good price. I think pho prices run about $7.00 to $9.00. 'd also suggest to try their Vietnamese ice coffee too! It's super delish and full of flavor.

wH6Vtf0ZmsgZEihrFIbVcA.text: The food was good. But the service from the young boy was shitty and I kinda don't want to go back because of his attitude

zh-Uf3OPMNNqdfc_-UsS1g.text: Every time I come here I am welcomed with a smile and tasty food! I love their lemongrass chicken. Keep up the good work!

GxEegaUXB-2GlPbNmk84mQ.text: Food is always good, I always get the combination pho, and wife gets the chicken pho, always good. Sometimes service for refills can be a bit slow but not a deal breaker, would recommend.

XMJ-FQZzSxSsS47L3izksQ.text: Always good food and service. Wife had rare filet with pho and it was awesome. I had spring rolls and noodles with sausage and also very good. Cool restaurant with great food and service!!

YdJsp6TNY55z4Ld-KSsGjQ.text: Really love this place. Their vegitarian Pho is amazing. Tons of veges and the broth is delicious. #58 and #59 are my favs. Also the peanut sauce with the fresh spring rolls is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #6 Delicious eggrolls

amvNUEuzV2wAzv2rOEg5BA.text: Whenever I'm craving Vietnamese, this is my go to place. Their noodles are great, their egg rolls super yum. I usually get take out and have only eaten inside several times.   So why not a 5-star? Ambience inside is just okay, Service could be better when you eat here and the final reason is for the person who posted the pic of the worm. Kinda nasty, but I'll still come back.....probably because it didn't happen to me?  Just thinking about this place makes me say "yum, yum, yum", but I'll still always check my leafy greens for things that shouldn't be there

p2n1u9kA_qZKNh7Vp-OptA.text: Me and my boy man went in there on a weekday around 4.  I LOVE the look of the place. Their exterior and interior are a cute 50's diner style. Even the tables are arranged in a diner style. Super adorable.  When we went it there, it was dead empty. I guess we went in after lunch time. I was a bit skeptical about it but we were too hungry to care. We ordered pork sandwich, pho, and their lemongrass chicken with rice.   Sandwich :  bf says it used to be bigger. The taste was really good regardless. The bread was crunchy and soft, the relishes were tasty too. Nothing to complain there.  Pho: I mean...it's pho, it's alwaysdelicious. It wasn't like OH. MY. GOSH. SO GOOD, but it was good enough. Rare beef wasn't really pinky rare tho for my taste.  Lemongrass Chicken : HOT DAMN that thing is amazing. I loved the seasoning and spices of it. I can actually taste the freshly cooked lemongrass. Although I live no where near Las Vegas, next time I visit, I would go back for them chickenss.  How was the service?  it was satisfying. :D

Cb3R9240pt7dszdjoDhzNQ.text: One of the few Vietnamese restaurants I have come across in Vegas and I have to say it is decent enough for me to come back multiple times. I was thinking about giving this place 4 stars, but I have been spoiled with cheaper and tastier Vietnamese dishes back in Orange County.  My favorite dish would have to be the lemongrass beef rice plate with the egg cake and shredded pork that comes with rice and vegetables. Don't get the lemongrass beef dish that only comes with the meat and veggies because it is the same price, but you don't get a variety of items. I tried both and you don't get much more beef so just be aware of that. A few things I didn't like was the lack of pickled carrots and daikon that normally come with broken rice dishes and the weak tasting fish sauce. I literally had to use the whole bowl they gave to me to flavor my rice and it still wasn't enough. If you don't like fish sauce, then it shouldn't be a problem haha.  You can expect typical Asian service which means the workers don't have the best customer service. I was literally seated and handed a menu and the guy comes over less than a minute later asking me if I was ready to order when I was clearly still checking the stuff out. Then he never came back to check on my friend and I so I had to go to the front and ask for service. They don't really check up on you if you need a refill on your drink or when you are ready to pay the bill. If normally let these things slide since the food usually makes up for it. In this case however, I am desperate for Vietnamese food so I guess I'll lee coming back until I find a better place.  Oh yeah, don't get confused by the place if you are going to try it out for the first time. It literally looks like an American diner from the 60's. They should probably change it up a bit unless that's the look they are going for...

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemongrass beef with rice and some veggies

8lRISyC0T3DOo44HbbDvJg.text: Amazing pho broth. #40 is amazing! The chicken fried rice is exceptional, and the fried egg rolls are very tasty, as well. This place used to be a '50s diner, so the ambience doesn't quite match the venue...All the more reason to check this place out! You will definitely be happy with this place. I drive across town just to go here, and it's always worth it. Now that it's soup season, my family and i will be frequenting Lemongrass even more.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LiJifREOqhgyjkeFnh7lZA.text: First time eating here and must say we were not disappointed! Food was great and prices were very reasonable. Don't let the exterior of the restaurant fool you, it's a very cool place to have a hot bowl of Pho!

cFmd4XJ8gGj_R0H3EneOOA.text: I ordered from here twice this week. My husband got me some takeout on Sunday, and I came to get takeout on Tuesday. The lady who took my order was super rude (I believe she's the owner). I ordered an additional item as I was waiting for my food to be prepared and because I didn't have cash and the additional order came to about $4.00, she decided she would not process the order. The reason why they only take cash unless it's over $10.00 is due to merchant fees. It's simply the cost of doing business. There are tons of better restaurants than this one. I will not be back here again. Mind you, I was the ONLY customer there. Very disappointed.

GZ7NhP91ouFxmpgwGzpEXg.text: Huge bowls of pho for $8!   Food came out slower than I'm used to at a Pho restaurant but I was definitely not disappointed with the food. We got the shrimp and pork spring rolls and the Vietnamese fried egg rolls to start. Spring rolls came with the tasty peanut sauce and fried egg rolls came with the fish sauce but no pickled carrots and radish. Pho came out hot, delicious, with very tender brisket! Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Adding in the goodies
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge bowl of brisket pho!

YoBZ_0NMm-skD4eUFKE7mg.text: Okay so I'm going to start off by saying I have come here at least 10 times. I come back each time for the food. But the reason I'm not going to give 5 or even 4 stars is because they make the same mistake every single time. I literally ask for my mae go ren noodles with no meat, and no extra veggies. Just what it comes with on the menu itself which is (egg, tofu, potatoes, and I think asparagus). EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. they either don't add egg, forget potatoes or usually add a bunch of veggies that I don't want. Is it that hard to just make it with the simple ingredients listed on the menu. This wasn't once, not twice. Its every time. usually they end up remaking it for me. You might wonder why I go back.. it's because when the noodles are right they are some of the best noodles I've had. The sweet and sour chicken is incredible and Thai tea as well. However, not sure if its the server or the kitchen.. but just learn to listen to the guest and follow simple direction/requests.

jAOrvJxnj5tI4DNt2khhnQ.text: I been going here for a while now and i guess tonight I recieved a very bad service and never coming here again!! The 2 servers where very rude!!

JI2O2OEhhdL1i3zSJWGnRg.text: I came in here and the service was horrible..no hello or greeting.  The vermicelli eggroll noodles I ordered was sour and bad. The guy didn't even acknowledge me nor asked if I needed anything.  I ended up paying my bill and walked out!

8_Njk247XImwsJ8w7NJ3eQ.text: Went here for lunch with my coworkers was very skeptical wasn't a big fan of pho. See I said wasn't. The pho was so good. I got the seafood pho as I love seafood. I got it minus the fishball and squid as I am still a little skeptical of some things. The price was good and I will definitely be returning. Our waiter wasn't that friendly but the food made up for it!

VBC2aXqMbW_dmfzLZQHCLA.text: I've been going here for years now. I give this four stars because I absolutely love the food so much that I don't mind the not so good customer service. I rate the food 4 1/2 to 5 stars. The pricing is good and the quality of the food is good. Their broth is really good and tasty and their fried rice is just amazing! Just for fried rice- amazing!! Also the exterior and interior looks like a diner! Doesn't look a pho place at all :) it looks different!   I take customer service into consideration and it's very important when rating the restaurant thoroughly. However, if there is lack of good customer service when the food is absolutely outstanding along with the price, I MIGHT disregard the bad customer service.   In this case, I've been going here for a long time and before they had staff that are now gone. The staff before were nice and polite. I would say the staff here is lousy and not attentive to the customers. They could improve by greeting the customer with a smile and not seem upset to be working when talking to the customers. There have been a few times when they didn't check up on us and it took a while for the waters to get to our table. Most of the time we have to go up to their front desk ourselves if we needed something.   Other than a 3 rating for their customer service, they have really good food for a decent price and the ambience makes it relaxing and chill to have lunch or dinner.

mb8_FQGi6U7GYUqt6n11Gw.text: 2 stars for service. 3 and a half for the pho. The diner feel turned Vietnamese is kind of random but doesn't feel like a diner. I loved the geisha paintings on the wall but this place was a big miss for me. Came in on a Sunday. Seated right away. Server was in a bad mood seemed like. I browsed the menu while boyfriend was in the bathroom washing his hands. I decided to browse and maybe try a noodle bowl with grilled meat but they wouldn't let me substitute beef for pork instead of pork with pork sausage. I went for my usual pho tai. Nothing outstanding about this pho. Meat was tender and the portion was standard. I remember the pho tasting better. As for service it's been so long I can't tell but the server here was absolutely rude. I wouldn't return. It's sad there's less than a handful of pho places on this side of town and most of them have hit or miss service and subpar pho.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho tai. Pho with rare steak. Beef was tender and a little thicker than your standard steak.

QNxsMR59o6NHXujaR4jWvg.text: Pretty much our go-to place for pho. I had the round eye steak and brisket. My wife had  the brisket and tripe. Both bowls were empty when we got up to leave.  We were hoping for a 45 minute dinner at 7 to make a movie at 8 o'clock on a Saturday night. We didn't make the originally planned movie. It was our fault for not planning enough cushion. The restaurant is understaffed to handle dinner rushes on the weekend and everything was just backed up. The staff was not standing around twiddling their thumbs. In fact, they were working quite hard and they did well to get us in and out in an hour. But we only got two bowls of soup. They had two servers to cover about 20+ tables and to host. There was one food runner and one busser. 5 minute wait to get seated, 5 minute wait for greet, 35 minute ticket time. They just couldn't handle the volume. We did make it to another movie at 8:15 in the Colannade.  I would recommend for the pho. Unless you have no time constraints for your meal, I would not recommend going during peak meal times.

ormk8Z7hWTvEhb92zGXsbQ.text: Fast service and good food. My husband and I ordered the vermicelli salad (chicken,  lemongrass beef and egg rolls) # 65 & 63 respectively, and boy they were huge portions. We were full and satisfied. My daughters shared the large #38 (combination) pho. They both loved it. This is the first time I have seen them finish a pho bowl by themselves. Maybe it's because we were all hungry after a day's worth of shopping and walking, but this place was a real nice surprise. It's cheaper than a buffet meal in LV too.

x-LrGHtnEGh4zhBp7_-Dcw.text: Hungry for Pho ! Got big bowl for $7.95 and have to try Vietnamese coffee ..it will wake you up very strong coffee ..test very good!!!!

yI0cJKk7wKCIKC-_PYv__A.text: Yes, it really is a 50's style diner that serves pho.  I'm not a professional on Vietnamese food (aka Vietnamese) so I'm not sure how pho/Vermicelli noodles are actually supposed to taste. When my Vietnamese friends want pho, they come here. When I want pho or Vermicelli noodles, I go to the place down the street on Eastern. Lemongrass isn't my favorite. The Vermicelli noodles taste weird here... Plus there are so many leaves in it I feel like I'm eating a salad.  Other than that, great service!

7ktE6NdxuFKPEhEQ-O18-A.text: I've come here a few time and am always recognized when I walk in.   So let me start with one of my favorite things here.   I love lemon grass!   They use is in so much of heir food items and one of my favorite is the spring rolls.   Not only the wonderful crunch it gives but the taste is amazing.  Everyone here is so nice and welcoming.     You can tell they care about their customers.   So if you're looking for Vietnamese food with a different flair, come check them out.   You won't be disappointed! :)

AUE-VmHzErfcBsu3LIfxXw.text: I have mixed opinions about this place. The vegetarian pho is amazing, and is always on point. It's my go to food when I'm starting to feel sick and I love the fresh spring rolls as an appetizer. However, the customer service is consistently horrible. Other than an older lady, everyone else has been rude and its why I will not eat in anymore. When you call to place orders the staff have answered "I don't know" to my questions more than once (i.e., how many meatballs are in an order?) and I'm still mad about the time they were out of vegetarian broth and didn't tell me until I drove out of my way to get there.... But the pho is still really damn good. Even though they're stingy on the tofu lol!

MlppEPRernwNecgPQHUr8Q.text: Food is good, if I was going to rate JUST the food I definitely would rate 4.5/5 however...  THE.....SERVICE....SUCKS!!!!!!! Each and EVERYTIME we are there, the men waiters are SOOOOOO RUDE!! It's like they have something stuck up their ass!! Even if I say thank you, the look at me like they want to murder me!!!! They don't even talk, they just like... Look at you and expect that we understand what they are subconsciously thinking like.... "I'm about to murder you b****"  The only nice person there is the sweet elderly woman! She's soooooo sweet and nice!!!!! 5/5 service for her! Grandma I love you, please fire your other waiters!!! Sheeeeeeeesh!!!  The food is really good though, we do the Vietnamese fondue and it's the only place in town that serves it, so I always go back! However I cringe when we have to order!   But for real though, the WORST service EVERRRRR (except from the awesome elderly lady, she's so cute!) But seriously, it's sooooooo bad from the other waiters, I don't even want to tip. But when you pay, they stare at you like, "better give me at least double the tab, or I will cut you" type of state, so I am obligated and fear for my life to leave a tip. Damn if I wasn't such a fat ass and didn't like the food I would never go back. But yummy deliciousness, why you gotta be so good? I just can't help it!   4.5/5 for the food -37366368273528292529/5 for the service from all the waiters except 5/5 for the nice elderly lady/owner!   Ok end rant. Go eat there food is good, but beware to get scared sh**less from the bad, CREEEEEEEPY men waiters service!

hOwRgTQFceEaGEIhCzqycQ.text: I really love the flavor of their pho, probably my favorite in Vegas. Rich, deep flavor and very generous with their meat portions. Only reason I will  likely not be returning is because they burn incense near the entrance which is the center of the restaurant. While I understand the meaning behind this, it's very off-putting for those who are very sensitive to smoke and fragrance. Unfortunately, it's so overwhelming that it ruins my appetite and my meal.

WMCvQ9-kCvwK97Ns4KbV7Q.text: I've been coming here since I was in high school. Best place to get pho. It's not over priced like other restaurants. The staff is always friendly especially the little lady with black curled hair. She is the sweetest. She always has a smile on her face every time we dine in.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #39 large no cilantro or green onion.

UC3yf2chBiwoC_RWMboBvw.text: Great vietnamese food and great vegetarian options. Love the pho, the bun, the spring rolls, and the great crepe. The crepe is monstrous and oh so delicious. As usual, everything comes with a whole garden of herbs. Love it because it fills you up without feeling bogged down and no guilt, since it is so healthy. I also love their complimentary jasmine tea that comes iced or hot. This is now a staple restaurant for me.

FSgkOUTB6s90umQEMlwI-g.text: I mean it's good but it ain't all that! I went to this place twice in two weeks, and I really wanted to like this place because it's right down the street from where I live. This place has a very interesting theme. Like all the other reviewers mentioned, this place looks like a diner straight out of the 70's. The first time I went there, I had Vermicelli with Chicken and my friend had rare beef Pho and we had shrimp&pork spring rolls for appetizers. The spring rolls were okay, one unique thing about their spring rolls is that they have some kind of crispy chips? in them. Vermicelli with chicken was not bad, but nothing special. What I like about their Pho is that the portion is huge, but I thought it should be a bit hotter when it's served. Pho So 1 or Pho Kim Long serve their Pho super hot, but Lemongrass Cafe is just hot, going towards warm.   Second time arounds we had the same appetizers, well-done flank Pho, and Shrimp stir fry noodle. Again, I don't know why, but Pho was almost just warm! Maybe I should let them know to make it super hot when I order. Also, the noodles were a bit overcooked this time. Shrimp stir fry noodle wasn't that good. It had a very good flavor, but the noodles were a bit too sticky.  All the staffs are very nice and friendly. I didn't have any problem with their service. I think I'm going to give this place one more shot and decide whether or not to become a regular.

uN58boX_qCffO4_wvrqT8A.text: Cockroach crawled out of sprout plate... Killed it, hesitated to stay but did. They apologized, replaced food, charged me every cent for my food n to-go dinner. Used to come here every week, my fav pho diner, but I think I'll drive a little farther to Chinatown from now on...

5DX7bE9JIOzGqJA0fjl6Fg.text: I don't typically like Asian cuisine but When I came here I had the shrimp pho, It was so delicious! If you like spicy and seafood, this is your dish. And service here is friendly and I love the decor, it's so cute.

m40ArAGWRd5eQFw7sXTNUg.text: From the first time I was here to the last time, it seems like the broth drastically improved.  Maybe the lunch cook was better than the dinner cook.  Maybe a few months passed and they changed the recipe.  Maybe I was just really hungry.  Whatever the reason is all I know is that was some of the best pho tai I've had in a very long time.  The service has also improved quite a bit.  They have good from friendly to extremely friendly and attentive.  I'm not going to act like I am a pho expert and that my knowledge of pho is more than everyone else, but I've had my fair share of bowls across Cali and Vegas.  This last one had some of the best both I've had in a while.  A lot of places that I've eaten out here at seem watery, the basil isn't fresh, or i'm thinking "where's the beef" (showing my age there).  This one has it all working for it.  I cleared the large bowl, had some egg rolls, and mango ice cream.  The large bowl is large... I just have a healthy appetite.  So much so that the waitress asked if I worked out all the time because she didn't see where all the food was going.   Most of all, this place made me home sick.   Awww... Westminster and your tasty eateries I miss you.  Lol!

FGjfkBGJwmPrAV0hlgE-ew.text: You have to really look for the location because it is a Vietnamese restaurant in an old diner building, but the Pho was delicious.  The vegetarian is my favorite.  Comes with a ton of vegetables and the broth is great.

dLIDmy7r07g37rNhqavVbA.text: While in Vegas last week, I got a sudden urge for some Banh Mi and Chicken Pho and of course, almighty Yelp led us to Lemongrass Cafe.  Yeah, yeah, the outside looks like a 50's diner, actually now that I think of it, it kind of resembled an oversized Streamline trailer.  But hey, who cares, you're there for the food, not to play Architectural Digest trivia.  Their menu was quite extensive as it had your basic Vietnamese and Thai offerings along with, Banh Mi...yay!  Talk about a perfect trifecta of Asian food!  So, I order my Chicken Pho and I shared the Combo Banh Mi with the s/o.  Pricing was a little bit on the high side compared to the Bay Area, my Pho was pushing $7 and the Banh Mi was $3.75.  Our Banh Mi took awhile to make, not sure why but when it came out, I was slightly disappointed.  It's thickness was mostly the bread's doing but it was also short but oh well.  I took a bite into it and the sandwich redeemed itself, it was quite delicious for such a small thing.  The bread was tasty, not sure if they bake it on site but it sure tasted like they did.  But, still disappointed about how small it was.  When it comes to Banh Mi, size certainly matters, the longer the better, right? ;)  My Chicken Pho was good, pretty basic, can't really mess it up.  However, my bowl had a lot of chicken.  Usually, my general complaint on most food I eat is how skimpy the meat is, well, not my bowl of Chicken Pho, it was loaded!  The staff was really friendly.  This one girl who was our server, whoa, talk about stewardess in the making!  She exerted such overwhelming friendliness, courtesy and hospitality.  Overall, Lemongrass Cafe was a decent place to eat and worth going to get your Viet/Thai/Banh Mi fix on!

SO2WaOR1jg2tLQVmuXZ64g.text: Love this place!! Food is fast and always good. Staff is always friendly. It's definitely my favorite Vietnamese restaurant on this side of town.

xqz5vf1OtBAK052tdrfHvw.text: Very depressing place. There was no: greeting, small talk, thank you and goodbyes.  The food wasn't great nor bad.  Not coming back here and not recommending this place to anyone.

3VHPO3YvI678OQ0wwcXDKg.text: My search for awesome tofu options in a Vietnamese menu might be over! Let me tell you, tofu options in a Vietnamese restaurant make my heart race. I get even more excited when the tofu is prepared and flavored well.   Finding this place must be fate because my craving for some vermicelli noodle dishes pushed me to pursue my quest for the "perfect" Vietnamese dishes. I'm glad I listened to my gut because this place definitely satisfied my cravings.   My Fiance and I order for take out. Here are the items we ordered-- 1.) Shrimp and Pork spring rolls: Nothing out of the ordinary. Packed really dense, looks small. Peanut sauce tastes the same as other places.   2.) Rare steak and meatball pho: my fiance likes it, but the broth slightly lacked flavor and there wasn't as much meat as he wanted or has had from other restaurants.   3.) Tofu Vermicelli: YUM! The carrots, cucumbers, lettuce, peanuts, mint and noodles were very well balanced. I like having more vegetables in my vermicelli dishes so this definitely caught my eye. And the sauce that accompanied it, so light and not overwhelmingly fishy tasting. My only complaint was the tofu was somewhat more oily than I am accustomed; However, the mouthwatering, lemongrass flavor of it outweighed it's oilyness. :P   And thank goodness this place is close to where I live. Lemongrass Cafe gives me even more reason not to move too far away from the southeast.

lbvfcLBniA0kL7os8DxpZw.text: I love the use of fresh veggies here. you must try the banh mi !!!! these sandwiches are to die for!!!  It seems to be under new management

LAh6uqRbKinzleoMB-fX6Q.text: Amazing Service! Staff is so nice and very friendly. Attentive as well.   My brother was in town for the day and was looking for a bit of Asiain flare and I had remembered going to this place one time before based on the reviews.   My brother had the Veggie Curry and loved every bite of it. It had great flavor and the veggies were not mushy like they can get in some not so good curries.   I had the chicken pho, add a bit of hots and was good to go.   We also had 2 apps, the veggie spring rolls and the chicken satay. The satay was a bit over done, but the owner popped by the table to tell us that and that she would take that off of the bill without us even saying anything.   I will be dining here again!

G98fFfX50YWAS-NBG_K8nw.text: I LOVE Pho and this place is my favorite. The food is fresh and delicious. I can never finish it all. I like how they give me extra broth so I can enjoy my leftovers at home. Great service!

PN1AK8XxuMF7YUJHIXdeQA.text: Lemongrass has delicious food and tea.  The service was good.  My only suggestion/concern is the smell.  Need better ventilation.

7Oacq8VuV2GmKo8kNK3X9w.text: I don't usually write yelp reviews but wow. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER.i always think going to a restaurant deals.with giving us food saying hi some smiles from the serber. But nah. The owner (he is 40 yr oldish guy) doesn't say shit. Just comes to us and waits for us to tell him. At the end we give him our bill and pretty good tip and nothibg. So I went up to him and gave him a good smile to think about. WORST PLACE. Food is not even that good. Trust me. My.family owns restaurant too and this gotta be the worst sht ever

Bm-Wq8JuDpdEgkLT7qsEew.text: Tasty... Odd ambiance of 50s diner with mediocre service but good food... I'd come again

qmrI3nG6X3HsOi6mON0kmw.text: The pho broth has great flavor and seasoning. The shrimp spring rolls were awesome. Great lunch stop.

VFQUTT3EyODbxHUcx_hdjA.text: Maybe I came with expectations too high. Maybe I came on a bad day. But Lemongrass Cafe did not do it for me. I dragged the husband to this place (we drove around for about 20 mins cos my GPS was taking me to weird places) and finally come to it. It's a Vietnamese place that is in one of those old school diner structures. Intrigued? Yes I was. I galloped into the restaurant.   Service was good. The waitress was very sweet and made recommendations for us. We had the following  Vietnamese Crepe (Vegetarian) - This is probably why I'm giving the place 3 stars and not 2. Tasted amazing and was HUGE. Note to self: Vietnamese Crepes are only starters when there are 5 people at the table. The expectations grew higher after the stellar crepe  Veggie Pho with Tofu and Veggies - Have to give it to them. Portion sizes are generous. The Pho was not flavorful. It was like vegetable stock. Quite disappointing. I could microwave something in 2 minutes that could have tasted similar  Lemongrass Tofu - Eh.....I've had better. The tofu by itself was quite overpowering and had a pretty weird smell but with the rice, I was able to eat a few bites.   They did honor the 10% discount on the menu when I mentioned "Yelp." The total bill with the discount was around $30.   I'll probably not be back. I think the Pho at Veggie Delight tastes superior.

LZrgWGpVRclR3QO9RUWtNA.text: The place smelled like fish sauce. Broth was okay, I've had better. They didn't have any chili oil sauce...Minus 2 stars just for that.  The hoisin sauce was the $1.25 bottle like the one in my pantry. (Could've at least put it in their own plastic container) I had the combo pho and there was 1/6 slice of a beef ball in it. Really? Ok, no. Then I got a Vietnamese pork sandwich.  The only thing in there was some kind of lunch meat looking thing, shredded carrots (mind you, it wasn't even pickled), and sliced cucumbers. No cilantro. No taste. Nothing special about the Thai tea.. Last, the guy who rang up the bill handed me a paper with numbers and my total and said, " is everything right here?" Umm how would I know what those numbers mean? Won't be coming back if I'm ever craving pho. Sorry not sorry.

_Lu-XJ4klZDD7TPPJd-LXg.text: Great for vegetarians like me! Their Vegetarian Pho is made using only vegetables, no meat broth or fish sauce and it's yummy!  My favorite items are the Vegetable Crepe (appetizer), the three bean ice (dessert) and the Vietnamese Coffee. Very fresh, and tasty herbs and spring rolls as well! I highly recommend this place!

8ZnOsE6FKrZ-iuk5CbXE5w.text: The food was good, if anything the food was a little bland. The service was great and everyone there was really friendly. Everything was made fresh and I really enjoyed my visit here!

QrFsBd-ITj7xtWVVUcDZPw.text: Solid place for Vietnamese food. I've gotten the vermicelli and rice dishes and would come again for those dishes. The outside of the restaurant does not scream Vietnamese, instead it screams diner. Like really, the outside looks like what you would imagine a diner to look like. Kind of cool and funky.  My gripe about Lemongrass Cafe is the service. It's been pretty iffy all the times that I've come here and that's for both dine in AND take out. For dining in, it took way too long for someone to come up to us, greet and seat us then even longer to get water and have our orders taken. For take out, I had called in my order and came a little later than what the host had told me it would take. And then waited another 10 minutes on top of that.. AND the restaurant was not busy at all.   Questionable service but the food is good enough that I will keep coming back for now!

JT-KeG8d38LtKME0tzi2QA.text: To start , service sucks , from the very first time , same waiter that always brings our menu , never gives us a hello , just puts the menus on the table and walks away , I did notice that anytime Caucasian people walk in , this waiter walks over to them and is very friendly to them and walks them over to their table, I am Mexican , I don't know if this waiter thinks Mexicans don't tip well and just doesn't want to give us good service for that reason, however I love great service along with good food and for that I give great tips , whatever his reason for not treating us good, tonight , 7/17/18 , I did tell my family that we no longer will set foot inside this restaurant , he makes it very obvious , he does not want to serve us, so we will take our money somewhere else. It's a shame some people judge people for their color without even knowing them. Good people come in all colors and shapes , take time to know them.

WQKlLayLGvSrDaEm1vzw4A.text: Always good, friendly staff and inexpensive. Their menu is HUGE - so many choices. But the spicy is SUPER hot! be careful ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Post bench meal w/ muffins!

dLSAEFRvbCjBBe7ZoY_y8w.text: My boyfriend and I came across this hidden gem because of Yelp, i've got to admit on the outside it does not look appealing because it use to be a 50's style dinner, but we are glad we looked past it.  we were pretty surprised just how delicious everything was. My boyfriend orders pho with brisket. it was very rich and had a flavorful broth and he could honestly say those were the best rice noodles he's ever had. I had the vermicelli bowl with the sugarcane shrimp I thought it was pretty delicious. Very light but satisfying. We also ordered springs rolls which I loved, both shrimp and pork that came along with a peanut sauce which seemed different than most peanut sauce it was light and not just a peanut butter taste.  Service was good there is the male waiter who seemed a bit grumpy when he approached us, but was attentive. The older lady at the front was very welcoming and sweet. We will definitely be back for more!

t0Z-UjYhgGuhGiPSKEZGRA.text: One star. Bad atmosphere, terrible customer service.   Smells like Clorox bleach with a side of raw beef.   Eerily quiet inside. Not even public radio playing.   Although it's fairly priced and food was OK. You cannot pay with debit unless your order is more than $10.   Would not recommend. Go to Pho Saigon across the street.

3bWpNLuph9EKHPWeYPWZLA.text: Pho-ck it.  Pho and I have had a rocky relationship from the get-go.   I originally tried it in Seattle where my sister swore up and down about its deliciousness and supposed healing powers.    I was super stoked to try this magical soup! I was sorry to report to her that I did not, ahem, like it at all. I wasn't a fan of the flowery tasting broth and the raw meat that had to cook in there. And no, I don't think the Vietnamese are "savages" as one yelper was insinuating I said!  Anyhoo. I wasn't a fan.   Jump to 2 years later. Vegas. My sister again tries to convince me and brings me here to Lemongrass. I wussed out and went with a Banh Mi (which was delicious!) and decided to give her pho a taste. Lo and behold, I didn't hate it!    From that instance, I vowed to order my own the next time I had the opportunity.   That such time came early this December and I am glad to report that I am a phan!!  The staff here is very friendly and their food is fresh and delicious.   Thank you, Lemongrass. You win.
