8d8pXjzH8FmkW5KPddNk2Q.text: Our favorite little Pho spot. we ear here once or twice a week and the pho is always good.

9_bQXlGlznugLfudJwU3Iw.text: Vegas.  My home away from home for the past 5 6 years.  Food is good in general on the vegas strip and pricey but I wouldn't quite categorize it as great for what you pay.  As I would always say, the nice fancy restaurants always dish out "technically" good food.  I mean, how many ways can you really make sushi or cook a piece of nice steak.  6 ways I guess... Rare, black n blue, medium rare, medium, medium well, n well done.... Done "technically" well, plate it nicely, and BOOM price marked up the ying yang.  Too much eating on the strip does sometimes make "charming" food lose its magic.  You can call it boring to be precise.  That's why I'm always looking for food away from the strip especially during the lunch hours.  After a long hard fought night through the clubs n drinks n the masses, it's always a pleasant feeling to sit down to a nice bowl of pho.  In this case, it was a Bun Bo Hue; a traditional spicy beef and pork noodle soup with the fragrant aroma of lemongrass and shrimp paste along with other herbs that originated from central Vietnam.  It's really hard to find a great BBH but when you do find one, you can guarantee to be loyal.  It's like having a GF or a wife.  Why would you look elsewhere when you already have the best?  For BBH though, if it's above average, I suggest you stick with it and stop looking around because you'll be disappointed when you finally realize that even an above average one is harder to come by than a SF home with A/C.  The one I had today was a keeper.  I normally would play it safe n just pick up a Pho Dac Biet aka combination beef pho aka  at any pho restaurant while itching to satisfy my curiosity of the BBH if available.  Saw it on the menu so I just had to ask... He said he'd order the BBH over the PDB.  I was sold.    I subbed the usual thicker denser chewier rice noodle for the pho noodle.  It was a good choice.  Very aromatic and flavorful.  Soup came out very hot which any noodle soup lover would surely know to appreciate.  It came with fancy pork, cuts of beef w tendon, and pork skin n collagen that were nice n tender.  I wish they had the cubes of pig's blood though.  Overall, it was a good BBH experience which is nice since it's just a few mins down from where I stay out here.  It's located in an old vintage american diner setting that you can't miss.  Service feels slow here but you'll be satisfied.  And if you are still battling a hangover, be sure to hydrate and restore your electrolytes with some young coconut juice.  You'll feel alive when you walk out of there.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Bo Hue subbed for pho noodle.  Thumbs up.

_CuTki-gTSouuZ4jVMeDbQ.text: So far this has been the best Vietnamese food outside of China town. Most places in Vegas are terrible. We've tried maybe a dozen of them and have not left satisfied. Portions and taste was good. Ordered the Com Bi Suong Cha and Bun Thit Nuong Nam and Chai Gio. Rice plate and cold noodles. For the appetizer we had Nam Nuong spring rolls. We liked the spring roll as the pork patty is home made. Not the store bought kind. Peanut sauce is legit. For the rice and vermicelli plates the meat are seasoned well with a hint of lemongrass which most places lack to be authentic. Their fish sauce is also good. As any Vietnamese person would know if the sauce is terrible your dish will be terrible. -1 Star was due to service. Food took 25 mins to come out on a very slow day. 2 parties came after us by 5 mins or so got their food first and they didn't order noodles. Everything was made to order which is nice. Meats are not partially cooked and re heated on the grill. All in all good food in a dive location. 50's diner ambiance.

U1q-4rPdTJO5pGxFthNsqA.text: I'm a shameless regular at Lemongrass Cafe. Although business has increased steadily since I first started coming here, the quality of service and food has not declined, which is PHENOMENAL. It might even be safe to say that the staff and food here have gotten even better with 'age'!  Now on to the pho...  The pho. Oh my god, the pho. It hits the spot. And when I say the spot--I mean THE spot. Amazing with a hangover, even better sober. It's better than sex, and I can say my mind's been blown once or twice so I know what I'm talking about.  Lemongrass Cafe is BETTER THAN SEX. When you're full, you wish you weren't cuz the food is so goddamn good. You just can't get enough.  I've had pho in different parts of the USA including Hawaii, and Lemongrass Cafe has the BEST pho I've had EVER. The broth is savory and delicious--it doesn't need any addtional condiment although you could add whatever you want obviously. It's flavorful and fresh... I get all hot just thinking about it.  Now the staff. The people taking your order and refilling your water and fulfilling your every need. They are wonderful, beautiful humans and you will love them. Every single one of them. They're always smiling, and their smiles are genuine--they don't fake it and that makes the climax of this experience indescribable.  Now the food might take a little longer than other pho spots to come but it's because it's FRESH, people. It's worth the wait. This restaurant is about QUALITY, and you get more than you pay for. If I'm not mistaken, Lemongrass Cafe is more affordable than other Vietnamese restaurants.  The fresh spring (?) rolls are Amazing, and the peanut sauce that goes along with it is orgasmic. I rarely use that word cuz I rarely orgasm, so believe me when I say it'll make your eyes roll back.   In fact, everything I've had here is delicious!! Even their iced coffee!  Overall, Lemongrass Cafe is the best. And trust me, I'll have nothing but THE BEST.

7TlyHQu_ilxLk2T55VGKWQ.text: Love the food here,  but this is the closest place I can get pho.  I usually get carry out and have never had a problem with the service,  even for the few times we have eaten in. I always get pho and Bahn Mi,  yum yum.   If they were on an online delivery service I would probably order from here more.

iMEACkbNinn6ZossN_Pxsw.text: I drive very far out of my way to eat here nearly every week. The food is delicious and very affordable. I will only eat pho with vegetable broth, so I'm very grateful that they have it. I love that I can get my vegetable pho with more vegetables instead of tofu, too. They have a $10 minimum for credit cards, so watch out for that, but I recommend this place to anyone looking for some yummy Vietnamese food.

FhJBMOQXGnPP_CKgBC7JJw.text: I've seen this little stainless steel diner cart a few times since we've moved to Vegas and had always wondered what it was. Well, today I finally found out when the hubby and I decided to try it.  I have never had Vietnamese food in my life, so I was a bit apprehensive, but I love trying new things. It looked exactly how you would think a Vietnamese restaurant in a diner cart would look and I absolutely loved it! We started off with the tofu spring rolls that came with peanut sauce and they were delicious. They had a nice crunch to them and the tofu was cooked perfectly.   Hubby ordered the Vegetarian Pho and it was fantastic! Beautiful-looking and tasty, the broth was very flavourful, and tons of crunchy veggies with rice noodles that were not overcooked like they can normally be. I ordered the Vermicelli with Tofu. Once again, the tofu was cooked perfectly and had very good flavour! The vermicelli were very well cooked too and I loved the Thai basil in this dish especially.   All in all, a very good experience! Our waitress was very attentive without going overboard with it and she was extremely polite. Very comfortable atmosphere and will be recommending this little gem to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie bahn mi with vegetarian pho.
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vermicelli with vegetarian eggrolls
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Pho

WyDEs-FrqymVa16bk971pw.text: I enjoy this Vietnamese restaurant meets 50s diner.   Their standard (pork and shrimp) and grilled chicken spring roll appetizers are pretty good.  The pho tai nam was really good. You could taste the beef bones used to make the broth. It was rich with beef flavor and had a little fatty richness to it.   If ur not that risky and want a safe dish. You could order #80 which is an excellent tender beef dish with onions and bell peppers.   The wait staff during lunches are really helpful and informative. The male&female staff work the floor and seem to know all the patrons on a first name basis.   I was impressed when the female server asked me if I wanted my grilled chicken spring roll. I met her only once before (3 weeks earlier) and asked if there wS an alternative to the shrimp and pork option.   I wS impressed when she mentioned it was too hot to eat soup and asked if I'd still be ordering soup . Which is what I ordered once before.  "she's good"  I thought for a moment wow I'm that memorable, "pause for reflection" nope she's just that good.. Lol..   I will come here again just to order something different to throw her off. Hehehe.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese iced coffe
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu9
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu8

lOFXuhllTnJ8cR44naPI-Q.text: I ate here with my boyfriend and the service was good, but it took a while for the food... About 20 minutes.  I've made pho before and basically all you do is boil noodles and add slices of beef and the broth that was pre-made in a larger pot, but it took my boyfriend and I at least 20 minutes to get our food. We saw bowls coming out and none of them were ours... We thought they may have forgotten about us haha.   I have to say though, the broth is much more flavorful compared to other pho restaurants here in vegas. However, the bottom of my boyfriends bowl had remnants of dried food... Not the best at washing dishes.   But since my boyfriend was starving and it was only dirty on the outside, he ate it anyway haha. Still... It wasn't appetizing knowing that he was eating out of a bowl that was dirty on the outside and was filled with a dark soup base not being able to see what was inside.

wuaQxFs8w28C_iHX_IbQ1Q.text: This is probably by far the best place to get Vegetarian Pho.  There is actually flavor when you eat the noodles.    Also, the employees are really sweet.  This is definitely my go to place for Pho. :)

gqQIUAhdoZSnZTpz_XfVNg.text: The food is great. The service is pathetic, borderline rude. And don't even think about using their bathroom, it is disgusting. I can't believe it's osha qualified. Gross. I still come back for the food, but it gets harder and harder.

85kyf85BbLEAz_vMQ4zx0A.text: The best pho in vegas...for price and quality. I got the special combo and it was great..the broth tastes fresh and full of flavor. Price is great (if you have to pay $9.00 for pho you overpaid) Plus I have yet to taste pho that is better because it costs more... It's locates in an old diner, so it's funky but delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring roll that has a crunch with fresh peanut sauce

Gp3fIvAmOyOb_w-uq_qktw.text: My rating is based on the seating is not comfortable for a large person. There were no wheelchair booths.  There were no tables accommodating large family dining .  However the food was excellent, food took time getting to us but once we got it, it was very delicious.  Atmosphere of the place is a 50's diner which has nothing to do with asian cuisine.  The menu was out dated with wrong pricing on food.  The restaurant appeared to be clean. I would recommend this place for food quality.

9N8zA0ZUzPBVH2atMFaaIQ.text: Me and my wife were not that hungry so we shared a large bowl of Pho which I was not that impressed with, Not much  beef or toppings and while we were eating I heard one of the workers or owner talking bad about us only ordering 1 bowl and going on about it WOW, we could not believe it they had been speaking vietnemese but this was in English so we could hear it! A very bad experience !

Auquhg4XBX6viZ1lVXdTUw.text: My boyfriend and I were regulars at JenniPho and we were sad it was so far after we moved to Henderson. WE found our pho place! Best pho ever! Cherry on top that the waiters know exactly what we want.

tmk_cWSizmRyo7kGui1q-Q.text: This place looks like a oriental style 50's diner. I walk in & was greeted right away. Quick service & to the point. I ordered a chicken pho for my kids & a veggie tofu pho for myself. If I'd have known how big the portions were, I would've ordered only 1 soup. The broth was pretty good & I like how they gave us lots of vegetables. What I didn't like was how mushy the noodles were & how they were all stuck together. Regardless of the mushy noodles, I fulfilled my pho craving so I still enjoyed the pho at Lemongrass Cafe.

ptLI35VxvtkG1uTFXtjc6Q.text: I am absolutely disgusted by the high reviews this place got.  I expect a place with mediocre/below mediocre and barely authentic Vietnamese food to at least have good service.  Service was horrid (half an hour before we got asked for our drink orders), but that isn't the dominant reason for the low rating.  The broth was just salty with little actual flavor.  Portions were small and the price was much higher than that of REAL Viet places.  I can certainly see the draw of this place --it's close to Green Valley and suburbs of Las Vegas. Go here if you must, but if you've been to the Little Saigons, the Little Vietnams, or a Vietnamese grandma's kitchen, you'll leave unsatisfied.  Go to Pho So 1 on Decatur and Spring Mountain -- little grimier, but loads better.

4_dnECYDOxJrZhM5rxNrCw.text: awesome food. the little old Vietnamese lady who took our order was adorable! authentic vietnamese spices and flavors.

KetT8kNPaZfaKfl_VXy8CQ.text: Hubby was feeling a little under the weather due to the AC being on in the room all night.  So we figured to have some PHO.  We're not locals and coming from Los Angeles we know all of our PHO spots.  So who do we turn to, our handy dany yelp.  so this place pretty much was the first to pop up, read reviews, and said why not.  So we pull up and it looks like a 50's diner which was pretty off for being a PHO place, but don't let the looks decieve you.  We enter, we sit down look at the menu and ordered our soup.  Although most of the PHO places i've gone to is really quick and fast it took kind of long to get our soups, i won't lie i was getting frustrated already.  i would say it was a good 20mins wait, for PHO i know right.  well anyways we holler at the waitress to ask what's up with our soup and she said they were waiting for our egg rolls to cook, so i think okay they just want all of our stuff we ordered to come out at the same time.  So food comes, and wow!! The broth was super good! It was very rich in flavor, it was really good, i really enjoyed it.  So this frustrated person became a happy person.  We are for sure coming back to get our PHO fix and i would totally recommend this place.

KiLk-LcQR1c1SArR6fRY9w.text: The food is great.  Best pho in town.  Their service on the other hand could be better.  Don't expect to be served right away if you come by yourself on your lunch break.  They will walk right past you.

pFwlpIT062NRZoQgSXygjA.text: The family was hungry and craving Pho today, so we headed to Lemongrass Cafe. When we first walked in we were hit with that familiar delicious aroma. As we stepped in towards the dining area, though, we ran into sewer smell. We hesitated, sniffing, and the owner noticed. She gave an apologetic smile and nodded that yes, there was a problem. We know back-ups can happen and it wasn't overpowering, so we opted to stay.  The food was spot on delicious. 5 star for sure. The waitress was cold, but stiffly polite. A couple things we asked for didn't come, but we rolled with it and chalked it up to language barrier...no big deal. We raved about the iced tea. It was very good, mild with a subtle hint of vanilla. When it was time to go, my daughters asked if they could have to-go cups for their tea (we had demolished all our food) and were each given one.  While waiting for the chech and credit card to come back I decided I wanted to take my unfinished tea with me as well. I asked for a cup. None ever came. We were ready to leave and I asked again...thinking she hadn't heard me. The owner told me that they normally charge for cups because the tea (which is not gratis) is to be drunk in the restaurant. She further informed me that she had to buy said cups, completely de-bunking the assumption I had when I fell off of the turnip truck, that they arrived free from the cup fairy. I asked how much, she said 25, and I gave her the last dollar my family will ever spend there.  These are tough times, and we all work too hard for our money to spend it somewhere that obviously does not want our business. We've been repeat customers because of the food, putting up with surly servers, but today was it. Our final order, and it was delicious: Banh Xeo Chay / Vegetarian Crepe 7.95  Goi Sen / Lotus Salad 8.95 Pho Tai / Rare Beef Pho - Small 6.95 Pho Bo Vien / Beef Meatball Pho - Small 6.95  Banh Mi (we got the Vietnamese sausage one, but i can't find it on the online menu)$3.95 I think... 4 ice teas (reg, not Thai) @ $1.50 ea plus tax and 20% tip came to about $53 bucks or so... not bad for lunch for 4.  Anybody have a Pho place to recommend? Pho Mailan (sp) is where we thought we'd try next.

5GCupk4o97XBk2HY9yLekw.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.  The selection here isn't as big as other Vietnamese restaurants but I always find something regardless.  Good quality food and the cool thing about this place is that I don't have to worry about leaving the restaurant smelling like pho like other Vietnamese restaurants.

R5K_3lo9q0K2GLcpvH_mxQ.text: I'm usually a fan of hole-in-the wall pho restaurants that make a mean bowl of soup! You know... the ones where the tables are sticky, you have to use a napkin to wipe all the chopsticks and tea cups, where the service sucks, the waiters look like they would mug you in a dark alley, and they stick their thumb when carrying the giant delicious bowl of goodness. Who cares about these minor deficiencies if the food is good, right?!?!  Well lemongrass gets pretty dang close to that quality, while being an extremely CLEAN and CIVILIZED restaurant. The pho was off the hook. A bit smaller than the hole-in-the-wall places, and the meat was leaner. Price was a bit higher too. But I guess I can pay the extra dollar so the waiter doesn't dip his thumb in my soup.

z-ZnP3-FNu5_xD5rp24T6g.text: The food here is good, although I've noticed that they have really started to skimp on the tripe.  The service is so-so.  I came here once by myself (which was awkward anyway because I didn't have anything to read or look at) and I sat there for 45 minutes after eating, just waiting for the server to come back and refill my drink and bring me the check.  I probably should have just gone up to the register to pay, but I was thirsty!  Overall, the food is usually good, and the experiences that I've had here have hovered between three and four stars.

fQ-edyD_dJhnxYYO5PMy0A.text: If your in the Henderson area - Lemongrass is one of your better options ! location is cool in a standalone diner looking structure .. love it. seating is comfortable had a Pho vegi rolls and lemongrass chicken. vegi rolls lacked a bit of variety did not seem to have sprouts and rather than use inside of lettuce they used outside leaves Pho was good and the lemon grass chicken was very good, service ok   ... but all in all a great place for lunch

BZZRuZN8torIfbAK240nNg.text: My friend and I were recommended to have the dinner here. The food was awesome! Love the Lemongrass Shrimp (basically is kind of like Fried Shrimp Cake). Also the Lobster Soup was so good with extra Citric taste we both loved. Don't forget the Thai Ice Tea! Love the environment, services and design of the restaurant. The prices was surprising reasonable too for Vegas!

iNMFPzHn_4urJ0tflRQa4w.text: For those of you on the east side of town, Lemongrass Cafe offers a decent bowl of pho, if you get the craving but don't want to drive across town to Spring Mountain during your lunch hour.  Been here a bunch of times, but am such a fan of pho that I always end up ordering a bowl of pho and an order of fresh spring rolls (which always hit the spot.  I will have to say that the one time I deviated from my usual was a sore disappointment...  My husband and I love bahn mi, so I bought a few to take home and try.  They totally missed the mark on the bread (good french bread is the key!), which ruined the whole sandwich.

L5tn03ssGyGUYQFluB2VYA.text: I quickly became a regular here ever since my fiance discovered this place. Lemongrass doesn't have the Vietnamese restaurant deco from outside. It looks more like 50"s diner with couple Asian wall pictures to me. One of the reason keeps bringing me back is soup is always served "HOT". And chef is pretty generous with veggies on vermicelli noodles. My only complaint would be their overcooked sugarcane shrimps with vermicelli noodles.

y0s-huqGu4MGPqOTwXWMRw.text: Its like a 50's diner... this place is fairly new.    The broth ot their soup isn't as flavorful as Pho Saigon 8.  However, not bad.. Some of their items make up for it, but their pricing is a bit more than other Vietnamese restaurants.  I tried the fresh spring rolls and they are delicious, and much larger than Saigon 8.  What I liked the most is their rice tea.. it has a sweet taste to it.   Overall, a nice, clean atmosphere.  Definitely a place to eat if I am in the area looking for a nice Vietnamese restaurant.

_8ZW8-619MU6TVklw8viqg.text: My husband and I are vegetarian and come in about once a week. We appreciate the options we have here, from curry, to a vegetarian springroll/rice vermicelli bowl, to vegetarian pho (with a vegetable broth). I  can say that we've been impressed with the food - our veggies are always very fresh and crisp.

NDYEyK_4zlnzLDVc6e3Bbg.text: I think this is one of the top 3 Pho places in Vegas  The broth is amazing. I talked to the owner and she said they start the broth for tomorrow at 5pm today. The spices are baked (maybe toasted?) before they are added to the broth. You can't get better unless you go to Spring Mountain.  I haven't tried much on the menu because the soup is too good, but friends I have gone with have told me that the non-soup food is good also.

eAnMkRbK1M4r6cGXCutLog.text: My husband and I really enjoyed everything... My husbands ex wife is vietnamese and a great cook and this is great food. we had pho was rich and delish. The spring rolls with shrimp were as fresh as it gets. I had a beef dish with red rice, the beef was really tastey and tender, the red rice is made with tomatoes I was told it was great.

kCBueMz-siEuPtgs8wB-9g.text: They're getting a 2 only because I have had very limited experience with Pho, and it could just be I don't like what's considered good Pho, so yeah I'd give a 1, but still take this with a grain of salt. Broth was almost tasteless and what you could taste was too sweet.  Noodles were clumped together, and the menu is just too big to have anything of real quality in my opinion.  I understand that most were the same with small variations, if that's the case have the variations as toppings.  Condense something. Atmosphere is really weird, as this used to be a diner, and the seating is pretty cramped. I can't recommend this place, but again, my experience with vietnamese food is limited.  Granted my friends with me who had been to more places like this said it was sub-par.

EX-93SAuTmzAb1jWzDlPDw.text: This place is awesome!   Green tea, great soups, banh mi sandwiches and great dishes.   Stand outs include the 75 spicy soup (unbelievable flavor) , 88 chicken chili lemongrass, and all the pho.   It's inexpensive and a great place to eat. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chili Lemongrass 88

sBhNzQKrNPLRk670GhqHqA.text: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant on my side of town! At some point this place changed business owners and there were some inconsistencies such as a noticeable change in their pho broth, hence the lower rating.   - Spring Rolls: Love their version! They add a crunchy element in the middle and it is yummy! Add sriracha to the peanut sauce for an extra kick.  - Pho: I used to really like their pho broth.  It is not as flavorful anymore.  The pho tai (rare beef), seafood, and vegetarian pho are all good.   - Vermicelli bowls:  Flavor bomb and great noodles. Their noodles are thin and soft, while other places have hard, thicker noodles.  My go to is the charbroiled pork with egg rolls.  I highly recommend the beef lemongrass vermicelli bowl if you're not afraid of flavor!  The sweet, vinegar, fish sauce that comes with the bowls is yummy...pour it all in the bowl and mix everything up. I love the freshness of the veggies and all the different textures going on.  - Beef crispy egg noodles: I really like this dish, but they are a bit stingy with the "gravy."  I like the center to be slightly softened by the brown sauce, with outer edges still crunchy.  They tend to serve this dish with not enough sauce, with a center that is still very crunchy.  Service isn't the best, but food usually comes out in a timely manner.  Pay for your meal at the counter after you're done eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prices are increasing. Hmm...
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef lemongrass vermicelli
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho tai

QMNrQjfLg1qDWl1n-wJ0Vg.text: I read reviews of this place that they had a vegetarian pho, and I had to get down here to try it out!   When you arrive to this place, it looks like a diner. With that, you can't miss it.  I get inside and immediately asked how many.  I told them to go and they directed me to the bar to place my order.  At first, the lady seemed a little cold, but lightened up a little later on, asking if we would like anything to drink while we waited.    After a little wait, my food is ready. I am anxious to try it. I also ordered spring rolls with no pork it them. When I got home, and prepared everything, dug in, oh my goodness. It was so good! I said how did I not know about this place? They give you all the fixings too. The spring rolls with that peanut sauce. Delish! the whole concoction was just so good. I will definitely be making the drive over there to get some more!

86BUwK9aTkIXlodCVkdpMQ.text: This place gets a lot of 3 stars, but I am giving them the 4th star for being open on CHRISTMAS day. They are also open on New Years, and Thanksgiving (but closes early). We went outside of the box and didn't get Pho. If you are feeling adventuresome, order Bo Nhung Ram, which is a build your own spring rolls and cook your own meat. It was so tasty, and done with plenty of veggies and sides. Good as any place in Bolsa.   Bun Thit Nuong, the meat was grilled to perfection, bun was soft, veggies are fresh Goi Cuon - spring rolls. 4 stars, Peanut sauce was 3 stars  Thank you for opening up in the South East of Las Vegas so I didn't have to drive 30 minutes to Spring Mountain Road to get vietnamese food. I don't mind the 50's diner thing, just happy you were open Christmas day to break up all the Ham/Turkey meals we were eating at parties.

VXzGQ4d6kgJj7q-_yR_WCw.text: My new go-to Vietnamese Restaurant. I have to drive pass 4 Pho places to get to here and it's worth it. Great value as far as portion goes and great tasty food.

ZALFWVz5CD6uiVPnExLKzw.text: Love this place!  I've been coming here for years, but I haven't done a review before.  The overall quality of the food has gotten better over the years, as has the service.  There is a slight odor when you first walk into the place, but not untypical of an Asian restaurant.  The overall price point of the food and the quality of it are top notch.  We love getting the spring rolls, any of the rice dishes, and the Pho.

Xjus7s3GaU7l9ezNk4bZQQ.text: Yea. Just don't. Food is bland. Service is horrible. Guy at the counter is rude and wouldn't let us eat at the bar top.. "why eat here? Plenty booth available!?" Not worth the time of effort. I understand turn key business but put some effort into a little remodel.

xIOumJ9vnKJUIPRwG7HZBw.text: The food has a very homemade, cooked with love kind of taste.  I wish I could say the same about the service.  The waiter seems annoyed when we ask for refills.  He seems angry that he has to be here. The older lady who I believe is the owner is a sweetheart. I would give this place 5 stars if it wasn't for the service.

ELoIGXF6p1fcRTlORkPWRQ.text: Not a bad place to eat, you probably wouldn't notice it. But the set up and place looks like a retro burger joint, but the food was pretty good. No issues with it. Thai tea was amazing compared to other places... customer service though..? Not that professional at all but I guess it's just how they are.

aAAfOcXUW8sSfvEGbIxsvw.text: Food is not too bad. My biggest beef is w the service... it just sucks. I ordered a take out at 1230 pm. Picked up 39 mins later... no customers at the restaurant. Walked in, zero greeting.  I announced my to-go order and he brought it to the cash register, still no spoken word from this salt/pepper crew cut server. I paid. No thank you from him whatsoever. Clearly this place lacks customer service... but to this degree is just a lack of respect for its customers. Disappointed.

idvxLpI3mkxtoEpTQzl_eA.text: Gosh if there was ever a 0 star rating on YELP it would definitely be for this place. I've been a regular here with my roommate for a few weeks now and last night we walked in to an empty restaurant with no patrons. I've been suffering from a cold the past few days and thought a nice bowl of hot soup would do me some good. I sat in my usual booth but the ceiling fans were turned on full blast so I asked if we could move to another booth which is reasonable especially if you have allergies and a cold.   Here's what really shocked me besides the soggy noodles and rancid tasting wontons: The male cook in the back. He was loud and boisterous and spoke Vietnamese clearly within range of an earshot and talks very badly about customers that dine here. After the lady took my order, he proceeded to talk about me and my roommate bashing us and saying we are bad customers. He also said a bunch of nasty things that were very shocking. He called us lousy customers cause one time my roommate asked for extra napkins and also extra veggies with our chicken pho which we happily paid for.   I can't believe how rude this chef was. The thing is, I speak fluent Vietnamese and understood everything he was saying. He probably thought I did not understand or speak his language but regardless here's the deal: If you work in the restaurant industry and bash your regular customers by talking smack about them while they are dining in your restaurant, you have no business working in this field. I was very shocked, we could barely finish our meal and needless to say we will never support this restaurant again. There are much better places in the area especially the Pho place down the street by LVAC that will treat you will kindness and respect. From the lack of customers this place definitely is on it's way downhill. They definitely lost a loyal customer for life.  If you ask for anything extra or order extra sides, just know this CHEF will talk badly behind you back or perhaps even spit in your food. ( Seriously he is THAT kind of person ) I noticed reviews here that have stated the service is beyond rude and and it's totally True, it's lousy and disrespectful especially when customers are paying out of their pockets to help keep you in business. Not sure where these people learned hospitality but it really shows that they are lacking in that department severely. BEWARE when you eat here. Horrible experience all all around.

a3PzMTrHBDvRmmb5ypTPFw.text: Food - High Average  Restaurant/Environment - Unique yet bland  Service - Hit or Miss, depends if that is a big deal to you or not honestly. Doesn't really ruin meals for me.   Will return and recommend but I do have other favorites in the area that come before Lemongrass Cafe.

s_dQUkibPsgSXuuv-40qlA.text: This is one of our spots to go to!  Family owned restaurant.  We are regular here, they have ways treated us kind.  The pho broth is two tumbs up!  Broth is always consistent!  And I also love their ice coffee, sweet and strong!

rgMoGKa9dnmxHcgQY3OEug.text: For pho, you can't go wrong. The prices are incredibly reasonable. We always get the spring rolls egg rolls and pho. I think this is a family ran business because we always have the same servers and we always see the same staff. They're really friendly. I've never had my order come out wrong. The food comes hot and quick. This place looks like an old 50s diner that they turned into a Vietnamese restaurant. It's not decorated to nice but it's clean. The restrooms are always very clean. When you want some Vietnamese food at a reasonable cost with no frills this is a great place

HP8W-6xqriSV72wMV5uIAQ.text: I had lunch here on a weekday with some coworkers. I had no idea this place existed and it was in a shopping center that I frequent. The building is unassuming in an old diner's location.  I started with iced tea. It was very sweet and I liked it once I got past it not being the typical tea. For my lunch I chose the chicken noodle bowl which reminded me of a deconstructed Pho. Everything in the bowl was very tasty and very fresh. It came with a carrot sauce on the side for dipping. All other sauces were served on the side to add as you please as well. I liked being able to choose my own flavors.  Pricing was very reasonable. The waitress that served us was very sweet and took good care of us during our visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Noodle Bowl

3scYRNtHXhiHJcanfiD97g.text: There's not a lot of meat in the hu tieu and it doesn't have the authentic taste. The bun bo hue is okay but spicy even though they offer me a not spicy choice.

sslANTnNG3-BciuwWG3j7Q.text: so yummy! went with a  couple friends on a weekday night and service was pretty good, pho was great and the spring rolls were delicious. we will be back!

5FXY_pu2xa4nTe0x80m1CA.text: This is a great restaurant that serves amazing Vietnamese food....The service isn't the best, but lets be honest. You come for the food and as long as the service isn't horrible its fine....Prices are on par where they should be. The Pho is excellent here...I was disappointed that they took the 7 Course Beef dinner off of the menu. Must've not been a popular choice...A lot of people don't know about it but truly, if you like salad rolls, you'd love the 7 Course Beef dinner....Its off the strip, but its worth the drive...

HSojC26OnGEgYT2i-hOJOg.text: Slow service even when it wasn't busy and I didn't order much. Also disappointing they dont have simple condiments/sides for what I ordered.

eGvYr0wnOr9KVaaMsOAbdQ.text: This spot was really good! Their brisket and flank fell apart as you ate it and was super flavorful. The broth was also delicious, didn't have to add anything to it except a little sriracha for some spice. My kids ate their stir fry noodles like they hadn't eaten in days lol and the price was right too. 5 adults and 4 kids and our bill was $89, not bad at all for all those people. Will definitely return here, especially after a night of drinking that requires good pho the next day haha.

sOzxEShMItwegnW9aBwBrA.text: Okie Dokie,  let's rock and roll.  1.  Ambiance - Looks like a modern or ancient Route 66 diner. The setting is so odd compared to the food.  2.  Space - ton of space for your peeps.  No worries there.  3.  Service -  Come on, it is an asian place. Not bad.  4.  Food - Went here several times. with kids and then my son's friends for his birthday.  5 adult non noodle kids scarfing down pho like it was the only meal in town.  Does that say enough?  Broth - great.  Noodles - Great.  Thai Ice Tea - Nice yet expensive.  5.  Price - Not too shabby except too many Thai Ice Tea!!!  You cannot go wrong here, so if you have time before or after a movie at the Colonnade 14 nearby, you gotta check this place out!

cDbMIs3TSq16SwqkA0osuA.text: Crazy delicious and oh so fresh. No MSG bomb served here. Good quality ingredients and made to order. Oh and free tea!. I'm a life long pho fan and this is the only place in Henderson that I will eat at. Believe me you will not be disappointed.

wQWj2x6sQxhPETAXIYtJvw.text: When in today to get rice and garlic chicken with an order of egg rolls , let me tell you that shit hit the spot ! The sauce for the egg rolls was THE BOMB ! I recommend this to anyone ! I'll be back for more egg rolls and garlic chicken especially the egg roll sauce .

-BHFD2ikQRgyFTduS9Mlgg.text: Decent comfort food 10 minutes from the strip!  Had the spring rolls, egg rolls, and pho (#39, rare steak).  The spring rolls are a decent size. Not huge but hits the spot.   The pho is good. The broth has good flavor although tastes a but salty.  Thai tea is on point!  Service was good, food came out fast, and the staff was helpful.  No complaints here.

B_pPisbJhVDfNDX-vD7QfA.text: Good Pho and spring rolls. My wife, sons and I enjoy this place when we need a Pho fix. This place is very convient since it's right by my house. Good service and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Dac Biet. Very good soup

h3InSDNixk11OY4fWWi9qQ.text: I had the Bun Bo Hue and it was perfect...just the right amount of spiciness and full of flavor! Would definitely be back for more.

imjBr-XJNv4qsmboQxb2CA.text: These guy's broth is the best I've ever had! My only complaint is how fast they take to serve when I dine in. However; if you're having diner and want time to discuss business or enjoy some conversation before eating then this place might be good for you. The taste of their food is absolutely worth the wait. if you decide to do takeout they are reasonably quick to get your order ready for pick up. I personally love this place and how homely their staff is.

oBQ5l2SZ-tyiotcB8hruLg.text: This place has horrible customer service. Wasn't greeted by the host, no one came to take our drinks, we waited for 25 minutes and still no one came.  We left very unhappy. Didn't get to try their food, but it wasn't worth dealing with their bad service.

QseMllUR_YfN6cDtMAptFA.text: They stayed open late for my pickup order one night after class. Thank you!  I love the all american decor! It doesn't fit pho at all but makes me smile. Their food is good and reasonably priced. I had the plain chicken pho and would recommend it again.

zWWVLKteoO0Oql02S8zP1A.text: My first time here.  Didn't care for it at all, even though I love Vietnamese food!  We were the only ones in the restaurant and it was around 6 p.m.  It took more than 20 minutes for the food to arrive, even though we were the only customers!  Our orders were wrong.  The portions were way too small.  The broth for Pho was way too dark and salty.  We had Bun Xao Thap Cam and there was 2 shrimps and the Com Chien also had 2 shrimps!  Also, the imitation crab in my Bun Xao was still so cold, nver had that happened before!   Definitely not a place I will patronize again.

tdQVZ5giopY9j3MvId-KgQ.text: PHO was good, just not great!! The service was a little lacking as well. Overall, it was a good dinner and reasonably priced.

R0TWkAkeRA4jTeNC8Gc-rg.text: This place was fine, but I wouldn't say much separates it from two other Pho places in the vicinity on Eastern : Pho Little Saigon and Pho Saigon 8. The service was fine, beef pho was enjoyable -- I would say the broth was more flavorful than the two places mentioned and wasn't as salty as the other two. The prices were between 8.95 and 10.95 for a bowl of pho or vermicelli with choice of meat. They also offered complimentary Jasmine tea which was great. It did not stand out as a place where I can't wait to go back, but I also wouldn't be opposed to coming back here. A-OK.

hZfioy35jbObqLtpQ_vh1g.text: Wow, this is the best Vietnamese food over ever had.  From the very fresh spring rolls, to the best vermicelli with pork and fried spring rolls, and the taste I had of my Dad's pho, this is absolutely delicious food.  Next time I'm in Vegas, this is my first stop!

stJUPt-p54MxTJry1Go6Lw.text: I am from the Bay Area, and have eaten some good Vietnamese food in my time. My wife and I were excited to try this place after reading the positive reviews on yelp. Outside, it still has the appearance of the previous Diner that used to occupy this location. Despite its appearance on the outside, I was willing to give it a try. After all, sometimes the best places are those "hole in the wall" spots.   Walking in, I was encouraged by all the people dining in the restaurant.  Once I received a menu from a distracted employee, I was really hopeful that this was going to be my new favorite place.  The menu offered so many wonderful choices that sounded amazing in print. Problem is- the dishes we chose did not live up to our expectations.  I chose the lemongrass chicken chili -since we were at a lemongrass cafe. The dish consisted of pieces of chicken that were cooked with white onions and spices. Not gross, but not good. The sauce was too thick and was more like a paste. My wife opted for the lemongrass beef with noodles. The dish was cold and not what she was hoping for.    The service was horrible. The guy came to the table and says "you ready"?  I asked him a question on the two dishes that I was debating on. His response was that everything on the menu was good. Ok pal, that didn't help at all. Our drinks were not refilled until we were done with dinner-which bugs me.   Perhaps we didn't choose the best dinners off the menu, but I have to imagine that the service will still suck-"if" we do come back.

XXEGWd61OUsRj9KaiwPDZg.text: One of the better Pho places around town. It's especially close to where I live. Not only Pho, but other rice and noodle dishes, as well as bahn mi. Good flavors and the food here is pretty fresh. The pho was tasty, the broth was well done and tasted home made (some places use the powdered base, you can tell when the broth is salty). Crisp vegetables and fresh meat. Service is also attentive. All in all, its a good place.  Btw, this place used to be a diner. When your in here it's an interesting ambiance.

hCvB-HXU9U8rA9MVkolWow.text: MmmMm! I've never had a juicy vietnamese sandwich before.  I've always been picky on what sandwich I should eat, and usually I go for the pork.  But this time I went for the grilled beef and OMG yes it was good.    For an (asian) restaurant, yes I was surprised to say it was clean. The people were great, and our food came out within 15 mins of ordering.  Sadly I only ordered a sandwich, but it does guarantee another return!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Beef Sandwich

Sq_SubVcWmvERfUG7RypgQ.text: Was on my way into Vegas from Orange County and had a mad craving for some pho. Found this place through Yelp and decided to take a chance (Orange County has a the best pho in my opinion). On the outside and inside it looks like it used to be a Ruby's Diner of some sort. The staff was nice and the service fast. The pho was actually pretty good! The broth was decent and the noodles and meat were awesome. I am definitely going to remember this place whenever I am in Vegas. Great remedy for a hangover too!!!

UX9Kr-J47rDmcMyyjDN0oQ.text: Great if you want to get food fast that is not "fast food". And it's pretty healthy too.  :)  I always get the spring rolls and a small Chicken Pho.... love it.  The rolls are fresh and crunchy. The Pho is hot and filling.   (Note: the large is LARGE... it can easily feed 2 people.)  I like that you can make the soup as spicy as you like by adding the jalapenos and hot sauce.  The Pho broth is clear and has good flavor on its own but like I mentioned... you can make it spicy.  The chicken pieces are big and plenty. The noodles are not that exciting but hey... they are noodles...   Food: 4 stars Service: 3 stars (this isn't the Ritz) Ambiance: 3 stars (see above) Ease of parking and getting in and out of: 5 stars Price: 5 stars (My husband and I can fill up and have 2 non-alcoholic beverages for under $20)  Will I be back?  You bet!  During the cooler months, I like to go about once a week.

slFPM-jeQT0efLnerPMrnA.text: Dropped on for a quick lunch with my wife. We shard shrimp and pork egg rolls. I orders #68 - vermicelli with pork, pork sausage and egg roll. My wife got vermicelli with beef. The appetizer was light, fresh and delicate, an excellent starter. My vermicelli was full of fresh vegetables. More importantly, the pork was tender, full of flavor and excellent quality.  Only negative (and it's a small one) is that it took a while to place our order and we were a bit rushed. Waitstaff were very friendly, but not overly attentive. If I could give 4 1/2 stars, I would.

UMfW3tTETap8zQzPkUnUNQ.text: My family decided to try this place finally after the reviews we saw on yelp. We usually go to Pho So 1 or Saigon 8. We don't change when we find a good place, but We thought we give it a chance and decided to go and order our usual: vermicelli with egg roll/beef, lemongrass chicken & rice, bowl of pho with meatball/rare beef, and the seafood pho (this was the only thing new). The wait was so long. Other places pho comes out in 10 minutes. My hubby also order banh mi sandwich and bean dessert drink.   Banh mi came out in 20 minutes. It was good. Another 20minutes went by and finally our order came out.  The food didn't look so fresh. Seafood pho was suppose to have crab, shrimp,fish cake, and calamari. It was not what I was expecting(imitation crab, 2 pieces of shrimp, 2 piece each! Soup base wasn't rich and the rice dish didn't even come with soup. Oh well, then we sat for awhile and not dessert drink. We paid and left.   I don't think we will go back there again.

8DNkON4qHBmyXEGARRM8hA.text: If you are looking to eat Vietnamese food and live in the south east side of town this is the best place to go..  They have the best fresh spring rolls, mango salad, pho and spicy beef dish in this area.  There are other Vietnamese restaurants in the area and they are HORRIBLE.. and I mean HORRIBLE. This is a really good place without having to drive to spring mountain. And if you mention YELP they will give you a 10% discount.

tFBuYKpXh35E-wv21JgCbg.text: We have given this place several try's. I have really wanted to like it, it's  close to my house and took over a cute old diner. The service here is just  bad and saying that about a pho spot is kind of redundant. However that only fly's when you are in Chinatown. We actually waited 20 min for our food after we ordered?!? For a bowl of Pho?? Usually it's on the table 30 seconds after you order it. There may have been six pieces of meat in my small bowl. Which besides the ammount of broth was the same as the large bowl. Then they come around to vacuume by our table at 9:00? They close at 10 and are telling people at 9:45 they will have to get the food to go(they went somewhere else....go figure). As far as the food it's just OK. I have eaten in Pho places all over and some are a little better than others but they are all pretty much the same. Just give me a large portion with pleanty of vegg on the side and I'll be happy. Pho 8 opening across the street is gonna put a serious crimp in thier numbers. Or maybe it already has they were basicly empty when we were there?!?

92T7JYvPMI6zUqF6uFmGKQ.text: We ended up here by accident; a very lucky accident.The original destination was Ali-Baba's next door but they were closed. We were almost the only people there and the service was great. We each got our favorite noodle dish (#66 & 68 here) and they were both perfect. It was nice to find such great food in an old Denny's Diner

_wL-8MSpihY9z1STAqa6vQ.text: Been coming here since it opened. Best Pho ever! Way better then Pho kim long. I drive from the Northwest part of town for this bowl of goodness. And you should too. And its in a super cute dinner car.

bHzAEgMGziSIwdiBPTRZLg.text: Our favorite pho place to eat! Spacious . Great staff. Like family. Not as busy as Pho Saigon 8 up the street and most time their service is...ugh alright. I like the pho here better. The meat seems more tender. Overall, my fav pho close to my place.

sEA2jW7SKqgpkk2zWtZFHA.text: We have been there twice now. Friendly staff and great food. Tried the seven courses of beef, it was delicious! And the three colored dessert is one of our favorites.

5ReqagHfdMbw4GGu2__Xmw.text: A retro style diner from the outside, a Vietnamese Pho restaurant inside. The pho was just good. My family liked theirs more than I did. So next time we'll try other items on their menu.

IVGgUdZYV4fm3DuVxWgfWA.text: i used to go here a lot (like every other night) until recently made my own pho at home. i hate to say this but their pho soup is inconsistent. sometimes its good but sometimes it tastes just bland. other than the pho, i get other dishes that are also good on the menu... spring rolls, summer rolls, spicy beef soup, beef stew, this mango shrimp salad (yummy) and pork chops. so many to list. i love the owner, she is the sweetest and she's also from hawaii too!

9C1J9wp_xmYMkPf3HjlZyA.text: This place definitely gives all the chinatown spots a run for their money.. the food is amazing and its CLEAN!! If you're hating on this spot then u don't know how to eat or your family probably owns Pho kim long or some ish.. Have I mentioned the fresh squeeze Limonade and oj? they literally go squeeze them by hand right after u place the order! Now thats service folks!! Ask DJ Dig dug, Melo D and Kimcess! We ate there 4 times last week! Big shout out to DJ Crooked and Kenny @ Knyew! Word to yo motha!

ogTPyzPS_5VPwzEjdH70qg.text: This review is way past due but as always before I speak i want the facts to not waiver and one thing for sure is the food at Lemongrass does not waiver - my family and I have eaten at Lemongrass a minimum of twice a month if not 4 to 6 times a month since they opened and can honestly say have NEVER had a bad meal!  My son always gets chicken spring rolls and #41 Pho with nothing green!  They are so go to make every dish exactly as you wish, down to the noodle and extra vegtables.    The friendly atmosphere adds to the dining experience where the owner is on the floor and doesn't hesitate to pull up a chair or join you in your booth.    Lemongrass is always the restaurant of choice when we eat out!  Thank you for bringing vietnamese food to my family!

ZQ1J8H8NaciasWcodLRkbA.text: I moved away a few months ago but I ate here probably hundreds of times since they opened and never had a bad experience. I miss my pho chay, spring rolls and iced tea!  If you guys at lemongrass are reading this, I miss you tons! Keep up the good work and I hope to see you again one day soon....

2nqQONBJUdUmBFKg1mEBMA.text: I decided to have a food adventure with my girlfriend and based on all the positive Yelp reviews, we picked the lemongrass Cafe. I am so glad we did!! We had the most wonderful experience. It was our first time at a vietnamese restaurant and our server , Lisa was super helpful! We ordered the shrimp toast as an appetizer. When it came out it also had gorgeous fresh herbs and lettuce on the plate.Lisa explained to us that you wrap the shrimp toast in the lettuce with the fresh herbs and use the dipping sauce. I never would have known what to do!! Let me tell you, IT WAS DELICIOUS!!! The bread it was on was fantastic !  We decided to try the pho, my first time! It was a warm bowl of goodness! Once again, Lisa was super helpful and so friendly and told us we might want to put some cirracha (sp?) hot sauce in our pho...this just added another yummy dimension. We also met the owner, Tansy, she was a lovely woman also. Let me say that our adventure was awesome! I cant wait to go again!!!

lKiDwr4JJScyhxPoiyul1g.text: Best Pho in Begas! Far better than the one in Chinatown! The broth is soo comforting! We always get the combo meat on he outside! The owner and the wait staff are sooo gracious! It's quite a drive out but it is soo worth it!! A must to get your pho craving fixed!!

xngeg9pdLBGKvM4FpYO2Hw.text: Okay, this place is f*cking awesome. The food is great, Chicken Pho is my fave, but there's this one lady that works there that is an absolute bitch, and she treats me like shit every time she serves me (which isn't too often) Anyway, besides her, I definitely recommend this place.

mClyl-p54ac69wkBivbWoQ.text: The other night had pho tai and the number 89 (I think). Pho was okay. But this number 89 Chicken dish was absolutely amazing.

hZT-CeQdkMcaujSg_VESjw.text: Their rice dishes are really good and service is great

mUcedn7wbmqbF2jh-yWIog.text: Decided to try Lemongrass Cafe as it is in our neighborhood and we were looking for something different.  I thought the food was very good (as did my wife and child).  We had the spring rolls with peanut sauce, a large bowl of chicken pho, and the vermicelli with grilled pork and pork meatballs.  Everything was very good quality and the wait staff and owner were very friendly.  The pork meatballs in the vermicelli were particularly good - lean, good texture and flavorful.  In fact, all of the ingredients were fresh, of good quality and the meats were all very lean.  Nice mixed crowd of all types here as well - families, couples, etc...  Recommended for a good quality neighborhood restaurant, and something very different (in a very good way) from typical suburban Las Vegas restaurants.   Seemed to be a reasonable value as well for the quality.  This appears to be a good quality local small business that is important to support to have a diversity of choice and to support small businesses in Henderson.

I9alUBTH759vR2o3of5srw.text: This is the only Vietnamese place in Vegas that I know which has a complete menu, not just pho. There salads are good, as is the barbeque.  The staff is also very attentive.  Nice atmosphere too.

YB6ZQDpBHyNflyzjl2S1Nw.text: The greatest thing about Lemongrass is its location.  Being the first Vietnamese place in Henderson to my knowledge, it's great to save the 20 minutes going to Chinatown.  I had the grilled pork and eggrolls on vermicelli.  The dish itself was probably a 7 out of 10, but definitely tasty, fresh, and reasonable ($9).  The same dish is $6 or 7 at Pho So No 1, my favorite Viet cafe in town.  The service was decent.  We had to get the waitress' attention a couple of times for water/napkins, but it wasn't a big deal.  She was very attentive once we got her attention.  When I must have Vietnamese, I will go to Pho So No 1.  However, if I want the food and experience without the driving, Lemongrass is a grea substitute.    Also, the diner building is kind of weird with the club lighting inside, but it's cool.  Way to be green and take over an existing space instead of building more and more and adding to the vacant space in the Valley.

wUtwF2WDliT-k9t_ToTLqg.text: I eat here regularly and their spring rolls are the best in town! They are so good and fresh! Also the spicy lemongrass Beef and Pork dish are very good (88 or 89?). Pho is pretty good, but their are better places in town for that. Overall the prices are good, food is consistantly good, and the restaurant has a nice relaxed atmosphere.

pVyUTv3-QHZDz-D5ELA-Cg.text: i can't stand the way this place treats their customers. the pho here is awesome but the service is absolutely horrible. i usually place my order over the phone and pick it up. one day i arrived and i was standing there for nearly five minutes waiting to be acknowledged, even when the employees clearly saw me. not only do they fail to acknowledge their customers, but they're very rude. giving them another chance, i just called to place an order and the man who answered the phone was very short with me. he didn't ask for my name, didn't tell me when my order will be ready - nothing. when i got there, the parking lot was completely empty. it used to be full on weekends at night and now it is not; that should say something about how their business is going. before i left, the man dropped my change on the counter and didn't even say, "you're welcome" or "have a good night". it's VERY clear that customer service is not a priority at lemongrass cafe and i will not return, even though it's right down the street.

EyluW4bBbLX3bRfDQaElTg.text: The food here was average. We ordered egg noodle soup and chicken pho. The egg noodles were good, but I think the pho at the original Pho Saigon 8 is better (haven't been to the new one on Eastern yet). The restaurant is in an old diner building which was unexpected, but kind of cool (or different, anyway).  I agree that they take far too long to bring out your order. We waited about 20-25 minutes for our 3 items. If they didn't take so long I might have actually considered coming back.

zlKWeyylFsGsEj2VFdiz4A.text: Nicely decorated, very clean, and the food I ordered was generally good Vietnamese. You can tell the difference between this place and other pho shops.  Very good, but not the absolute best pho in town.  It might be second best so I will never hesitate to return.  The pho is not disappointing at all but the vermicelli dishes are very good. The staff was very nice and service was prompt.  They were attentive but not pushy.

4zdiqUjRgQnFupZYSUmpKQ.text: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant. Most likely the best Vietnamese food in Las Vegas.  I would highly recommend you try this place.

PWVqCC6xbHoVdDtsC0rM3g.text: This was really good beef pho!  And served in the weirdest ambience of a 50's diner that played what seemed like karaoke tune tracks!  The strangeness was outbalanced by the deliciousness.  Add in a little (lot) of chili paste and let the sweat fly here, you won't regret it.

IK65F6DShgUEBlI2SFg3kg.text: 6 months ago, we ate here and there was a nasty stench of raw sewage and insence. (not working as a cover-up) Tried it again and stink was gone. Went back today and the smell was so bad that we immediately turned heel and walked out.  the people walking in behind us left too. Bummer, because we love the pho and ban xiao (spelling?).  Owners, pay whatever it takes to fix this problem, and we will be back!

Q-hhTwG-aNYvbJp2Q5mkqA.text: Been here twice so I'm guessing that means I like it..  But it is the only decent pho joint on the east side that I've come across..  Til I eat somewhere better, it'll stay at 4 stars..

P-agX6hDxHN83f_PP7seEg.text: I had my first bowl of Pho here. Although I have to admit that I have had better pho since then, I love coming here. The staff and owners are great and the pho is very consistent. I need pho to live!!   About their competition across the street - they have good pho too but the service is not nearly as good. Thanks Lemongrass, see you soon. We think you have the best pho in town.

qNdNYdpHg3SAn69HdVjF_g.text: I've been here probably four times, mostly because I don't want to drive all the way to Spring Mtn. I felt compelled to write this review after my last and final visit. The service is as bad as everyone has mentioned. The owner/server does not greet you or smile. He will eventually make his way over and say "ready?". He will never return until 20 minutes later when the soup comes out. I am pretty sure they dont have to make this to order. Soak the noodles, add the broth and rare beef and serve. It can come out in 5 minutes. While I waited I began to notice the mini-blinds were so dirty and then I started wondering what else was dirty. When the large bowl of pho I ordered to share with my youngest arrived, it had like 4 slices of beef. I asked the owner if this was right since I ordered a large. He says that is normal. No attempts to fix it. Well I won't be returning and the food is just meh!

IgjPZDnqvA-co4jqbMgwHA.text: I would almost give this a place an additional star for the cool old school diner building that it resides in.  If I lived in Henderson, this place is where I would go for pho.  Of course that is how I determine whether I would return to a Vietnamese restaurant.  If they can't get that right, then no point in returning.  The broth had good flavor and the Thai tea I ordered didn't come out of a can. Good portion of noodles and meat, and they gave me a lime.  I can't stand places that give out lemons.  I've been running across that a lot lately. They do have a decent sized menu that include banh mi's.

2uRAmRvWrqKDoKXUI6-4Jw.text: this place deserve no star at all but yelp is making me to give out star so i have to , Me and my wife was here lastnight start off with some appertizer everything went by good , after our entree has arrived i tasted the broth and it was straight up bland so i ask for some salt to reseasoning again  the meat was tateless the brisket were old they have turn into yellow so terrible, this is my first time and i think i will never return , the service was good . dont come here if u dont wanna get sick of eating old food

BQeLUecFPLEkp4Rpi1gEdg.text: 50's Dinner decor Vietnamese menu Interesting mix Pho was good Ice Vietnamese Coffee was good Service was good Buhn mi OK, but I wouldn't buy it again here.

78Z-c5TwJYGBt6zVw_mVoA.text: So disappointing!!!! The first time I came here I ordered a rare steak pho and it was okay. I have had way better but I thought I'd give it another shot and order something else. I got for my boyfriend and I the eggrolls, bahm niet, and lemongrass steak. The eggrolls were bland, the bahm niet had only one thin long strip of meat so all I really got to taste were the cilantro and cucumber but that's not even the worst one. The lemongrass steak which was 11.95 was disgusting!!!!! The meat was spoiled!!!! How can you sell spoiled meat!!!! I just hope I don't get food poisoning or something!!! Needless to say I am never going back to this place ever again!!!!

gK8Co7ZnR-N6_kprN1qwOQ.text: My husband and I have been here a million times (ok, maybe not). We have ordered many different items including pho, noodle bowls, spring rolls, fried rice and even flan and mango ice cream for dessert. Everything we have ordered has been good. I highly recommend the mango ice cream!

q28hp2YC-JlAss6N8-WASQ.text: Large selection of Viatnamese food to include Pho.  Priced under $10 per dish.  It was good food for the price.

wAHT3OVoVWh6Iu5w63Bwew.text: Their pho menu is pretty legit. Spring rolls are good. Iced coffee was delish (= their customer service could use some help tho...doesn't take much to smile, people! shheesh! -_-

7IoSQDhqTcAeWhxRw9f-EQ.text: A few people recommended me this restaurant, and I must say that I am a fan. The design of the building reminds me of a 50s diner from New Jersey, but it's decorate inside to change the exterior look. The menu has a nice selection. You get a huge portion for the price. The food is good. It's nothing awesome to rave about, but it's not so-so either. I would definitely return. It's a good place for a person on a budget.

sY8asXRadcI65cQ8cydmPQ.text: Way off the strip and Chinatown area but well worth the drive.  Bun Bo Hue was perfect.  Vermicelli with Egg Rolls was awesome.  Don't get any Vietnamese sandwiches.  They are stingy on the meat, tiny, and the bread is very chewy and doughy.  These sandwiches are not for the gluten-sensitive diners.

iJWVDZ8o6_cFXm0m7-RRxA.text: With all the restaurants that closed, i don't know why this place is still open. The food sucks here. We ordered rare beef & tendon soup and seafood crispy egg noodles. The soup and the sauce they put on the noodles are very salty and the meat, seafood and veggies are not fresh. The seafood taste like frozen food. After the food was served, nobody even came to our table to ask us how's the food or if we need anything else and there were only 6 customers (including us) in there so they can't say they are busy.  Maybe they knew their food is bad and they don't want to hear it from us. Pricey too.  Would not recommend this place and will never go back here. Pho Saigon 8 which is less than a mile away from this restaurant is alot better or go to Spring Mountain...lots of choices.

8GFcvpxjyvEzjbuRPReq5Q.text: Loved the Shrimp Pho and Shaken Beef.  The service was great and food arrived quickly.  I went with my 10 year old and she has a high sensitivity to smells.  When we walked in she wanted to walk out, because she said it smelled like mustard.  But, after eating our delicious meal she was happy!

WGY5KbICGW-PV_AKQpUFJQ.text: We got the won ton soup and pho tai to go and it was nicely packed with the broth separate from the meats and vegetables. When I got home we reheated the broth in the microwave, then added the other ingredients and it was really tasty.

MMzLB590HDxiEcXsmSex3g.text: Food here is great. I really like the woman who owns it, but service can be better. My favorite go to restaurant.

ZypOs6s5KaWhmtx6iOfcmQ.text: This place was great food! Definitely coming back here. Service was fast, food was tasty.  What we ordered:  Vegetarian egg rolls: solid, good appetizer  Vegetable banh mi and fried egg banh mi: really liked the fried egg banh mi :)  Tofu pho with veggie broth: best of the night! Got a large and was enough to split between three people  Shrimp stir-fry noodles: not a fan...was OK overall.  Young coconut drink: DELICIOUS!!  Thai iced tea: soooo good!

-2BRBqkhTlG40wNCJDXKgw.text: I visit here every couple of months from Oregon.  I am addicted to their spring rolls and egg rolls.  Every thing is really fresh and delicious.  I also usually get Pho and it's great too.  That's all I've had here. I'll get a bit more adventurous next time I come:)

tRaD1wixJMQTLf-bXNCiXw.text: That's gooood soup! Also good value for the money as well. I love a filling soup and was more used to Ramen but now I'm also a Pho-fan. The broth has a savory meaty flavor which is very important to me and just as equally (or actually more) important, they don't skimp on the meat!~ ^_^ It's also nice that you get a generous amount of extras, jalepenos, mint, bean sprouts, hoisin sauce, etc. to add in whether you ask for it or not.   I'm not sure how people are thinking the broth is too greasy/salty, all good broth is to a point, since that's where some of your flavor comes from and a bland soup broth is a big no-no. The only non-praise I have for this place is that you have to spend $10 to use a credit card and I also wasn't impressed with the spring rolls, too subtle of a flavor for me even with the sauce.  P.S : I wish they would stay open later! 11pm sounds perfect!~

2DX7-UmmsmtWyJEAfq5BbA.text: Great food, and great service. By far my favorite place in vegas

xN44P0cUln6wzJiKSEKHZw.text: I have been to this place twice & would probably be a regular if I didn't live on the other side of town. But, it is definitely worth the drive! The first time was pretty interesting. While taking pics of my food, for Yelp, I dropped my phone in the Pho!! Fortunately, it survived to take a few more before I had to shut it off to let it dry out ;)   I've ordered the same thing both times. Small Chicken Pho & BBQ Pork Banh Mi!  They offer plenty of Thai Basil, lime, sprouts & chili's. Sometimes even a bug or two hiding in them. Oh well, at least they don't charge for the extra protein ;)   They have a very extensive menu! Someday I hope to try their other offerings, but I just can't get away from those 2 delicious items I love so much :D   I definitely dig the 50's Diner look it has going on the outside ;) The service is a little sketchy, but overall they are pretty friendly. Regardless, they deserve everyone of my 5 stars & more!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm...BBQ Pork Banh Mi!!  Lol, taken after I dropped my phone in the Pho :P
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum, delicious Chicken Pho!! Right before my phone ended up in it :( Although, siracha is a much tastier addition ;)

tZnDmPojRDQTvHX51RyL9g.text: Went there for a quick bite at 8:30 after checking online that they close at 9pm, they locked the door as soon as we pulled to the parking lot. Cant grade the food.

M5h_vSoY4jp6jc9YJErNhA.text: Just came here for the first time; keep in mind I've tried plenty of pho places. This place was quiet nice. Very interesting 50's look. The pho  was pretty good as well. The best part is that The service was great. Nice servers. Overall, pretty nice pho place.

-F-uC-u5kcNVvMOUG_p4xQ.text: The Best place to get pho in Las Vegas! The place is Very clean and the food is always fresh. Service is great and friendly staff. They always accommodate us! I love this place! Simply amazing!

qjuMf_XIMHsMt0m4bD8muA.text: My family and I have been coming here for years and I guess it's just been such a regular staple for us that I forgot to review it. I love the food here. Everything I've ever had I is fresh and flavorful. My favorite is the #69.  If you're not used to Vietnamese cuisine but you're ok with stepping out of your comfort zone, you'll be pleasantly surprised with Lemongrass Cafe.

6y7Yz3J6bCaKPtsHl2ySpg.text: I am so disappointed in their customer service but their food is pretty good. I tried to get a small pho to go but they wouldn't do it if i got no meat....huh??? I can get a large no meat to go or a small with meat to go but no small without meat. She said "if i do it for you i have to do it for everyone ". I go here quite often and my bf fixed their freezer for free and all that, i couldn't get a small pho to go. With their restaurant empty, they allowed me to walk out instead of giving a small soup to go. Not good business skills! !

W0bxqV9y_6XspHFeW3ufBA.text: It's nice to have a family dinner but no kid menu makes it difficult. Aside from the extra expense the place is cool very 50's diner retro like. Food was good, traditional Vietnamese style. Very laid back and casual. Delicious spring rolls.
