6Cwat1t9xnctMrF7bQK_rg.text: Don't really see what's so good about this place. Order the small pho.. it was just ok. Asked for extra lime to make it taste better and got a half of a slice... the little lady that was there was so sweet, but as for the guy he was not.. I can say we will just keep going to pho sigon across the street.

TrzffQTI6yEDNW0_UgI6NA.text: When I am tired of gorging on crab legs, prime beef, and miniature desserts at Vegas buffets, I always come here. Pho All The Way!!! Three times in Vegas within a year and never a single time has this restaurant let us down on Vietnamese food.  Pho is always decent. I recommend their "bun" aka vermicelli, which is tasty and comes with a big portion. Customer service is friendly, sometimes a little ignorant when the restaurant is busy.

TrN1RZS-DWviEA_LsF08XQ.text: Dear Lemongrass Cafe,  I like this place but y'all need to stop vacuuming while I'm eating. I know that Las Vegas RJ review called your floors dirty. LOL!  But c'mon man, not while there's people trying to eat. It's loud, rude, and totally not acceptable. You should know better. That's like spraying lysol a few feet away from me to clean an area.   Best,  Mikey

NTYrRN3kWqvGtnRKHwN2kw.text: I love this place. The food is awesome. It's kind of a weird building for an Asian restaurant but don't let that keep you away. Pho, noodles, spring rolls, stir fried noodles. It's all delicious! The food comes out quick. Most of the staff is friendly and efficient. I drive out of my way for lunch all the time.

Ox95YU8iRpyvqO5yor0UKQ.text: Had heard about this place and read a few reviews and got excited about another New Vietnamese restaurant. I went there tonight and left totally disappointed. Ordered pho and fried, crispy tofu with nuoc mum sauce and got tea. It took forever so we finished our tea and asked for more, which never came until I reminded the senior lady that she took our pot and never returned. The tofu was way too soft and they gave us peanut sauce instead of the nuoc mum that we already had a discussion about. While seating there eating my pho, I watched the waiter put a straw in his mouth to pull the paper off and then put the straw in a drink and take it to a customer. That's pretty disgusting!  I am giving two stars because the pho was good but Will not be returning.

AcVVRTwIUyGCigWzz6xobg.text: Tasty pho! I liked how there were many meat combinations to choose from. Service was great our waiter was very attentive and was cracking jokes every now and then. I will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried egg rolls yum!!

rrOKLSaAF5lMcAnDNbYs3w.text: Almost just like Grandma makes it. Almost. I like to get the pho with brisket, as I find it's the best cut of meat for this delicious soup. The broth is flavorful and brings the meal together. They have especially delicious Thai tea here that definitely does not come from a bottle (I watched them make it behind the counter)! My only qualms are that the fish sauce is not strong enough and they don't allow debit transactions under $10...I even offered to add a tip to the total to make it reach beyond $10 and they said no. I know credit card companies charge the business for each transaction...but many people don't carry cash and it's a convenience factor to be able to pay with my card. Either way, the pho is delicious and I shall return again!

XHDcZ71mhq-h7qYLdGTDVA.text: If you're coming for average pho and some spring rolls you may be okay coming to lemon grass for lunch or dinner but if you're looking for a nice environment and great customer service, turn around. No one was friendly and we didn't even get a single smile. I felt like I was being watched during my meal. Also, if you have allergies or are sensitive to certain smells, beware that they light incense and they are very strong! On top of that, they act like they are afraid or too stingy to turn up the AC, we were sweating during our meal... gross. The most positive thing I have to say is that the prices are reasonable, although they did just raise them.

I0WYa4hCsDD8s7Rg82dzwg.text: This place is a hidden gem.  The staff and owner are very friendly and the food is amazing!!! I always come here to get my pho.  I highly recommend everyone to try this place out. You will not regret it.

-vHYxMuh_oaam_Nf96QT7A.text: This place is near my job... so i decided to give it a try with some co-workers..   Always passing by to go around the area.. i did not imagine this would be a Vietnamese restaurant.. Only because the setting inside and outside reminds me of one of those retro diner spots where someone comes out with roller blades or something.. ?  anyways, i was digging it.. walking in.. it was very quiet.. now it started to feel like one of the mid-west saloons.. to my left there was a bar and to my right is where a few people were sitting and eating..   we were seated by our host.. who then became our waiter.. and started us off with something to drink..   i got the combination special.. i also liked how there's an option for the size- regular or large.. so if you're really hungry.. go for the large or order two regulars i guess.. noodle broth ratio was really good.. the taste is as simple as pho can be.. and the meat was nice and tender.. vegetables and mint was fresh!  waiter seemed to be just about business.. because he was straight to the point.. and didn't really engage in a conversation.. could be a good or bad thing.. i didn't mind it..  everything went well until i found out that they don't accept a credit/debit card if the order was $10 or less... which was weird.. ill take the extra charge.. but to completely deny my card?.. not a fan of that.. so i ended up paying for one my co-worker's meal because he too did not have any cash.. with that said.. this place is a good cheap spot for pho..  enjoy!

ntV5iMxEDqSOmEdNBY6c7A.text: FREE TEA ALERT!!!! The iced tea here is complimentary. How awesome is that? Also, the tea tastes a little bit like an orange creamsicle. I think this place is pretty awesome food wise. The Pho is tasty, the price point is right on, they give you a plate of different goodies to add to your bowl. (Jalapeno, bean sprouts, lemon etc) The restaurant itself is an old converted 50's diner.  It could be a little cleaner, which is my major hiccup and complaint here. They were fairly busy though, so it doesn't appear to be a deterrent.  Overall, I think I'd give it another shot myself, but only if in the area.

LcfQtYkJovSshEml0NKy9g.text: My favorite local spot for Pho. Great portions, always good quality, great service. Quick, convenient, always fresh and consistent!

cAUyNyjKOk9Sy7rHxldJ0Q.text: Have driven by for years. Never gone in.   My wife was looking for Shrimp Toast. I searched on Yelp and they came up as having it.   Glad I did!  Not only was the Shrimp Toast great but the rest of the meal was also!  Have returned a few times since...always been great!  Glad I found it!

qhNagqXfu2l0jtHddpzXEQ.text: Located in an old fashioned American diner type building, the looks of this restaurant can be deceiving. At first, you walk into a throw back of American yesteryear. Then you realize that you're in a Vietnamese restaurant. Oh and the pho is good too.  On this particular trip, I ordered my usual. Steak and lean brisket pho, large size. The broth is very tasty and the meat is plentiful. Also, I ordered the vegetarian spring rolls which were not what I expected. I expected that the spring rolls would be deep fried but were actually wrapped like a summer roll. SO make sure you double check before ordering.  Lemongrass Cafe has a variety of Vietnamese options along with vegetarian dishes. Its a very complete menu that would satisfy everyone's palate. My go to spot on cold Vegas nights.

9sctCxYd1_uZpbfS_A_IyA.text: Obsessed, best pho I've ever had & the whole menu & vibe is amazing! Been going here for almost a decade & it's always perfect!

ggUF2nvIf-uEYxTKgXuDIg.text: Consistently good food. Consistently grumpy staff. Whatever - ignore them.  Good vegetarian options, but be sure to say "Vegetarian" or you may get the "vegetable" option (which might have meat broth).  The vegetarian Pho is delicious! I like the tofu- vegetables option. They are generous with the add-ins - basil, sprouts, peppers, etc.  Also very good is the Lemongrass Tofu - which is like a thick curry - not too spicy, but enticingly pungent, and redolent of lemongrass. I order it just so I can legitimately say "redolent".  This cute place needs a little updating. Some booths are held together with duct tape (literally).  Really 3.5 stars - slightly better than "A-OK" - rounded up for delicious Vegetarian Pho on a cold drippy day.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty vegetarian Pho with tofu and veggies (#59). Do not be fooled - this is not a thin, light soup. It is rich and hearty!

gFRdsfuJ3m2wCpOKGgASZw.text: It's been quite a while since I've eaten here so time to bring a newbie and check it out. The first thing I noticed was how many new businesses are in this jumble of strip centers. My friend drove herself and she had a difficult time just finding the restaurant since she's not been here before. I'll start by saying that in the past at 12:30 the place was jammin with a healthy lunch crowd comprised of what was typically a largely Asian crowd. This Monday we found the place literally empty other than the two of us. I heard the phone ringing a lot with orders to be picked up for takeout. This was definitely what was keeping the woman in charge busy as well as the guy helping her. I'd ordered two appetizers which arrived as my friend did and she sat down and we began to eat but she had no setup of silverware, napkin or drink and my iced tea was empty. We waited until finally flagging the woman down to the table and asked for a drink and a fork. She returned to her spot by the register and took up her task at hand and we waited until I finally got up and asked her for a fork. My friend commented perhaps this was why the place was empty. Service was not at all attentive and felt almost begrudging. I realized she and the guy both seemed preoccupied, likely from the prep of the takeout. You ask why I give 4 stars in spite of the service and I can honestly say I did not feel the woman was being rude, just very preoccupied plus the food was solidly good. We shared a vegetable crepe full of succulent mushrooms and sprouts, veggie egg rolls and some chicken/veggie fried rice. It was all delicious. So, I will come back for the food not warm friendly service which incidentally I've received from this very woman in the past. When she saw my empty iced tea she refilled it with water?! At one time there was a cool & friendly guy waiting tables here who I mentioned in my last review. Too bad he's gone but the good food is still here!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Colorful &amp; empty dining room @12:30
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front Station as you enter

RTVlZFaw-NF5ipb2APnuzQ.text: Small old 50s dinner now Pho Every thing is large portions  The broth is so flavorful  Smoothies are ok- nothing special to make me want to order another Still will go back the food is my Ultimate comfort food

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aQif-N9gDmOgfnw4tOeVSQ.text: Visted this restaurant yesterday with family. It was not what I expected upon seeing the building. It's an old style stainless american diner. It's set back from the street. You could miss it if it you aren't on top of your directions game.   Entering the restaurant we were greeted courteously and seated right away. I was surprised by how large their menu is. This is much more than just a Pho shop.  I had #68 vermicelli noodles with fried egg rolls, fried pork and sausage. The most pleasant thing about my dish was the lemongrass taste in the sausage. The eggroll and the pork were good standards in the big bowl.  Everyone in our group were very happy with the amount and quality of the food. The service was fast and the waiters were on point keeping drinks filled and clearing dishes.   The tab for three people, three huge bowls of food and one ice tea was under $29.00. This restaurant is a great choice when you can't or don't want to venture out of Henderson good Vietnamese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #68 Oh so yummy. The sausage makes it!!

4wxtiY3J9SrngsNIA5IptQ.text: Let me start my review with mentioning the location as it is a bit odd. Lemongrass is located in the same shopping center as the Regal Cinemas. It's in an old style diner building. Really upon first glance you wouldn't realize it's not a diner.   On to the review....  One of the main reasons I chose Lemongrass was because they have vegetarian options and I was really really craving pho.   Service was pretty straight forward. The servers don't really chat you up and aren't very outgoing, but they get the job done. The server who seated us quickly came over to take drink orders and then food orders. It was very straight to the point, sorta let's get your orders and move on, which I was fine with.   I ordered the vegetarian pho. The vegetarian option is made from vegetarian broth. I ordered it with tofu and mixed vegetables, which I recommend. The food came out rather quickly. The broth wasn't overpowering. I have been to other restaurants where the broth is too salty and/or too oily. This was not the case at Lemongrass. The vegetables were perfectly cooked and crisp. You could tell that they were fresh. It wad severed with all the trimmings, fresh bean sprouts, basil, etc.   On my newly adopted vegetarian lifestyle I was very happy to learn that there was still a place where I could get my long time favorite dish, pho.   Tip:  When I visited, the jasmine iced tea was complimentary. I highly recommend this if you enjoy jasmine tea. Hopefully they keep it complimentary.   This will serve as my go to spot when I am craving pho.

oJayHNBU3vqdbsHpO11xWA.text: Pho was fine wasn't as good as previous times. Soup was like,main concern is customer service. This is the second time in the last three weeks we didn't feel welcome here. It's usually when the old lady isn't here, staff seem salty. I figured the first time the servers where just having a bad day. But happening the second time around was really discouraging and ruined my appetite as well as day.

qi2KDlFY8vVdHiP60D6wyg.text: Service: 1 star  Rude unfriendly and fake smiles all around. They have a kid working there who was so rude to my family and I,  If I didn't know any better I would slap the shit out of him every time I see him. But I understand he is just a kid.  I hope he grows up soon because his behavior and attitude is not good for his family business.    Taste:  4 stars   From the items I have tried in total from here they were all pretty tasty.  Although I have only tried about 7-8 items on their menu.  I can't speak for the entire menu.  But they seem to be pretty consistent as far as the dishes being tasty but nothing to really boast about to tell people it's a must.  Price:  5 stars  Very affordable.  Cheaper or about the same with most pho places around town.  My only compliant is  the price of the egg rolls.  It's about $7 for 4 small pieces.  Definitely not worth it for the price.    Portion size:  4 stars  Some of the appetizers are a bit over priced for the portion size.  All the main entrees I have tried from The pho to the pork chops and Hong Kong style noodles were all good potions and enough to fill you up.    Overall: 3.5  Place offers a wide selection of Vietnamese dishes to chose from.  Decently priced and affordable with the exception of a few appetizer items.  Tasty meals with more than enough portions to satisfy. Unfortunately the worst service I've ever experienced and on several occasions.  So bad that I've decided to never step foot in this place again and should I decide to order from here it'll more than likely be take out.  But the chances of that happening for very slim.

kqAs0EcyUDWKdMeMsdenyA.text: Could be friendlier that's for sure. But the foods good and I appreciate that they have vegan / vegetarian options /pho.

x1d7PVwpqpV1b94nSgVSWg.text: Loved it and will return if I'm around again. Great food and great service. The food was fresh and healthy.

QTTllTU35KA3p-bdtmVq0g.text: 12/8/18 12:15pm visit te restaurant with a  co- worker and the male server that also runs the register was just an unhappy person we ask him for another table and he refuse to change us ask him a few questions and almost wanted to leave but I had lady is present bit when shes not - this type of things happen!! Big buuuuuu

-PnsIZVFwVRWppd3xP4eYA.text: I waked for the most popular dish and was told it was the Spicy soup.  Loved the spicy soup it was hot but not so spicy hot that you lost the ability to taste all the flavors.    Went at lunch and service was quick and prompt   Will definitely go again.

YYpUyyouaXyRK7FHA_7Dag.text: So, other than the building itself being pretty cool, the compliments end there. I've gone in one time for dine in (which I will never do again) and about 4-5 times for pickup over the last few years. Staff is incredibly rude. Every single time there's always something. If you ask for more of something or have a special request, oh you'll see they're not thrilled. They talk poorly about other customers in front of people. It's really sad. And the food isn't even that great. Example, their broth for pho is way too oily. I'll never go in again. The thing too, they need to be very careful because there are so many Vietnamese restaurants in this area that are way better and relaxing to dine in and not have to worry about attitudes and/or rudeness.

jo9EOnO98brY1BvbIGT-xg.text: Enjoy the Vietnamese food the staff was friendly huge portions I would definitely get a couple of dishes for 5 friends and everybody share family style.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_m4YXZjCy_Hux0WuC2-cIg.text: Thai ice tea is really good! Vegetarian spring rolls with peanut sauce were great! Soups are good too: tried vegetarian and steak - both great! Curry was absolutely tasteless...payed $2 extra for tasteless boiled shrimp... Noodles with lemongrass tofu - too much garlic (which was not even in the description of the dish) Loooong wait for to-go orders, 30+ mins with not busy restaurant! Order pick up ahead!

gH74Y4f7Q2PawQKJ68xZDQ.text: Came here for a dinner gathering recently and I had a hard time locating this Lemongrass Cafe restaurant.  Who would have guessed that the diner I drove past as I entered the vast parking area of the Colonade Square Strip Mall would be the site of the Vietnamese Pho restaurant.  The interior of the restaurant still bares the unmistakable look and feel of a classic diner, with touches of Vietnamese art works decorating the walls of the restaurant.  It definitely has a different feel compared to the typical pho restaurants in Vegas and California.  I think that is good.  Their menu is pretty typical of other Vietnamese restaurants that serve pho, bun (vermicelli noodles) and rice dishes.  It also has the standard appetizer, drink and dessert menu.  I ordered their pho and thought it was pretty good.  Someone else ordered their bun with fish cake and that looks good as well.  As a group, we each enjoyed what we ordered.  But we were all most pleasantly pleased with the service provided on this visit, in spite of some less than positive comments on Yelp.  Our server was very organized in taking our orders, asking for our initials to note down next to our orders, which was tremendously helpful when it comes to settling our individual tabs at the end of the meal.  I can only assume the waiter was very used to requests for separate checks and have developed a very effective system for it.  Bravo!  Decor:  4/5  You will definitely remember the time when you had pho served in a diner :)  Food:  3/5  A-OK!  Service:  5/5  Food served promptly, drinks frequently refilled, settling our individual bills was hassle-free.  Parking:  5/5  Capacity was not an issue here.  4 stars overall.

CWACS8FD4_lxgrRwg0-_ZA.text: I move around a lot but, no matter how far I am, I go out of my way to come here. I come here for one thing only. The iced tea!  over the years I've tried asking the employees but nobody wants to give up the secret. All I know is it's made of four different types of tea leaves. If anybody can figure it out let me know

JLFptMk1oaJUfYC-5-1kYg.text: Loved the Pho! Neat place. Looks like a 50s diner on the outside, and the inside is very clean. I will be back :)

kBJbkyp2sQwHPetfYf1FXw.text: I missed eating Pho since I became vegetarian over a year ago. But I was very excited to discover that Lemongrass serves vegetarian Pho using vegetarian broth, and it is DELICIOUS!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian pho

CW0IZ15S_HmEuj05x9IuAA.text: I really don't have much new praise to add to the already heaping amount. I've been here a handful of times and I've never been disappointed. My regular at Vietnamese is Bun Tom Nuong (Vermicelli noodles with shrimp and fish sauce) and I tried their fatty beef pho once. Everything is so good - and plenty of leaves, sprouts, lime, jalapenos to adjust the flavor to your liking. I always get the spring rolls and they are always delicious. This is my go-to pho when I'm on this side of town and want a cheap meal. Oh, and sometimes there is room left for dessert (only when I order a small, though - which is still so filling). Their mango/lychee dessert is to DIE for! All the flavors come together so well, and the fruit actually tastes fresh and sweet. Oooh, I'm craving some just writing about it! Make sure you order it!!  Someone else wrote here that management may have changed recently, and over the course of a year or two of coming here, I noticed the service did get slightly better. It was never bad, but I noticed how attentive they were the last time I went. I've never had a problem with getting seated quickly or having prompt service, however. Oh, and I love how Lemongrass is right next to the movie theatre!  I would definitely recommend this place to those who wants to sooth a sore throat to those who want to expand their tastebuds (not that us Yelpers need that). I love Pho!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. APPETIZER Menu (sorry for bad quality)
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PHO Menu (sorry for bad quality)
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #35 Pho with rare beef and fatty beef. Mmmm, fatty beef....

r5dXrYG_UZ6bRaU2Jn1dSA.text: This place is very clean and the ingredients are all fresh, it just tastes clean if that makes sense (some pho places seem to put some junk in there).  The service is great and they are always welcoming and accommodating when Im there with my 3 year old girl. I wish they had veggie steamed dumplings but other than that no complaints here!!

IwVe-oi1_U5L0ZpVIhs21w.text: We eat here all the time or call in for pick up. Our young kids love the stirfrys and we get the Chicken Pho. There is always a ton of food - portion sizes are amazing. It's fresh and tastes great. Such a fantastic value. Not the nicest digs, but if service is good and they are always friendly.

W-XFuf8JCylS490pniy_1g.text: This place is pretty bomb. It was a little weird driving up bc its in some converted 50s lookin' roadside dinner and I almost missed it. They keep it freezing in the restaurant, which is awesome bc who wants pho when its 90+ degrees outside. The broth was pretty on point - traditional and seasoned just right. The best part? It didn't leave you smelling like pho. You all know what I'm talking about... That broth seeps out of your pores all day, but this place didn't leave me feelin' like that. Will def come back the next time I'm in Vegas, esp. after a crazy night.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. small rare steak and well done flank pho. perfect size for gals... nom.

L7nh0GGEizHjrxr2vsStoQ.text: Got nervous at first; the smell inside made me queasy (I wasnt sure if it was poop, raw beef, or cleaner. It was a mix of all three)  server seemed frustrated, we had limes in our water when we asked for lemons, and I got iced jasmine tea when I asked for hot. It wasn't a big deal when we got our food. Reasonable pricing and food was good. Family and I got #53 (seafood pho), spring rolls, a beef and broccoli plate, and an egg banh mi. The banh mi is small, barely a foot. I was imagining the baguette would be longer. However, the other food had a satisfying portions. I could come back if it was a last resort. Id probably go back to Pho Saigon instead, which is right across the street.

It1UfM-lLvPHWBG0yxzYCQ.text: Great Pho in the area especially the broth. I usually get #36 on the menu. Also try the Che Ba mau(dessert) which has red beans and green beans if u like sweets, hands down the best in Vegas. Come check them out. Highly recommended!

WP1Sf0zSggjCRcG30HW8Ig.text: Love the customer service here, friendly attentive staff. Food is fresh and well made, fairly low cost or average for Vietnamese food around here.

VDsVjKj_6No8EsjULXeetw.text: The pho here is not very good. Broth is not very tasty. Lacks richness and beefiness. Their egg rolls were soggy and very bland as well. I'd much rather eat at pho little Saigon or pho Saigon 8 which are both a block away. Will not eat here again.

8VEHRU0QfG66eqeqUwyHHA.text: Not sure what happened to older staff that was there. Back then, food was great with decent service. Now it's still the same food with terrible service. Why? I do not know. I don't ever see the good staff anymore. Bad choice by management.  I was not happy from the beginning when I asked for extra lime prior my dish and she agreed and then she brought out lemons instead. Then I informed the waitress that I wanted lime and she said because lime is so expensive they don't serve it anymore. First of all, lime and lemon have two different distinct taste...   If they had good management this wouldn't be happening.

RjmIlSJrTuxds7bLr5X7_w.text: Our first visit but have driven by for over 2 years. My bbq short ribs were a little on the chewy side but flavor was great. Wife had the vermicelli grilled shrimp which I will get next time it was delicious. Their spring rolls (not fried) were perfect and the peanut sauce was awesome. Quite and friendly. We will come back

hPIubKPnB9BeUuaWIDpZIQ.text: Excellent meal and fantastic service!  Vermicelli with Grilled Shrimp, Spicy Beef Soup and Flan!  This was our first visit and won't be our last.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vermicelli with shrimp
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Beef soup
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Must try!

9HJVHAF-bJFIwhIP-ILx_Q.text: So we came here after a long trip from SF to satisfy our hunger but in fact a little bit disappointed.  The service is good and effective. Since we can speak Viet so there was no difficulty ordering food. They actually speak English well so there was no problem for the service.  My recommendation is not to drink the water if you are from other states. Reason? LV water tastes different and unpleasant. You should bring your own water to satisfy your thirsty.  One minus for their food is the vermicelli. Its like they use the frozen ones and put them into microwave to make it soft and hot. Not the fresh one.  Their deserts including ice cream, flan, sweet desert are too sweet and contain lots of glucose. Stay away if your on diet plan.  Stick with traditional Pho, not the other things if you don't want to get disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vermicilli
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lotus salad
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice anbience

3A0rf7_8yvUPUAWnM7G93g.text: I love this place but I'm giving it 2 stars because every time I come here the male waiter has the worst attitude, like it's such an inconvenience that we walked in to eat. Over it bro,never coming back.

Eh2Yj_95DvzOL3OBrZBCgw.text: So...as reading other reviews on this place, someone mentioned that service is non-existent on Sunday nights. I went on a Sunday night.  Walked in with my friend and stood around about 5 minutes until someone sat us. -1  Was ready to order and waited about 7 minutes for someone to recognize it. -1  Food came out pretty quick +1  Pho was a good size for a small and spring rolls always get me everytime! +1  Had to ask to refill water a couple of times -1  Waited while two waiters walked past us to pay at the front. -1  Overall, 3 stars. I think I'll try a couple of other places before I head back here again.

xtbWcp9e_tuZ5TZJ9O3TJw.text: Vietnamese food served in a fifties diner. Good beef broth. Nice Pho. Spring rolls so so. Delicious peanut sauce. Everything we enjoyed  was fresh. Service was excellent. Actually forget the Pho and order the Bo Kho ( beef stew ) with a warm French baguette. Out of this world and you won't find it at many other places.

pntZv1do08L6k_j01O3SYQ.text: I like the food, it was pretty good. But the 50's diner decor makes you feel like your in a Twilight Zone episode. Some things just doesn't go together... Maybe I came on an off day, but I wasn't quite welcome'd in. I was given the Asian gangster hospitality. Kind of like the gangster nod, but not the good homie kind. Like the kind that they acknowledged you but please seat yourself.  Like I said, food was good, the kind where I may order out but I don't believe I'll ever come and enjoy the atmosphere. The atmosphere was like oil and water.  But I will say this, there was a sweet older lady that did give us the comfort of "family". With that said, knowing that this was a family business, i give them credit for striving like they do.  Just wasn't too keen with the Asian welcome wagon. Heard kids in the background, and were given Asian gangster looks, but I'm sure that's just their "brf". But I have it too, so I can't be too mad.

Z9LiYeaXeWq8ZF8uV1xc9A.text: We stumbled upon this hole in the wall on our recent trip to Vegas. We were craving some Vietnamese food and this place happened to be open on 4th of July and had decent reviews so we decided to check it out.   I ordered the Bun Bo Hue and honestly, I've had better. It was missing the pork blood and a truly authentic bowl of Bun Bo Hue will have pork blood. I really liked the sauce though. It was spicier than how other restaurants have but I'm not complaining. I love spicy foods.   Overall, it was decent. I like how they have the traditional dishes on their menu like Bun Cha and Banh Xeo. Most Vietnamese restaurants that I've been to usually just have the noodle soups and rice plates. So I thought it was pretty cool that they offered these dishes. If I'm ever in the area again, I would definitely come back to try those dishes.

AqM4ZP_wx_4xmNaHgi4uMA.text: I decided to try this place after hearing mixed reviews from several different people. Upon arrival, it looks like a 50's diner with signs that it is a vietnamese joint selling pho. The interior seem like it was still the same as when it used to be a diner. The furnitures were old and some seats were ripped but you can hear Vietnamese music playing in the background. The interior decorated with plants and walls covered in Vietnamese paintings.  There was one other group eating and we were seated quickly.   Food:  - Nem nuong cuon (spring rolls with homemade pork sausage) with peanut dipping sauce (2/10)- it came out smaller than more places but u get three rolls (each cut in half). The nem tasted old and dried, as if they precook the nem and reheat it when you order this. The veggies were old and you can tell it has been sitting around for awhile and wasn't fresh. The peanut sauce was OK, it helped with forcing the spring rolls down our throats.    - Pho Dac biet (3/10) -I typically like to try the soup before adding condiments to it. The broth was lacking in flavor and definitely didn't have the rich and bold beef flavor that you normally get from a home cook meal. The meat was mediocre at best in teen of quality. The veggies that came with it was also old and not fresh.   - Bun bo hue (2/10) - I have been on the hunt to find a place that makes this delicious spicy beef noodle soup and still haven't come across a place that calls my name to come back. This soup was very oily and had a weird after taste. I don't know what it is but that distinct taste overpowered the whole dish.    - Bun thit nuong, nem nuong, cha gio (6/10) - one dish that it's hard to get wrong but once again the homemade nem nuong was dried and tasted old. The thit nuong was decent and had a nice char flavor that made the dish more bearable to eat. Cha gio had no flavor and needed more seasoning in the filling. The veggies once again was old.   - Thai tea did not taste like Thai tea   Overall, I would not recommend nor come back here to try anything else. I will continue my hunt to find a place for bun bo hue. I gave them an extra star because we had no issue with service. The staff and owner were very friendly and nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun thit nuong, nem nuong, cha gio
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue - very oily and had a weird after taste

UExVuzf4B-jq7Sf3mmSV0Q.text: Errrrr, I'm SO torn between 3-4 stars on rating this place. Here's the thing, if you normally eat Banh Mi's then you feel my pain, when you see the size of these Vietnamese Sandwiches served here... if you peep my picture you see the size compared to my small hand. Although the size is on the smaller side the actual sandwich stuffing is quite delicious.   The people that own the restaurant are sweet, so because of the customer service and flavorful (small) sandwiches they offer here, I may consider coming back.   The location of this restaurant is a little tricky. The easiest thing I can say is that it's directly across my favorite Hawaiian food spot, Island Flavor (off of Eastern Ave, just off the 215) in the same shopping center. It's the silver building that looks like an old school diner.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small sandwich for $4.00

FxZFHRpJaaQB6Ab6u4K4Ag.text: We ordered a 38 soup and didn't finish all the meat so we wanted to order a small soup without meat to bring it home. They refused to let us order it to go and said we could only order a large. Um ok?  We only really come here for the food since the service here is always terrible. But they were so rude about us ordering a small soup to go, I'm just done with this place.  Too bad, since we come here at least 3-4 times a month. They just lost as customers, will be trying Pho King down the street.

PmTJ50LTmIcPvPaZomXQAg.text: I love this place. The Pho is excellent. The lady seemed to not be in the #mood but other that- the bread is good & fresh. This place doesn't have Cilantro as an option for pho ( I like mine that way) but this still my go to pho place! So busy eating forgot to take pictures

P2teKMNePsK4YAUhpXj4EQ.text: In the southeast side of Las Vegas this is my go to pho place. It's a Vietnamese restaurant in a dinner space. I've always had really good service. The food comes out quick, the food comes out hot, and the food comes out tasty.  Their spring rolls are really tasty. I prefer the shrimp over the nem nuong pork patty ones here. Their peanut sauce is a little runnier but flavor is there. They give you four for $7/$8 bucks which is great.  The pho always has a lot of meat which trumps the china town spots. They also offer smaller bowls.  They have all the Vietnamese staples like ban xeoh and even ban mih sandwiches.  I think the space has an off putting smell which I have no idea if they have any control over but this is to help them improve.  Also the pho is definitely not the best in town in flavor but it's still solid and overall good. I think it could use some salt but hey I can add my own.  The older grandma lady is my favorite as she seems very proud to serve the food here. She does the hostessing and takes payments.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H4eZUMPz4oc5bvwnx52D2A.text: Good food and nice service especially the lady owner. The place is clean too and lots of parking.

BrxIHTf86p0-n6xU_iPUgA.text: I had been driving around looking for a different experience and, lemongrass definitely delivered that. The diner look was apparently a carry over from the previous owner but, we were greated by a kind old lady. The menu was a bit difficult to read and, it had alot of cross outs on things I guess are no longer on the menu. However, I ordered a crispy chicken stir fry which was absolutely amazing all the way down to the presentation. I would definitely be interested in trying this place out again and, explore more of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy noddle chicken stir fry

2iV6gZ9_UCOGnxUwcW_ZsA.text: For me it's the best Pho is Henderson. We eat there at least once a month. Sometimes more often. Highly recommend their hot Thai coffee. And pho of course. My husband is vegetarian, so it's good they have vegan pho with vegan broth. Some places only give you vegetables, but still with beef broth.

FmOsIOgpqBF-0gdgMpouog.text: Solid Vietnamese establishment. The menu is large and prices average. Service was mediocre but I wasn't expecting much.  The interior is unique because it appears that it was once a Western diner, but the food is definitely Vietnamese! Decor is basic.   There are only a handful of Vietnamese restaurants in this part of town, so this is a decent option.

vAmbgyKR0TwALy_EsEMPhw.text: Our go to for Vietnamese food. They somehow have Thai Tea, which is awesome. Lol   I've never had a bad meal here, everything we order here always tastes good. They're very consistent and reliable. I love this place.   #66
