u6bKwA5_LtaYrxizgwB3cQ.text: I'm hung up on the 50's burger diner style exterior and interior...  looks like an airstream camper.  My booth rocked every time I leaned in to eat.  If you omit the atmosphere the food and service was pretty good.   The broth was excellent.  My tofu Pho was perfect.  My friends had the flank steak pho and also loved it.  Service was very attentive.  Has a lot of potential but with so many other choices on the street I probably would not come back.

KP5M9ppxwxxa3Y1QefT1Hg.text: The food is amazing, best pho I have ever had. I order the beef loin I think and it was so good. There was fresh bean sprouts to add and red chili to give it a little kick.

5c3KCNge0l0Z_iV_axXMCg.text: I had the Shrimp Pho for the first time and it was absolutely delicious. I have been here before and both times have been excellent. Great food in a nice, quiet atmosphere. Recommend this for any lover of Vietnamese food.

AGajiqd2qBbGq1NDoHCajQ.text: I absolutely love this place! The staff are all friendly, and kind, the food has always been fresh and delicious, and the prices are perfect. I actually like that it's set up like a diner, makes it really unique. I recommend this place to people all the time.

nfGJ-Eo7dnzIuZqtBXO9tw.text: We've been to this place more than five times and we come back for the awesomely crunchy spring rolls. They have an extra crunch in them which my husband loves.  I particularly love the pho noodles, they aren't floury like other pho places and they don't stick together in a mass like some other places do..as if the noodles have been sitting in the same bowl for a while or were pre proportioned. You ever been served pho and you stick your chopsticks in the bowl and find yourself having to separate the noodles because they're all stuck together?? I can deal with that, but I don't necessarily like to.  Other than pho, egg rolls and spring rolls; we've had the combination banh sandwich which comes with jalapenos so be careful, and the fried pork. My kids love the fried pork! Thai tea is always a winner too! I have yet to try a dessert, I've always been too full to add a dessert to my meal. Moving on, I've never been in the restroom here so I'm not sure what the situation is in there.

slxpAI_pHpA3riqbbSV-6Q.text: The food is really good here. The service is definitely top notch always on top of the table making sure you always have your water refilled, And seeing if you need anything else. Definitely going to come back to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sBX7rS3N8KBxcnSJdQKixg.text: Wow...I am so amazed by how a Vietnamese spot can f'ed up banh mi so badly.  I to-go 5 Vietnamese sandwiches.  3 Combination (pork, ham and pork roll), 1 grilled beef, and 1 house made pork sausage.    Cons 1. Bun - more on a big hot dog bun than a French baguette.  So compared to all the other Vietnamese places that sells Banh mi, Lemongrass Cafe has the tiniest baguette ever.  It wasn't even toasted. 2. Meat - skimpy and totally not worth it to consume.  The house made pork sausage was thin and flavorless.  I make the nem so much better than this restaurant.  The grilled beef looks more like sauteed bits of beef.  The cold cut tasted like Asian store brought.  Supposedly there is pate...I didn't see any, didn't taste any. 3. Herbs/veggies - there was no cilantro in any of our banh mi.  The carrots must be pickled in just water and sugar because it was not sour at all.  I question whether they know how to pickle or definition of pickling. 4. Mayo - or lack of.  What the heck is going on?  Can't even spread some mayo?   5. Soy Sauce - I opened up the banh mi and did not see soy sauce.  Pros Not a damn thing I can say here.  I grew up eating banh mi (Houston, Westminster, etc.), so I know what banh mi should be.  The banh mi here is a effin disgrace.  They are the worst banh mi I ever had.  Everything was wrong, no redeeming quality.  Because there are not many banh mi places in Hendo, I decided to give this place a try.    I will NEVER return.  Lee Sandwiches is still better than this place.  Too bad China Town is quite a distance from where I live.  Also, as I was waiting to pay for the worst banh mis ever, there was a funky smell at the front register area.  Eew.

g_YEQd2wdugHNDZZmphvgw.text: Overall a good experience. We were hungover and decided to try this place  since it's literally right across the street from where we live. We were actually very surprised at how good the service was, and how all the servers spoke English and were able to get all of our picky orders right. I don't think I've been to one Vietnamese restaurant here in Vegas where the servers were able to fully comprehend the phrase "beef on the side". We all had the pho tai and it was delicious.

-wDBuyNpJTDWS5o4UnjL8A.text: They wont last long! Food sucked (not original, fusion-ed, nor tasty), service sucked (slow, incompetent, dumb broads who have drama between themselves), prices sucked (waYyy overpriced), portions were for two while trying to call themselves a family style restaurant, hmm I don't think so! Don't waste your time, PLEASE!

-tLXUQtIIJmovpoqtVmBgg.text: The service can be slow, and the food is slightly overpriced for what it is.  That being said, I eat here quite often because in my opinion the food is actually very good.  It is the best Vietnamese I have had in Henderson.

mHYdhKvgRWdMC6iHB5jwZw.text: Theres not enough meat in the pho, u can get double the amount of meat in Chinatown, LV. Too much cinnamon and star anise in the broth. I'd much rather drive the distance to Chinatown to get my money's worth. They better change that or they won't be in business long.

cPkeFZU2ityVZLZcxqyeLw.text: I love trying new things, and a Vietnamese restaurant in a 50s diner setting sounded like something fun. But this place was not worth the trip. We ordered the spring rolls, which were delicious- fresh with crunchy rice noodles inside. I was eager to try my entree, the Pork Chili Lemongrass. When my order came out, it was a little smaller than I expected. Usually when I go out for dinner, I eat half and save half for lunch the next day. Oh well, I figured I had just worked out and it probably just looked small in my hungry state of mind. I sampled a piece. Hmm.. very chewy. The flavor was great- perfectly spiced and the onions had a great texture; maybe it was just a bad piece. But my entire dish was like that. As small as the serving was, my jaws started to get tired from chewing through it. I don't think I had a single piece that was good. Wait, yes I did- the piece I sampled from my boyfriend's dish. His turned out fine. This place gets 2 stars instead of  because the service was great- 2 people kept our water glasses full the entire time. Plus, my boyfriend thought his Vermicelli with Pork, Pork Sausage, and Egg roll was tasty (and it was). He doesn't blame still being hungry afterwards on the portion size, even though we ended up going to the Havana Grill (same parking lot) right after to get something else. I'll give it another chance, someday. Maybe the dish I ordered just happened to be the worst thing on the menu.

YNanD0crznjQh5cWSSEwMg.text: We called earlier in the day and made reservations for 7 people and the earliest they had available was 8pm, but we were able to call and just put our name in and they said a table would be ready in 45mins so we were able to have dinner around 7pm.   They were out of the shrimp spring rolls which sounded the best out of all the appetizers, so we ended up ordering each of beef and chicken satay.  Folks, I recommend the beef satay-it had curry taste to it, but the chicken tasted like nothing.  The dipping sauce was delicious too!  The little dish of cucumbers were a bonus. We ordered: Pad Thai, Yellow Curry, Pad See Woo, Rib eye steak, and few other dishes I cant remember the names of- one was a shrimp dish, chicken with cashews, and something else.  MAKE SURE YOU TELL THEM IF YOU DON'T WANT SPICY AND MAKE SURE THEY MAKE IT CLEAR ON THE TICKET! We ordered everything on a scale of 0-10, a 0 and all the food ended up coming out regular. We had someone who gets a bad reaction if they ate anything remotely spicy. Well, he took a bite of it and had a really bad reaction.  We called the manager over and told him and the manager didn't seem happy that we complained. The manager was able to cook something up within minutes, but the food and the appetizers took forever FYI.   Overall the food was good, but not much different than your neighborhood Thai/Asian cuisine places.  The portions were TINY... I mean I can probably eat a whole plate in 3 bites and I'm a girl.  Not worth the $$ for regular food, but if you are craving Thai, the Pad Thai was really good. 3 star because the service was slow, portions were TINY, and price was too high!

qwaX2lteewquB6CN2GmFlQ.text: having been here only once, i can tell you that i will definitely be returning. the food is fresh, authentic, and delicious. the waitstaff is friendly and courteous. next time, i will be eating in instead of doing takeout. and you can't beat the prices.  There is absolutely nothing wrong eating here 3 times a week. i would also like to add that their #69 (tofu with vermicelli noodles) is so so so so so so good.........smokey and flavorful.

ANjvlAPbRju4fi8hpPI7Ew.text: This is my new favorite Vietnamese place. It's not too far from home and nice and clean inside. The pho broth here is delicious.  I only tried 5 dishes so far but they were all excellent, prices are reasonable (don't forget to mention yelp for the discount) and the staff is very friendly. During our last visit I had a glimpse at the kitchen and the cooking staff seemed to be all Vietnamese and male. That is pretty darn impressive if you know what I mean... =)

w2ybXTE5gHWXNmzo1Gvbyw.text: I am Vietnamese and Chinese so when I found out there was FINALLY a Vietnamese restaurant in Henderson, I had to try it out!  My nail guy said the BBQ pork was pretty good, so I headed there with my daughter to check it out.  I ordered the Bun thit ( BBQ Pork) over vermicelli noodles, eggrolls and nuoc mam...it was alright, definitely not like mommas but was better than driving all the way to Chinatown to get decent Vietnamese food.  My daughter had her usual, Pho with no meat or veggies ( she's only 10 and hates onions). I did taste her pho, the broth wasn't bad ( again not like mom's!).  We also ordered the shrimp wrapped sugarcane- which actually came out with no sugarcane but was again no bad. It came with the lettuce, mint, basil and a few other herbs that most Americans won't eat and I don't know how to say in English.  Overall, I am just SO happy there is a Vietnamese place in Henderson.  I would definitely recommend to anyone that has never had Vietnamese before, it's so healthy and delicious!

k1bRLZJpqw4TvOPpjZT-Ew.text: Great service, cute diner style atmosphere, and good broth.  Definitely worth stopping by sometime.

wWNGQEVAZZHm3yKQ0_gWCA.text: Outstanding fresh ingredients. The vegetable spring rolls are the best I have ever had. The salmon salad is delicious and all the soups seem to be made fresh every time   My top 5 favorite restaurant in Vegas including all the top strip restaurants. On a par with Lotus of Siam but very low key.  No wine

YxhXfbSy7qDi5M7Z7uwcYQ.text: Give the food three stars but overall a four because of the outstanding service I always receive. Better to be had on Spring Mountain but this place is good for a fix since they were the only place in Henderson until recently. It will be interesting now that another joint opened up literally across the street.

U9sVQrPGCeoWvFYioicCag.text: love it! found this place by accident, had to get my oil changed across the street. it looks like one of those old fashioned coffee shops with chrome panels on the outside of the restaurant. inside there are booths & a very nice hostess who i think is the owner too. the prices are reasonable & the selection is huge. they have vietnamese sandwiches, appetizers, pho soup & entrees. i had cha gio the vietnamese pork egg rolls with fish dipping sauce. very crispy & delicious. nicely presented with lettuce & assorted veggies to wrap them in. I also had suon bo nuong, grilled beef shortribs with white rice. so yummy! they are the same as kal bi & quite good. the rice was perfect nice & sticky, not dried out. the hostess came up to me & asked if the beef was too salty but i told her that this was what i was hoping for, i love kal bi & would be back again to order this entree. not to mention they have coca cola products which is rare for restaurants in las vegas. the server was nice & attentive. i hope this restaurant does well because the food is awesome.

oiATeHvFV8d2Jt-i6onDwQ.text: I am vietnamese and i can say that when it comes down to Pho, i know it better than most cuisines i enjoy. Lemongrass Cafe is not in the upper tier of good vietnamese cuisine but is consistently decent. The broth of the Pho wasn't fatty and had a nice taste to it but the flavor of the broth wasn't deep. It didn't have the rich beef flavor i personally enjoy. I was very dissapointed by the vietnamese crepes here, they didn't have much flavor at all probably because the shrimp, pork and veggies were thrown into the middle of the cooked crepe instead of slowly cooked with the batter. The vermicelli dishes were good and consistent with most vietnamese restaurants. The staff was very kind, accomodating and i would have gone back but Pho Saigon 8 just opened up across the street.

pYsKN1xZUs_y6QkLARYNQg.text: We drove from our hotel on the strip since there were so many good reviews. It was definitely worth it. Family run, in a diner, it looked a bit funny from the outside.... Everything was very clean (I can get turned off by dirty washrooms - no problem here).  My husband went under protest and said he would TRY to find something he could eat. After inhaling the very fresh egg rolls (he pronounced them the best ever), he moved on to a combination sandwich and a "small" beef broth soup (not pho).  He ate everything, even though that was the largest "small soup" we have ever seen.  I had the pork with vermicelli.  My only complaint is everything was so good there was no room for dessert.  Service was excellent.  The owner came and chatted with us a few minutes afterward.  Very nice people.  Dinner for two with drinks under $30 - cannot be beat.

058-Ze5EL0ayVcEZo8HoAg.text: i love it here.  it's convenient, affordable and yummy.  take-out or eat-in.  the pho is always hot, soothing and tasty.  the rolls, vermicilli noodles and meats are delicious!  not to mention, the complimentary hot tea is gooooood.  need i say more?!

UBrKsBv_bZ2ygZeIYzw0GA.text: Great friendly service in this new establishment.  Its the only vietnamese restaurant in henderson.  Very clean compared to a lot of other places in chinatown.   They serve the usual fair with some other things you don't see at other places.  Go check it out.

vSyk8bxzs0eCIuJKk3bvWw.text: I have been here around 8 times so far, and I have always been pretty happy with the food and service.  I almost always order the pho, and it is made well here.  It might not be quite as good or cheap as some of the places in/near Chinatown, but Lemongrass Cafe is much closer to where I live and it's nice to have good Vietnamese food without the drive.  And actually, it seems like the quality of the pho has improved over the last few months.  The only other things I have had on the menu were the egg rolls (good) and the bun with lemongrass beef (very good).  I keep wanting to try some of the stir-fried items, but I usually only decide to eat here when I am craving pho.  This is a good place for people who want to have Vietnamese food without driving across the city, and it also would be a good place for people wanting to try Vietnamese food for the first time.

Dtl_t8x24ATYpnHGjGFS2w.text: Good--not killer, but good. We had Pho Hai San/Seafood Pho, veggie spring rolls, Viet sandwich with home made sausage, and the Goi Xoai/Green Mango Salad. My biggest complaint was the pho, they claim shrimp, squid, crab and fishballs. What was placed in front of me contained fishballs, FAKE crab (which is fish), and shrimp....so basically, I got fish and shrimp pho...not a piece of squid or crab in site. It was good, but hey, don't bullshit me on what you are putting in the dish. The spring rolls were OK the wrapping was starting to dry out, been sitting out a little too long--the filling was tasty (though a bit bland) and fresh. The Gi Xoai/Green Mango Salad rocked the house. I'm not sure how to describe it, I ordered it based on another yelpers recommendation, it was the shining star out of everything we had. The pork sausage sandwich was good but damn, throw a little mo' pig between that bread, just a little. Oh, and the ice tea, a little different and delish. Service was good. In a land overridden with homogenized chain restaurants, I can see why this place is well loved by those that live close by, but I would not drive out of my way for a return visit. Lemongrass... it doesn't suck, it doesnt kick ass.

OuMJmGakfKIzH1uzllxBHw.text: If you have a fetish for pho, forget restaurants altogether and just make your own.  Damn, people, it's not hard!  Lemongrass Cafe's pho is just okay, but every restaurant's pho is just okay.  BUT... if you bring a friend and just order the 7 Courses of Beef meal for two, they will rock your world, fill your stomachs, and barely scratch your lunch budget.  I forget what it costs, but it's cheap.  I think it's less than $20.  I've long since forgotten what was in it (the seven courses showed a full spectrum of tastes), but I'll never forget that it was great.

TNTLWVOTbbXMknGoZiDHdA.text: I just finished eating here and the pho was just "meh.". They didn't give us (3 people) separate addins (basil, lime, jalapenos, bean sprouts) and the serving size of add ins they gave us was for 1 1/2 phos...double the amount short. Pretty whack. Service was unattentative and for middle of the road pho, just not worth it. I'd definitely hit up all the other pho joints before coming back here.

aq4t2ahN3XPDtaOvddLnLQ.text: My favorite local place for Pho.  Close to my house & work. Good food, good service.  I love that you can call in for take out orders.

CcjWhqwXSeAceVGRfImUyQ.text: My wife and I were looking for a Viet. restaurant after leaving so-cal and happened to find a place near our house and away from Chinatown.  It was empty at the moment and we discovered that they opened 11 days before we went in.  We ordered Bun Boe Hue and wasn't really wowwed by the Soup, but the other ingredients were fine.  The Soda Chanh and Vietnamese Coffee were excellent.  The place is family owned and operated and the service is top notch compared to other asian establishments.  The waiters, Bryan and Ching are especially helpful.  The owners (a caucasian male and his vietnamese wife) are very customer oriented and try to please customers from all types of backgrounds.    On subsequent visits, the food got better (They must've changed the chef) and we tried spring rolls, the mango salad, the Pho, the beef stew, etc.  Everything is better than average for Vegas.  It's not little Saigon, but I'll take it rather than have food thrown at us.    I'd give them 5 stars when I'd pick this over any restaurant in Little Saigon.

gMu4oKF6gDt8TeYhAW5B_A.text: i'm no pho expert but theirs was sooooo goood.....i almost got a second order to go....broth was super flavorful even before i added my favorite condiments....someone said their noodles were all stuck together but all you have to do is give it a quick stir with your chopsticks and they're all separated and waiting to be slurped up! can't wait to go back...wish they were open late night too.... YUMMY!

eV9Z7ikrmB5_pPiQzcjyHA.text: One of my favorite Vietnamese places in Henderson. I like the 50s layout/booth seating, the smells aren't overwhelming, food is consistently good, and prices are fair. Service is decent as well.  My go-to dishes: chicken pho and vermicelli bowl with bbq pork and egg rolls. Super yummy and healthier options than other foods.   It's never been very crowded when I visit, and there's always plenty of parking. I think there's a credit card minimum charge (~10 or 15).

atZxRijpG3zA41lnboNR0g.text: You never forget your first love or your first.....time. This is where I nervously had my Pho cherry popped a while ago so it has always been special to me. Let's just say my first time was A-MAZING and I fell in love with Pho and Lemongrass Cafe on that day.  - It's always hot and spicy  - Cures hangovers and helps with head colds  - No noodle and all white meat action works with my low carb lifestyle  - While it travels from my pallet to my belly the warmth brings me peace and calm......a Culinary Nirvana.  - Using chopsticks makes me happy (it's the small things in life)   After being to several other Vietnamese spots Lemongrass is my go to for Chicken Pho. All white meat, fresh veggies, and a small that I cannot finish is $6.95. I usually get mine without the noodles and extra side of peppers and load it up with hoisin and chili sauce, etc. They never skimp on the amount of meat or it's quality. It's quite simply, Pho done right. I would also like to live a little and try a fried egg Banh Mi here eventually.   The service is consistantly attentive, friendly, and quick. The owner always greets me with a smile and welcomes me. I especially enjoy this when I am here by myself in sweaty gym clothes which is frequent. (Yes, I am the sweaty white girl in the corner. Don't hate. My Pho is spicier than yours.) The restaurant is always very clean down to the ladle spoons and ramekins for the sauce if you are a dipper;)   I would gladly give Lemongrass 5 stars, but my one issue is that the temperature never seems right in here. I purposely keep a sweatshirt in my car just for Lemongrass in the event it's freezing. I've been there a few times where I hadn't been to the gym before, but the temperature was so "off" I had a fancy boob sweat line when I was done eating. I know, sexy.   Now that it's not Africa hot outside I imagine I will be craving Pho more than my average twice a week. TRUST I will be at Lemongrass Cafe fo' sho' fo ' a hot bowl of Vietnamese goodness to soothe my soul and take me back to that happy place.....

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Chicken Pho-half noodle

KuW6D_zsF1AJCXXD7ap8NA.text: I'm surprised this place isn't called the Lemongrass Diner, considering it is situated inside ones of those 50s style diners with the silver metallic exterior complete with diner countertop and barstools inside.  The only thing missing were portable jukeboxes at each booth that allowed one to play cheesy asian lounge music.    Don't let the juxtaposition fool you, since the food here is 100% authentic.  A friend and I ordered up the crispy spring rolls (cha gio) and a large bowl of the combination pho (meatballs, tripe, tendon, flank steak).   Here is the breakdown of our meal:  Crispy spring rolls (4.5 stars) These were definitely the highlight of the meal.  Aside from being perfectly fried, the filling contained taro, jicama, and black mushrooms to accompany the ground pork/shrimp.  My tastebuds were doing somersaults since there was so much flavor and texture in addition to the savory meat component.  The velvety creaminess from the taro, the light crunch from the jicama, and the chewy mushrooms all came through.  Wrapping each roll in a fresh lettuce leaf and a few sprigs of fresh mint and then dunking it in some house-made fish sauce, we were both pretty much on cloud umami.    Combination pho (3.5 stars) Definitely a noticeable upgrade from the pho offered across the street at Pho Saigon 8, which I had termed "pho-gettable".  The broth has a richer depth of flavor, but is a tad bit on the oily side.  Noodles were adequate but the beef components were a bit tough in regards to the tripe and there were pieces of meat that were overly intertwined with strands of fat, likely contributing to the greasy broth.  Definitely will hit the spot if you just need a nice bowl of pho on a cold evening if you're in the neighborhood, but not necessarily a destination spot worth making a long drive bypassing options in Spring Mountain.    Service/Ambience (4 stars) I actually kind of liked the surrealism of the diner vibe.  It was as though my friend and I were hatching a scheme over pho in some Asian remake of Pulp Fiction.  The owners were very friendly and hospitable as well.  My only regret was not having enough room in my belly to sample their vietnamese coffee or their mango ice cream topped with fresh asian fruits.     Definitely a solid option for pho if you're a Henderson resident taking into account the other options available, although the crispy spring rolls just may be worth the trip if you are stumbling in from elsewhere across town.

MaPULXrX5KdNSAGr4yZxeg.text: This is my go to pho place. I dont live in the area but will travel to quench my craving especially on a rainy day.

e4ezlWFnS-Nhx2A6jNyTYg.text: Cheapest meat ever.  Didn't like it one bit.  Staff was friendly. Did not care for the pho.  Cleanliness did not look like a priority.

vE9DyKaktGen3atTbjPkGg.text: Enjoyed the food. This used to be a Johnny Rockets restaurant so it has that retro look. Price is reasonable. Will go again for Vietnamese food when the craving comes.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese Coffee
Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vermicelli Noodle with Chicken and Fried Egg Roll #65 on menu

6-pa-pAZZwfQ8T2OsFGIDw.text: Place seemed clean but couldn't understand waitstaff and food wasn't what I expected. I ordered the veggie curry and it had 10 pieces of tofu, 1 potato and 1 carrot. Not enough for a meal. Left sad and hungry. Add more food to the broth please.

AA9A0O0aFEvaJ6uu1qAaGg.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese spot. They are very open to accommodating vegans and vegetarians, and have the best vegetarian pho I've had. Many of their dishes can be adjusted, with tofu subbed in for meat. I'm not afraid to get the vegetarian pho and a vegetarian sandwich and then proceed to dip the sandwich into the pho, French-dip style.  This place used to be a '50s themed diner which has had some Vietnamese stuff put around the room and on the walls, so the overall ambience and decor is a bit strange: Viet-American-Retro. The service is hit or miss. Some servers are on top of things and fast, others, not so much.  What keeps me coming back is the food and the willingness to accommodate a picky vegan customer. A lot of Vietnamese places wouldn't even try; this one not only tries, but succeeds.  By the way, they have excellent Vietnamese coffee for vegetarians, though I think they used real condensed milk, so it's not an option for vegans. Ask and find out; things like this are always in flux.

etdsheYCNfpmwlreBzSGYA.text: I have been making my way across the valley trying Pho' and I've stopped here. Great service, great food, and great atmo. Also try the other parts of the menu the rolls hit the spot too

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho&#39; time

xi_UwNWf1PBQmvw6KJlo4A.text: **GOOD VIETNAMESE FOOD IN LAS VEGAS**  Hangovers screamed VIETNAMESE FOOD to me.  Nothing better than knocking that stupid hangover out of the park with some good Vietnamese food.  In Las Vegas?  Yes, why not.  It was NOT close by. 15 minutes or so. It was inside a strip mall and it looked like a diner from the outside.  ORDERED:  *SPRING ROLLS - Not as good as Pho Kim Long's, but tasty regardless. Good portions.  *BUN THIT NUONG - Need more greens, but the meats and noodles were solid.  *SODA CHANH (lemon soda) - HIt the spot. Fresh and fizzy.  I tasted my friend's soup and the broth was amazing. Next time, the soup for me.  Dinner for 2 was $30.  Friendly staff (they spoke Vietnamese) and clean dining interior.  RECOMMEND for your Vietnamese food cravings in Sin City.

UInZySHIE_tv9kK29QhRQA.text: Food is always good. Service during the day is grand- night time less than excellent for sure... Bummer.

oA7F0zjW8KNzWtl8Vstq0Q.text: Great place. Got the vegetarian pho and pho tai along with a Thai tea. Excellent flavors, herbs were fresh and staff is friendly. Coming back for seconds.

photos.caption: Photo of Lemongrass Café - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diner turned Pho spot. Awesome!

a00MV3PZ3E7FDVs0nJJWzw.text: We are huge fans of Pho King Long and have now moved to Green Valley. Hoping to try and find something comparable, we stopped here on a recommendation. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The outside wouldn't seem like your traditional Vietnamese restaurant but damn the food was good. Definitely happy we found this place and we will more than likely be regulars.

_B3Ovd-XulBhaQn7UXJd_A.text: Weird setting for a Vietnamese restaurant to be in a 50s diner.  Came in on a rush for lunch to go.  Had my food ready in five minutes.  Pho was very tasty and packaged great.  I will return when I have a little more time to sit down and enjoy.

VjGdgOmVlpyL_dOKkEVUCQ.text: We walked in and wasn't even greeted the guy just pointed to the table while he was still cleaning the walls took our drink order came back with it but I noticed that he didn't wash his hand after cleaning!! Anyways we ordered some egg rolls that was ok, then me and my gf ordered our main dish then that's where I was upset the entree that I ordered was 11 to $12 my portion was very little with a huge scoop of rice. If I'm gunna pay that much I expect something bigger never coming back here again there rude, dirty and the server was Unexperienced.

wL9VZ3IG46vfKnwtiH6Hog.text: THE place to go for pho and more in the Green Valley/Eastern & 215 area. The shrimp & pork spring rolls are some of the best I've tasted.   Service is above average for an Asian restaurant. Sometimes they may not check up on your table, but it's no problem being able to flag someone down. Free hot jasmine tea, which is a nice addition to the meal.

nSnCnWwASl4WXv9Hal1LPg.text: Horrible Horrible Service !  Parents came to visit from California ,so they were super hungry. Walked in ( they aren't busy at all) . Told them we were a party of 6 including my one year old . Then we asked them for a highchair the guy said oh I thought you had 6 I gave you booth for 6. Okay so we waited 15mins to put our order in. That was okay.  When we walked in there was a couple who had been waiting for their food . Then it was my party . Two girls who walked in 20 mins after us and then 30 mins a elderly woman. We waited about another 30 mins for our appetizers of egg rolls and spring rolls and the table of two girls got there appetizers the same as us.  The couple who was in there first ordered pho. My party ordered pho. The two girls and elderly woman ordered pho. They brought out the two girls first then 15 mins later brought out the first couples order  . They were already super pissed so said they will not eat and left . So the waiter took there food and placed it on our table . We understand they did not touch it but you don't show people that we get somebody's rejected food.we left and will not be returning to here ever again. Never went to a pho place and got served really long. Their broth should already be done in the first place!!!!

R7CWUg0OGEtGyFVutlIumg.text: I have relied on Lemongrass for a few years now and not once have I been let down. You get an amazing portion size for your money and take out is quick and simple. My go-to order is the Pho Tai with a little hoisin sauce. Even on hot days it always hits the spot for me and makes me feel healthy. Not once have I had a problem with take out; though the dine in service can be... slow most of the time.   That aside, I always take people who are new to pho to Lemongrass!

EY7cr5x4gH2Nflz3-CIsjA.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese place. Love their #68 dish. I get it every time I come here. Its so good!! Highly recommend them. Today I ordered take out and the lady was so nice to offer me water while I waited for my order!!!

I9ZKQV-q51jNaAxgeNNpUQ.text: I'm really sad to say that the last couple of times I've gone here, the broth has been horribly greasy.  I LOVE this place. I go here so much that they always know me because I do takeout so often.    The first time the broth was greasy, I picked up the food right before they were closing so I attibuted it to maybe it being the last of the broth or something.  The second time I picked it up right after work and it was the same, if not worse.  I only ate half and put the other half in the fridge and the next day, all the fat had formed a thick layer on top, which has NEVER happened before with my left over pho.  I was so grossed out.  I want to give them one more chance and maybe tell them, just because I loved this place, but I'm not sure.  I'll go on a pho-break and think about it.

lUHEciJPxobZV4jBbZ2JyQ.text: This is the only pho spot that I know of that caters to vegetarians, so for that reason alone, I am a huge fan of Lemongrass Cafe! You have to request the vegetarian broth because it's not on the menu. The broth is very flavorful and I barely have to add any lime to it! I always get the tofu pho with veggie broth. You can either have them add the extra veggies to it, or just leave it plain with just the onion and cilantro. Just make sure you specify.   When I used to eat meat, I remember squeezing tons of lime in my pho broth to give it flavor. So for this veggie broth to be delicious enough without a bowl of lime, I think that speaks for itself.  I also like the lemongrass tofu vermicelli dish. If you're a veggie, ask for a side of the special soy sauce blend instead of the fish sauce. The tofu texture is perfect and tasty - not mushy in the least bit. I request it without bean sprouts because they get in the way.   The mango ice cream is yummy too. The portion is quite generous, so you can split it with one or two of your friends.   I love this restaurant - I can probably eat here every other day if I had the funds! For veggies who want a tasty soup or a delicious noodle dish, give this place a try. I got my other veggie friends to like it. If you see me, make sure to say wassup!!   Tofu pho is the truth, I'm just sayin'.

JdvkmznNbyEncDzGs93KDg.text: Only 3-4 miles from the airport but away from the strip. Great location. Plenty of parking. Good food and tofu choices as well.

2drsaE1tNNgVFnGh1ciNLg.text: This a hidden jem, and looks like a 50's diner from the outside.  Pho is fantastic, and the portions sizes are huge. You can easily share the large pho with another person.  I also suggest the shrimp toast and Vietnamese crepe.

TnTJvCM6IrFxuRKORTsWAQ.text: My friend calls this the metal box lol. Very diner like atmosphere. I would have never imagined a pho joint in a 70s diner so it's very original. The bun bo hue is really good here. The best I've had thus far. Customer service is really good also.

5FjU38nnr7Z2nJOotrCk-g.text: Decent pricing, good food (definitely americanized asian food, but not a bad thing!)  Really reasonable pricing, and like everything at the Aria, the decor was awesome.   Theres actually a dim sum cart at lunchtime (I went on Sunday) that was good, tho def 3x-4x the price of an authentic dim sum joint.  OVerall definitely reccomend and get a noodle dish!

HoGbJKs5hhjSlyndvXn5eA.text: My favorite dishes at Lemongrass:   Bun Bo Hue (Medium Spicy) Spring Rolls (Goi Cuon) Egg Rolls (Chai Gio) Beef Salad (Goi Bo) Pho Special (Pho Dac Biet) Baguette Sandwich Special (Banh Mi Dac Biet) Beef & Broccoli Beef Porrige (Bo Chao)  3 Colored Dessert (Tre Ba Mau) Mango Ice Cream  Hope you enjoy your experience too! :)

yuTsPdxwdYbis4BHJdtPOQ.text: Eat there two days in a roll, and order the same stuffs. On my noddles soup I ask for no onion, and both times come out with onions, I refused to take it, and I got bad service after that, first he blame on us did not tell them early and of course we did, and then he slumped the bowl on the table and took off. I feel insulting!  On second day, Found a bug in the food, told one lady there about it, she look at it and walk away, completely ignore it. While checking out, told the other lady about the bug, and she told me it's ok, and of course didn't do anything about it!

wYElTy_eKExofernv7yjeg.text: Wow this place is a blast from the past, looks like an old 50's diner, and ironically as I walk in there are cops sitting in a booth to my left, literally laughed out loud, be sides that the food was good, the crapes they have are awesome and I would come back for that alone, the only reason I don't give them that extra star is that it takes forever to get your food, man are they slow, and forget about refills on your drinks that's not happening

v4jptN6ePAj0CCBG_osH5A.text: Lemongrass Cafe is my go-to pho joint. A diner looking place that was revamped. They have a little counter seating as well with huge booth seating.  The pho broth is delicious although sometimes a little salty. The meat delicious and tender. Great place to eat if you are hungover! My grilled chicken bahn mi is awesome at $3.50! You can tell their baguette is freshly made too.  Service is always excellent (compared to pho saigon 8 right across the street). The woman (who I think is the owner) is so sweet! I like that they offer fried tofu pho, although I get rare beef, tendon and I ask them if they can add tofu as well, which they did.   I have ordered take out pho from them several times. The first time, I asked if they could keeep the noodles and broth seperate and they said they already always do that. (Had to make sure, you never know and I don't want soggy noodles) They keep the broth in a styrafoam container along with raw meats, green onion/shallot/cilantro mixture and the noodles in a styrofoam plate on the side, and a small baggie with bean sprouts and basil. They give a little container of hoisin and sriracha all ready to be consumed!

nTZ0LKNfSpHnHIP8VCVCCA.text: Very decent joint which confused the heck outta me because it looked like a diner from the 50s? 60s? 80s?? One of those eras...  I got the beef stew soup (off the menu) which was pretty yummy. It was the ultimate comfort soup after a night of debauchery with my friends ;)  I have yet to try the pho but they do offer decent selections of vegetarian dishes. Yes, this pho joint is vegetarian-friendly =)  There was only two people really working the front and they seemed so haggard from running around getting the food, dishes, and other requests for the diners. It was pretty busy... poor lady.

2ugtkzDxRfXslp8NDh02Ag.text: Pork/Beef Spicy Combo: strange items come with this bowl. Pig blood cubes, floppy pork skin, large chunks of fat. Broth was good.  Beef Sandwich: Very tasty, good sandwich but small amount of meat. You can order double meet for an additional fee.

zxzcc1ZapnyhEs1rzdmtKw.text: It's nice to find vegan pho in Vegas. It would be even nicer if it was amazing vegan pho. It's not. The vegetarian bun, however, is. A giant bowl of noodles topped with bean sprouts, fresh herbs and eggrolls. It's like pho minus the broth add eggroll. Super tasty! The  fresh spring rolls are also delicious.   On my to try list: banh xeo, banh mi and tofu chili lemongrass.

pQz0wvcv-d73vzlXJJ1B8A.text: I was getting an item tailored across the way when I noticed this Vietnamese restaurant and a Mediterranean restaurant.  Oh how I wished we went Mediterranean that day.  We ordered 3 things:  1. Pho 2. Fried Spring Rolls 3. bahn mi  The Pho was okay, I have had much much better.    The fried spring rolls were good.    The bahn mi was horrible.  It was so horrible I don't even know how to begin to describe it.  The meat was cold and was barely there: You know I opened it up and thought "where's the meat?", "where's the vegetables?", and "where's the mayo?".  Now looking back i wish I had taken a picture.  I complained to the waiter, who proceeded to ask me if I had been to Lee's sandwiches and how he worked at Lee's and that Lee's was just like their sandwiches.  I proceeded to tell him how I grew up near and ate often in restaurants in Little Saigon in Garden Grove and I know what a good bahn mi is.    There are so many other Vietnamese restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas, it will be a good idea to skip this place.

E71_coY15T55IDJxhNBIyQ.text: Best pho in Las Vegas for a reasonable price. The small was the perfect portion of food.

PpSxPqk07JtRPGqnAUi8tQ.text: I don't eat a ton of Vietnamese food, but this is definitely a little gem. It's in a classic silver bullet style diner, and the only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is that the decor is pretty odd inside, but nothing that takes away from the food. The beef with lemongrass noodles are perfect, and that's what I order every time. I actually went there four times the first week I found it, because every day I just craved it again. The service is quick and friendly, and the eggrolls are also really tasty. Never too crowded when I've been there but always has several other diners.

okcQpVwoS691THe2gH6-tw.text: I'm impressed with their quality. I've eaten about 8 different Vietnamese restaurants looking for that pho that makes me want to come back and here it is. The meat isn't old like at most pho restaurants in town and the broth is flavorful. They don't pile a load of mint leaves and sprouts just to make it look like you're getting a deal they give you enough to fill your bowl without wasting. Their fried egg rolls were very crispy and the sauce to dip it in wasn't sweet and thick it was palatable. The iced tea had a touch of the culture which gives it a nice complimentary taste to the meal. It was a little confusing finding the place because there aren't signs on the marquees and it is the old diner lol. All you need is a big conspicuous sign on top of the restaurant with bold colors. I read someone else's review and naming it Vietnamese diner is appropriate and cute idea! The only complaint is to air out the place it feels stuffy and stale.

QGB5s6cAG2Na1wATmFNEhw.text: Disappointing!  I had a craving for pho and thought I'd try this place out instead of driving all the way to chinatown.  I should have made the drive.  I ordered the combination pho without meatballs...broth tasted really odd (like it had way too much star anise) and it was lukewarm (huge no no), the meat was very stringy, and the veggies that came on the side were sadly wilted.  I also ordered springrolls, and there were three good sized rolls.  However, the pork in the rolls was very dry and the sauce was really bad (really really bad).  I ate half of one before giving up.  Also, the waitstaff was really dismissive.  And my order took forever to come out.  There were only two other tables of patrons so it wasn't as though the place was packed.  Save yourself the trouble and drive out to one of the pho restaurants on spring mountain.

o9fKKCDb1Bf5PZyfG9tNCA.text: For me, it's not all about the food.  OK I take that back it actually is, but not when I'm eating out.  The service HAS to be there to make my meal enjoyable.  I wish I could look pass that but I simply can't.  And the service was NOT there...the man we had as a server was literally dragging/scuffing (you could hear him approaching) his feet on the ground, he stood about 10-15 feet away from us just staring (there were only 2 tables in the place) and when he wasn't staring he was on his cell phone...not talking just texting or something.  I joined my party late and the very second I sat down he asked me if I was ready to order, no hello.  Which was fine I guess maybe I was in a hurry...but come to find out he had done the same to the other two in my party before I arrived.  I tried to smile at him and evoke something but nothing, not even a fake I'm trying to live off tips sort of interaction.  Zilch.  I've eaten here before...it's OK.  I had hoped for more flavor in the broth of the pho but I'm not exactly a pho expert...maybe it's suppose to be fairly bland?    My rating would have 2 stars but I'd been really craving pho so I gave it 3 stars...next time I'll try Pho Saigon 8 down the street...regardless of its mixed reviews.

87y4w1zjAXWGjDSHgDzXVg.text: This place turned an old diner into a Pho joint.   the food was decent here but nothing great, it is one of the only two in the area so choices in this part of town are limited. Overall I would go back if Siagon 8 was closed but other than that I would rather drive to Spring mountain for my Pho fix.

ZdKHbYVYddQ4bYcNK5NhDQ.text: My wife and I frequent this restaurant. This is our spot. Very unique atmosphere. Set up in a retro burger joint restaurant is the best pho I can find in Vegas. The owner is super friendly and worth taking a little time out of your day to thank her for such a fine establishment. The menu is awesome. Fresh and savory are the flavors of basil and sprouts as they sink into an amazing bowl of pho with meat balls my favorite. The tea they serve here is worth the trip alone.

Rlr-X6vbjX_TOJ1EGmrHPw.text: Pho is fine but the soup is not even close to 'warm'. I would give this place 4 stars if soup would be hotter.

UiwR6zTuh-_C0GkIf8Z2dQ.text: Yo, check it. I went with my homegirl Gaby and it ended up being one of the best conversations I've had in my life. We talked about love life, career, etc. Ya know, catching up. She's a cool ass chick, love her.  Afterwards, we watched Drive. Ryan Gosling is a beast. Respect.  Drive was better than Passion of the Christ and better than Lethal Weapon 4.

pfPo5HIfjKFCiuzaRhxNAA.text: Lemon-grass pork w rice dish is the bomb!

0Qsh20iT9EmLFO6wm_gQCA.text: I love this place!!! Best pho in Henderson!!!!   I have gone to the ones in Chinatown. They are good, but I think the quality of the meats here are excellent. The broth is super flavorful and the prices are excellent. They have had a few owners. (I think just within the same family.).  But the quality has never changed. I take everyone here when they are visiting or want to try something new.

TnkS77KmxXXfT5DOgOb9_Q.text: Very good Pho. Smells so good when I walk in the door. Great coffee. Good service. Friendly staff. Always willing to go back.

I2rWZKUPRyozpUvD344bFw.text: I am a fan of Lemongrass Cafe.  Clean restaurant.  Friendly staff.  I usually order #2 Chicken Spring Rolls and number #38 pho.  Ask for extra lemon or lime or basil if you want/need to.  They usually do not pile up on these items because some guests do not even make use of one or the other.  Will post photos to go along with this review.  P.S The owner's wife is just awesome!!!

E-nporjkTyM6zr2Xhh-nSw.text: The food is good only ordered one item.  The service was okay, not attentive.  Other groups around me got a lot of attention.  I don't really know if they want singles in there.  I will probably try this again.  The awards are good, and so are the reviews so I will go back.

gDuXp7RI0gIp_4w1s7ne9w.text: Our first time trying this place and we will never go back again! Service was terrible and food took forever to come out. They screwed up our order and my daughter never received her food. Orders came out separately and half of our table was done before the other half ever got their food. Always had to track down wait staff to get help. Food was ok but we've had better at Saigon 8 on spring mountain.  When I complained about the service they seemed to not care and never apologized about the problems. I will never recommend this place to others.

xwGb4sXHwuSivtOjkBXu1A.text: It's pretty obvious there used to be a 70s/80s style restaurant there, but of course people will do what they can to keep their business open and going (in which there was nothing wrong with that!) The night I went it was absolutely empty, so getting a seat wasn't a problem. The menu has all the typical Vietnamese dishes you would see in any other Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas, and the prices are *slightly* higher than other ones (I've noticed the Spring Rolls were about $6, compared to other places where they ranged from $4-$5).  I had the tofu and vegetable mix which comes with the addition of rice, and the place is filling enough to where it's a little hard to finish the whole meal in entirety! My server was helpful with pointing out some new stuff to try on the menu, and worked at the pace I was eating. The only downfall I experienced was the A/C in there, which was FREEZING! Besides that, Lemongrass is a pretty mediocre Vietnamese restaurant on the east side of town.

DVte8IHVLOqVqRu8Oee5rw.text: We tried ban xeo had great taste, the pork chops were also very good. The nuc muom sauce was really good can be put into anything and will make it taste good.  Will definitely try the Pho when we come back.

AI0Y8WhtS52fIxl4L4v_Sw.text: Only place I'll have pho and spring rolls. Of all the places I've been to for pho, they have the best flavor for the broth, best portion and best service. I've been to a lot of places in China Town, the broth is bland and the service is not the best.

8m5diCok8LZeXFEW-sRiKw.text: Buddy and I from work decided to go for a Pho Phix at lunch. We decided to forego our usual place close by to give Lemongrass a try due to their higher  average by the Yelpies.  Upon arrival we were concerned if the place was still open. The landscape is overgrown with weeds and the advertisement banners are in disrepair and faded. However the interior was well kept.  We sat at the counter for the comfort of sitting with room due to the fact that all the tables are booths (this really isn't a big deal to the general public unless you're over 6'3" and 200lbs+). The stainless steel preparation area behind the counter seemed to have been cleaned with play-dough as there was a milky haze from previous cleaning attempts. I understand Stainless Steel is difficult to keep clean, but it is necessary.   We ordered some rolls as we waited for our Pho. The rolls were really good but the condiments and veggie plate needed a little more love. Our pho was ok, broth was not as rich as I'm used to and lacked a good portion of noodles.  Our rare beef was well done.  Our regular Pho place down the street has a lower rating but on this day they were leaps and bounds better Then Lemongrass Cafe. I can see how this place might have been good at one time but their lack of attention to detail recently has caused them to receive a low rating.

HMeZ1gK6n5MNxwFda5VgQw.text: I was born and raised Vietnamese and I grew up in Southern California, so I know good Viet food when I taste it. This place was really disappointing for me, and I believe the food quality was really sub-par. My fiance and I started off the meal with some egg rolls. Hard to mess up, right? Wrong. The inside of the egg rolls were really mushy with no real flavor profile. It was just a jumble of mush (which I suspect was under cooked) with barely any seasoning. I tried soaking the egg rolls in their fish sauce which also lacked flavor and spice.   We also ordered their rice plate with grilled pork (Com Thit Nuong) which was mediocre. The meat didn't have that great grilled flavor and again the fish sauce didn't help at all. I nearly poured the whole bowl of fish sauce on my plate and it didn't help at all.  We didn't try their Pho which might be delicious, but that is a gamble in Vegas that I'm not willing to make. You'll see me dining at Pho Saigon 8 across the street which is so much better by far.

yVFd2GzOAcCPS7mZ7XTcEQ.text: Hubby and I went to Lemongrass Cafe last night for the first time. We had spring rolls, pho, and jasmine tea. Good and inexpensive- we plan to go back and try more menu items.

6_dJ8eglgnxbBUtXkD-dmg.text: I only order the pho here and it's pretty good as far as pho goes. The problem I have with this place is that they have the most miserable staff outside of a prison cafeteria in the first year of a 20-year prison sentence. If you ask for something you won't know if they heard you because they won't acknowledge you. Just give it 5 minutes and see if they bring it to you.

B85sneD6_-3t1fk9GILrZw.text: My husband loves chicken. So when he said we should go have some pho for dinner, I knew Lemongrass Cafe was THE place to go thanks to the review by Matt S.  I ordered plain pho without meat and my better half went with chicken pho and a chicken banh mi. We both had smalls which was more then enough.  I didn't try much of the chicken pho because he went a little bonkers with the chili sauce... to the point that he had broken out into a sweat and was crying from the heat. I am a baby when it comes to that! I did have a couple bites of the banh mi, the bread was nice and crunchy yet still soft, the chicken was seasoned deliciously and the veggies they put on it were so good. My pho was tasty, as other reviewers have mentioned the brother is nice and hot... but my noodles were a bit clumpy.   Service was a touch spotty. I didn't get a refill on my iced tea until I was done eating, and we ended up walking up to the cashier to pay because our check was not brought out to us. But the price was good, $21 for our food, my tea and a beer.   Overall I would rate Lemongrass Cafe a 3.5, but I am going to round down for the time being as I do plan on going back again in the future.

hUyvkNvsb2-TXs-ryBf0Lg.text: I've never expected great decor from Vietnamese eateries, but a Viet restaurant inside in 50's style diner is something I've never thought I'd see.  It's strange but understandable after the economic crash and restaurants closing over night causing property owners to rent out space quickly and cheaply.  Lemongrass is the exact place where you shouldn't judge a book by its cover.  It serves up some of the most authentic everyday Vietnamese dishes, there are even a couple of specialties I've never seen anywhere else in Vegas.  There are the standard Pho noodle soups, vermicelli noodle salads, and Banh Mi sandwiches, which allow me to never have to drive to Chinatown if I have a craving for the usual fare.  But if you're a non-Vietnamese and have never had something besides the dishes listed above, let me draw your attention to a few Viet offerings that are less-known but just as delicious:  1. Stuffed Calamari: fresh squid stuffed with minced glass noodle, shrimp, and ground pork and then deep fried.  This dish is time-consuming to make and doesn't yield too much profit (which explains why I've mainly had it home-made) but completely yummy.  2.  Tuna in Tomato Sauce: a peasant favorite that stands the test of time; it brings me back to the days of when my grandma used to cook this for me.  It sounds simple and it is: tuna filets are fried and then topped with crushed tomatoes with garlic and basil.  Simplicity in peasant food is usually what makes it so emotional.  3.  Lotus Salad: usually seen at parties, a rare exception (we don't have too many salads) in Vietnamese cuisine that works.  Thin pieces of lotus stems are mixed with jicama, pork, shrimp, and mint, then topped with roasted peanuts and served with tamarind fish sauce.  A healthy alternative as an appetizer or main entree.

BS0GGz9j9XFa8IbdT0sdgQ.text: This place is My regular Pho Spot. I have been to other Vietnamese restaurants and tried other Pho and Spring Rolls, but I like this place.

Buw9ewQg7IpDihQeFTwufA.text: This is my personal favorite place to eat when I'm home. I do a lot of travelling in my line of work, and I've tried Vietnamese food in Hawaii, all around the US and Europe, go figure, but Lemongrass Cafe would have to be my all time fave. The broth they use for their pho is absolutely addicting, the vegetables are always fresh and clean, and the appetizers are all so awesome, my eyes get bigger than my stomach. They also have a special satay sauce that's their own recipe, if you like garlic and spice, this sauce is meant for you.  I'm home 10 days a month, and I'd eat here everyday, if I could. It's a fairly new establishment and the staff there are all so very nice.  Good Luck & Enjoy

RakEpHPHWnv6YnTUmzB7rw.text: This is mine and my best friends favorite place to go together! :-) we always wonder why everyone doesn't go here, it may be the fact that it's a little bit hidden behind other buildings. But if you are a fan of Pho then this is the place you need to go. Every time I go I get the chicken pho with a tai tea, it's seriously amazing! The service is also great, and because we go so often they already have our order in when we walk through the door. If you haven't been here, you need to go :-)

stIF3nvAwc4wSXa1OMHMJg.text: Loved it! I have vegetarian PHO with veggies, tofu and noodles. The broth was tasty , kind of a very light onion stock flavor. Really was tasty. My husband had the PHO as well, a trio of meats. He enjoyed it as well. Spring roll was pretty good as well. Worth a second trip. And the prices were not bad at all.

lvoKY7H4MAMSRsYDv523kQ.text: I would say they have one of the best bowls of Pho in Vegas. It is really delicious, I think they've got a great broth that's consistent every time I visit. Also, make sure to grab a shrimp spring roll as an appetizer. It's delicious with the sauce.

EiFJkPWHHpH-uGWz7OBMdg.text: Lemongrass was my favorite pho place in town for years. Recently, several friends and I stopped by and to say I was disappointed in our experience would be understated at best. The smell of cleaner upon entering was so strong, i asked to sit at another table.   We didn't recognize the staff so I'm not certain if they're under new management, but the server was incredibly rude during our time there. My boyfriend came to join us and the server hardly gave him any time to order, and tried to take the menu away from him.  It took forever to even get our appetizer, and we noticed that people who sat well after us were served their food before us. The lemongrass beef was one of my favorite dishes, that time, it was charred and not up to the quality that I expected it to be.   When we went up to pay, we had asked for the cash to be applied first with the remainder to be paid on the card. He ignored us and pointed to the minimum ten dollar credit sign, which wouldn't have been an issue but he was very rude about it so rather than putting some cash towards our bill first and dealing with the attitude, I just put it all on the card. It is an absolute shame to see the quality in service go down so drastically from where it used to be, and I will never go back.

QU68lWah2cgtkowgtfVG0A.text: Food is consistent, authentic, and extremely fresh. Place is super clean and gets an A from the health board. It looks like an American diner with some Asian flair. I've been here about 15 times and it's always the same guy. He doesn't smile or talk much and might come off as grumpy but that doesn't bother me I actually find it amusing.

rg9MlbLB-A65Kr-9Of60PQ.text: Like this small pho place! Been here maybe twice or so before and always get the brisket pho! Good amount of food even for their smaller size. Noodles, beef and broth are great!   Today, I tried their vermicelli noodles with veggie eggroll! Their veggie egg rolls are deep fried with tofu, clear noodles, carrots, jicama, onion and mushroom! The dish is almost like eating pho -- minus the broth and beef!

U0YKIZwSdVj9SdaAj1Q9ZA.text: Meh....the Banh Mi is seriously dinky (about the size of a hot dog and bun from Costco), and it wasn't overly tasty. I didn't see the $10 minimum for credit, so I was told to order more items. No thanks, all I want is the Banh mi. I was given a long story about how they are charged to use the credit card reader, but they would make a HUUUUGE exception this time, but NOT next time. That's cool, I'm not coming back.

-oIGiC351vYr8IO36BPqSQ.text: We came here on a Saturday evening and ordered  1. Crispy eggs rolls 2. Vermicelli with grilled chicken 3. Vermicelli with egg rolls 4. Seafood soup  for $36  - FUSION! Haha.  - Good place for Viet food-newbs that don't want to deal with a language barrier.

cYGsk_MD95ZsNLgjpS2r7g.text: Very yummy noodles, but we preferred the shrimp over the chicken.  Egg rolls were the bomb!

fPRg-P2KGQlrZN-orweD8w.text: I was going to rate this place 3-4,but soon as I saw my waitress stuffing her face behind the counter with French fries and then touching our plates /food without washing her hands ... Huge no no for me. The pho was good, thai ice tea was good, easy parking, clean booths, and friendly service. But none of that matters if the hygiene of the staff serving food is poor and less than satisfactory. She put her fingers in her mouth and then served me my pho obviously without washing her hands. This was our first and last trip here. Should of just stuck to my normal Pho 8 down the street. Be smart and don't get fooled by the generous reviews for this business.

rnG8eVKhJUTCan4FU2sR5g.text: The first time I came here, I thought, "an old school diner that serves pho?"  Don't let their appearance fool you, they serve great food here!  If you come with a big group, you'll have to split up into different booths.  They have booths that fit 4-6 people.  But other than having to split up, everything is else is spot on!  The servers are really nice, they bring out food in a timely manner, and don't have a problem splitting checks whenever I come with large groups of people.   I don't venture out too much when it comes to Vietnamese food, I tend to stick to Pho Dac Biet since it comes with everything. Thanks to my friends, I have recently discovered a new favorite, Banh Xeo.  It's what my friends described as a "Vietnamese taco."  It is sooo much more than a taco.  It's like a crispy crepe filled with bean sprouts and shrimp that's folded into a taco.  You cut pieces of it, wrap it in lettuce with some of the other fresh herbs inside, and dip it into the sauce.  The mixture of fresh greens, the crispiness of the banh xeo, and sweetness of the fish sauce goes so well together.  It was love at first bite.  Another tasty way to eat this (although a bit more time consuming) is asking for rice paper to wrap it in like a spring roll.  I may like it more as a spring roll rather than being wrapped in lettuce.  If you're going to try banh xeo, it's a must to try it here!  I've ordered it at several other Vietnamese restaurants and sometimes the inside is soggy and anti-climactic.  I also enjoy the pho here, the broth has a nice flavor and there is a good amount of meat  They provide a lot of basil, bean sprouts, jalapenos, and lime with your pho.  My friends also enjoy the bun bo hue here.  Its very aromatic and packs a punch.  It's the perfect soup to soothe your throat when you're sick!    As expected with large groups, it's so hard to pick a place everyone's happy with, but Lemongrass Cafe has been a place we all can agree with and keep coming back to.

AEZC1Mcqp-Ig1_mpm6cdjA.text: This place sucks royally.  First of all... We had to wait 30 mins for the guy to take our order, another 30 mins for 2 banh mi sandwiches and to top it off... It must have been at least 80 degrees inside the restaurant. Bad service, bad food and bad ambience = NEVER COMING BACK

JCCRNKTCF5gi05aMKkK4sQ.text: I ordered #68 - vermicelli with pork, pork sausage and egg roll. This is the 2nd time I have ordered this dish. I like it. I am not a big Pho fan so the noodles work for me. On this evening we had an older woman as our waitress & she was very nice. Other occasions I have had the older gentleman who never answers your questions when asked & is very abrupt. This venue is never packed. xQvJXMlfsUV0KI7F5A7Vug.text: I like this place and food. Price is reasonable.  The only down fall is the servers are not friendly and as not as catering as they should be.   I will definitely come back. Like there vermicelli noodles with veggies and assorted meats in it.

r4zd83KuzpabQEXSsb1rZA.text: Best Vietnamese in Vegas hands down..  I've tried a lot of spots in this area and spring mtn. While pho kim long is super solid they don't have all the same items.  The seafood crepe is EPIC. One of my favorite lunch items in town. Under 10.00 packed w shrimp and pork crispy and delicious.  I'm also a fan of their beef broth it's better than Pho Kim.   Shrimp paste spring rolls are best in town as well. They do lag slightly for them to prepare them..  I am not a fan of their chicken in the chicken pho it is dry but so is every other place I've been to... the chicken broth is solid tho.  Anyone giving this place negative reviews is for sure a mammaluke.. I eat here average 2x a week for a couple years. Lemongrass is legit..

XJr_uzoYDb9hr4uNsigtNg.text: Stopped in and tried based on the reviews. I must say that the food is pretty good. I had the veggie spring rolls and #152 chicken sandwich. They give you peanut sauce for the spring rolls, but I like that plum sauce for dipping instead for this. Because the sandwich is dry meaning no condiments, I used the peanut sauce for the sandwich! I know it may sound strange, but isn't that how you eat chicken skewers? Anyway, I liked it!   The staff can be a little off putting, but I can overlook that if they're concentrating on making my food taste decent.

XzdsOlp3zdWBqBmQqh-Xsw.text: Service is horrible! Make sure you avoid the yellow curry!! Tried to return it and got billed for it! These guys have no clue about customer service!

sn4FvQn20UfPajzrDvdByQ.text: This restaurant from the outside looks like an old school diner.  Inside though it's nice and clean, their vietnamese food menu is pretty standard.  (Still can't find a place in vegas that sells Goi du du!)    The pho is good, but it doesn't really blow you away.   I always get the pho dac biet.   Next time we'll try a little more of the appetizers.  I'd only go if I were passing in the area and I really craved for pho.  Otherwise there's better selections near china-town.

yt6vDJQPOMOQP_uOOfCanw.text: Food is on the better side of good for Vietnamese that I've had in the area. Prices are slightly cheaper than others close by. People complain about the service but we had no problems, might have been because there were only a few other tables. If I could give 4 and a half stars, I would!

oyOV8HG19ygh2j_ucOAVLw.text: I love pho. I eat pho when its hot, cold, rainy, dry, windy, snowing, sleet or whatever. I have it when I am feeling sick or happy or out with friends. I even make my own pho with oxtails and marrow... but that is beside the point.   When I am feenin for a bowl, I stroll on down to my neighborhood pho spot - Lemongrass Cafe. I order pho tai gau gan bo vien (rare beef, fatty brisket, tendon, and meat balls) with a side of nuoc beo hanh tran (fatty deliciousness with green onion ends) and fervently wait for my bowl.  To me it is all about the broth and the broth here serves as a good baseline for when I make my own pho. The broth should be clear, have a balance of salt with a hint of sweet, and present an essence of the herbs used during simmering - and at Lemongrass - the broth succeeds in providing these baselines for me.   For the newbie get pho tai (a plain pho with rare beef), for the one that wants to try everything get pho dac biet (pho special with everything).

GIWXTfMD3ARVkj61CNIjzg.text: I've been to a lot of Vietnamese restaurants and I had pho so many times. I haven't quite found the perfect broth until now! This restaurant is located in what used to be "5 & diner" way back in the day and so at first I was kind of skeptic about this joint thinking another pho place probably mediocre.  Walked into a very brightly colored restaurant and decor was kind of outdated, but who cares as long as the food is good right? This restaurant had character leaving some of the "diner" decor behind. Our server took our order right away. He was very attentive. I ordered pho of course (well done beef and meatball)  and I love how they add green onion to the broth and they have a small size which is perfect for me ($6.95) Great flavor, I didn't really need to mess with it by adding so much sauce. Prices are excellent too!! Thank goodness I found a place that serves great pho in my area. No need for pho kim long or pho so 1 anymore.

LHRs3C2_a76_UfOOUeP0kQ.text: This place is A-OK! The food is really well prepared.   Thanks to Yelpers for pointing me to this place, and, more importantly, for posting a picture of the restaurant exterior! TIP: it is a free-standing building in a strip mall; the restaurant looks like a chrome-plated 50s diner. I am not from Vegas and literally drove past the restaurant 3 times before I stopped to troll the Yelp pictures to see if someone had posted a pic of the exterior. They had! And I realized I had completely seen the building, but discounted it, never figuring it would be a Vietnamese place.  Service slightly sluggish, with weekend servers tending to hang out behind the counter talking rather than coming to tables for basic things like providing water, or, taking orders.

NrATmt618MQ4Eim_TKkImQ.text: The restaurant has no big sign so it was hard find. We ordered Pho with rare beef, spring rolls, and fried rice for to go. The food was delicious and the amount is pretty big for me. Harbs come with the pho is very fresh and crunchy.

UcMOyUyqgYSjtq44ah1yiA.text: This probably isn't anywhere close to being the best Pho place in town but there's something to be said about consistency and the kindness of staff.  To have an Asian cuisine establishment set up in a 50's style diner is so cliche it's cute and fun. The booths are very accommodating for large parties. While their soup base is lacking a bit of flavor and the meat isn't top quality we appreciate the freshness. Plus, this is a great place for vegetarian options and the staff ensure that you are not eating something you shouldn't be. Try the vegetarian egg rolls! Really good! Not a 5 star place but we will continue to come back.

FLxDiwrYDOcdr5sZ_rmSIw.text: Ordered a banh xeo to go. The banh xeo was cooked well and delicious. I wish they gave me more vegetables to eat with the banh xeo and wish they added carrots and daikon to the fish sauce. It was still tasty.

B3kn51F0Rqbpgti_F1u0rA.text: Rushed us out at exactly 9:30. Owner or owners son awkwardly stared at us the whole time. Mad dogging us. Been going there for quite sometime. Wanna support the Mom and pop shops but can't justify it with horrible service

xSfgMkxwO0ie8YqI9Z9-WA.text: Lemongrass is on of my favorite spots to go to when I crave Vietnamese food! The have a very large menu to choose from.  I usually call in an order for pickup. It's a great location not too far from where I live and it's very convenient... I'm so happy that I don't have to travel far.... I have lots of favorites from Lemongrass like the fresh spring rolls, #68, #38 pho, porkchops, bah mi sandwiches... I'm craving it now. Lol that's my cue to stop writing before I decide to call in an order... If you like Vietnamese food you should try this place out.

F7DaVrxs_grQ6AkkyUhHoA.text: I've been going here on and off for years. The food is consistent. The service is hit or miss. Ither than the older grandmother, you seldom get a smile or a waiter checking on the tables after food is delivered. You probably will get your appetizer at the same time as your pho. Deal with it. The pho, spring rolls, egg rolls and more are pretty good though. Will I be back? Yes. Do I expect attentive service? No. Are the prices fair? Yes.

f0Tk49Pf5TLu250FEpsISA.text: This was my first place to pop my pho cherry and will be my last because it is an all-around pleasure to eat at when I get that perpetual itch for Asian cuisine.  What I love the most is the atmosphere. It may look tacky and strange outside once being a diner, but inside is a gorgeous purple interior with eastern paintings to emphasize its cultural integrity.   I love their seafood pho here, it's pretty much what I get every time. Other places has added their own unique assortment of the seafood ingredient part but I've always found Lemongrass to be way simpler and always cooked to perfection in the type of fish they put in there, and they hold the boiled eggs thankfully.  I love love love springs rolls! While theirs is a bit on the small side, they give you three that are cut in half which seem to last much longer than rival pho restaurants who only serve two huge ones intact. Because for such a tasty appetizer to cost around $5, it better feel like it never ends!   Their peanut sauce for the spring rolls is more on the watery side, but they make up for it in so many other ways. Not only is their Jasmine Tea DIVINE, but it's complementary with your meal! I'm somewhat of an iced tea connoisseur and their tea is like liquid candy crack to me.  On top of it all, their staff is very friendly and patient, making the overall experience relaxed and fulfilling. Emphasis on filling.   And so relaxed that even though the cashier woman checking me out had to charge my card twice because she undercharged it the first time, it was absolutely no big deal. Though I must say my face got a little Kermit when she suddenly hissed "Shit!" after swiping my card the first time. But that definitely won't be the last time my card is swiped here because it's definitely my new regular spot!

My husband, my daughter & I go there once a week. You would think they would recognize us ordering same things. We've been going here for years. It's the closest to our house. I'm at the point I want to find a new place but afraid the foods going to be terrible. Some how they must have changed owners or something because people use to be very friendly that worked there.

LjIFtH1iya_SdgldSh810Q.text: So went here with some girlfriends. The service isn't super friendly. I Felt like we were bothering him. The food is amazing definitely my new favorite pace to go for pho. The prices are so affordable too!!!Great food at a great price.

aUPcaYWszar_qNW8HdnZIQ.text: I'm surprised at why this place has such high ratings. Went here for the second time since my first experience was a good one except this time the experience was not good and I do not think I will return here or even refer any of my friends and family to go here.  Went with my boyfriend and ordered our usual egg rolls, beef with rice and BBQ pork chops with rice.  Appetizers were served first, boyfriend ordered the pork eggrolls and I had the vegetarian egg rolls. His egg rolls came out first whereas I had to wait 10 more minutes for mine, usually the veggie egg rolls would come out first at other vietnamese restaurants since pork takes longer to cook. Whatever no big deal. As I was half way done with my appetizer, the entree came out...I mean since my appetizer was late, i didnt get to even finish it before my entree came out....whatever, I stop eating the app and go on to my entree BBQ pork and rice. It was good as usual taste wise, as I'm eating my second bite I noticed there's a strand of white hair grilled on there.  Disgusted, I showed it to the server, which what he replied with " that's not a hair, that's part of the lemongrass"...with which i replied "I didn't order lemongrass pork I ordered BBQ pork"....he insisted that all the BBQ has lemongrass.  I am Asian and I can differentiate between a hair strand and a lemongrass strand.  He walks away without offering me any alternatives to the problem.  I lost my appetite and left it there.   My bf finishes and I ask for the check....the server asks if I want a box for the hair contaminated BBQ pork, and I said "no I'm not going to eat that since there's hair in it," he then gives me the dirtiest look then goes back to get the check.  He still charges me for the BBQ pork, at that time I was frustrated and upset because of the look he gave me. I asked for the manager.  He asks what's wrong n I said I need this off my bill since there was a hair in it, the server then reply to the manager with " I already told this lady its not a hair but she doesn't believe me and ask to speak to you" loudly in front of the whole restaurant.  Well just great now everyone in the restaurant knows how unsanitary the establishment is. ...first of all the server could have simply ask if I wanted something else or if they can send it back and have the cook remake it instead of saying, " its not a hair" then jus leave.  second, server did not have to loudly put the customer down saying its not his fault and that he already explained that's its not a hair, he could have talked to the manager first, back of the house, before the manager came over so that the manager is aware of the problem.  Even if it is not a hair, the potential that it is is fairly high.  A paying customers satisfaction should be top priority in the food establishment... In the end I left unhappy and will not be returning to this place.  Goodluck with your business treating customers that way and in ur way of solving problems.

J6skRPaKngGkiK-GYW7K_g.text: I'm a regular at Pho Saigon 8 but I really wanted Pho just somewhere different. We decided to try Lemongrass Cafe. I always see this place when I go to the asian grocery in the same shopping center. It looks like a diner (and being from NY that's an appeal in itself)  I had the spring rolls and the chicken pho. The Spring rolls had this little crunch to it. It seems like they put the fried  wrapper to the inside which gave it a pleasant surprise.The Pho broth was more flavorful. I'm really not a fan of too much cinnamon in my broth but if that's what you like you'll love this. To me you cant really have bad pho.. at least i haven't had any that was horrible... yet.  The place was pretty empty which kinda scared me a little but over all a good experience. I'd come here again to try other things.

Hy3FXqeZ2dBuqKpWNHNAAg.text: So what is it with places smelling so much like eggs?  This is the second place in town I have been, other than Bachi Burger, that made me want to hurl from the eggy smell.  My husband still claims that it is me that is too sensitive to eggs, and not the restaurant, so take my opinion with a grain of salt.  I am going to admit that I am not a huge huge fan of pho due to a flavor in the broth that I just have never gotten used to.  It's kind of like a tangy flavor that a vietnamese food newb like me cannot identify.  However, noodle soup sounded good today so I got some, and it was huge.  I could barely eat a quarter of it, with that tangy flavor I'm not crazy about preventing me from getting into the soup.  I also got a banh mi since I never had them before to try and eat later.  I ended up eating the whole thing instead of the soup, and I really liked it.  However, it was god awful small with very little meat, but nice veggies.    I would go here again for takeout (which is what I did this time) but that eggy smell will never have me go there to sit down and eat.  I would like to explore other places for more reasonably priced banh mi sandwiches as well.
